line=147 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,514.245,391.311,525.218 iscore=0.20                                                    :bear on a range of issues in our understanding of the nature of human language.
line=148 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,501.344,391.341,512.317 iscore=0.27                                                    :The  importance of the study of endangered languages for linguistic theory is widely
line=149 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,488.394,391.38,499.366 iscore=0.29                                                     :acknowledged,  as is the need to document linguistic structures that are in danger of
line=150 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,475.503,391.361,486.475 iscore=0.21                                                    :disappearing from view in the near future. Similarly, the importance of recording and
line=151 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,462.552,391.341,473.525 iscore=0.38                                                    :preserving the diverse range of human  languages for broader cultural and ethical
line=152 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,449.651,391.39,460.624 iscore=0.17                         :reasons is undeniable. Unfortunately, difﬁcult problems are posed by the desire to
line=153 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,436.701,391.341,447.673 iscore=0.21                                                    :satisfy the twin goals of comprehensive description on the one hand and of high-
line=154 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,423.8,391.38,436.8 iscore=0.14:lighting the theoretical signiﬁcance of speciﬁc areas of a language’s structure on the
line=155 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,410.849,391.351,421.822 iscore=0.14                                                    :other in a single work of manageable  size. As a result, linguists approaching the
line=156 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.44,397.959,391.42,410.959 iscore=0.14                        :documentation   of the world’s many  endangered  languages face something  of a
line=157 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.5,385.058,391.49,396.03 iscore=0.18                                                       :dilemma.  Many  researchers have collected important information on some areas of
line=158 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.5,372.107,391.44,383.08 iscore=0.19                                                       :the languages they work on without being in a position to produce a full grammar, or
line=159 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.5,359.206,391.38,370.179 iscore=0.12                                                      :perhaps in the presence of other literature that accomplishes that basic descriptive
line=160 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.5,346.256,391.45,357.229 iscore=0.25                          :goal adequately but without detailed attention to speciﬁc points of unusual structure.
line=161 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,333.365,391.529,344.338 iscore=0.17                                                   :Furthermore,  comprehensive  grammars   tend to be very  large and expensive to
line=162 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,320.414,223.898,331.387 iscore=0.09                                                   :produce, while having a limited audience.
line=163 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.508,307.524,391.49,318.496 iscore=0.10                                                    :   Oxford  Studies of Endangered   Languages  aims  to support  the publication
line=164 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,294.573,391.51,305.546 iscore=0.18                                                    :of theoretically informed work on endangered  languages, while striking a balance
line=165 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,281.672,391.48,292.645 iscore=0.14                                                    :among  these concerns. Books in the series do not attempt to provide full grammars,
line=166 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,268.722,391.44,279.694 iscore=0.29                                                    :but rather combine the documentation of portions of (one or perhaps more) endan-
line=167 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,255.821,391.47,266.794 iscore=0.15                                                    :gered languages with sophisticated analysis that establishes the theoretical interest
line=168 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,242.92,391.529,253.893 iscore=0.13                                                    :of the facts described. In the process, they contribute to the explication of the role
line=169 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,229.97,391.51,240.942 iscore=0.20                                                     :endangered  languages can play in enhancing our understanding of the diversity of
line=170 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,217.069,170.506,228.041 iscore=0.08                                                   :the human  language faculty.
line=171 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.508,204.118,391.47,215.091 iscore=0.00                                                    :   The  series intends to cover all areas of linguistic structure from phonetics
line=172 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,191.217,391.52,202.19 iscore=0.08                                                     :and  phonology through  morphology  and syntax to semantics and pragmatics. It is
line=173 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,178.267,391.51,189.24 iscore=0.23                                                     :open to work produced  in a variety of theoretical frameworks, the only requirements
line=174 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,165.376,391.46,176.349 iscore=0.23                                                    :being that the analysis be explicit and make testable claims within some framework
line=175 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,152.425,391.47,163.398 iscore=0.31                                                    :of assumptions  about the nature and organization of language, while being based
line=176 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,139.535,391.49,150.507 iscore=0.31                                                    :in substantial part on material whose publication serves the goal of enhancing the
line=177 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,126.644,274.349,137.616 iscore=0.15                                                   :documentation  of the language(s) under investigation.
line=178 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.508,113.693,391.549,124.666 iscore=0.22                       :   The present volume  addresses the incredibly complex inﬂectional morphology
line=179 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.559,100.802,391.49,111.775 iscore=0.27                                                    :of Kayardild, a rapidly disappearing aboriginal language of Australia, which has

doc_id=round-2013 page=13 block_id=13-2 bbox=57.35,113.693,391.42,538.118 label=b 191 223
line=191 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,527.146,391.42,538.118                                        :The  primary concern  of this book is the formalization of the inﬂectional system
line=192 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,514.245,391.341,525.218 iscore=0.20                                                       :of Kayardild and those parts of the grammar with which it interfaces. As I discovered
line=193 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.48,501.344,391.4,514.344 iscore=0.20                            :in the course of research, the most striking part of the ‘grammar with which  it
line=194 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.4,488.394,391.331,501.394 iscore=0.20                           :interfaces’ is an intricate and highly articulated syntactic structure which for the most
line=195 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,475.503,391.39,486.475 iscore=0.25                                                         :part is not evident in surface word order, yet is indispensible if one wishes to account
line=196 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,462.552,391.321,473.525 iscore=0.19:for the facts of inﬂection. Hence the title of the book, Kayardild Morphology and
line=197 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.4,449.651,391.361,460.624 iscore=0.21                            :Syntax. Questions of morphology  lead directly to matters of syntax, in addition to
line=198 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,436.701,322.473,447.673 iscore=0.23                                                        :some  rather complex matters of pure morphology and phonology.
line=199 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.359,423.8,391.341,434.773 iscore=0.08                                                        :   The aim is sound formal analysis of valid empirical generalizations. Thus, rather
line=200 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,410.849,391.321,421.822 iscore=0.21                            :than  developing a speciﬁc theory, I attempt to clarify exactly what it is about
line=201 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,397.959,391.331,408.931 iscore=0.29                                                       :Kayardild that any theory must respond to. This involves establishing just what the
line=202 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,385.058,391.341,396.03 iscore=0.31                                                        :empirical generalizations are that require formalizing, and to that end the book
line=203 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,372.107,391.281,383.08 iscore=0.17                                                        :adds to the basic documentation  of Kayardild by presenting a substantial amount
line=204 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,359.206,391.351,370.179 iscore=0.20                                                       :of data which has not appeared before. The analysis itself has taken shape over the
line=205 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.39,346.256,391.261,358.123 iscore=0.33                                 :past seven  years. An earlier stage of its development was my  2009  Yale Ph.D
line=206 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.36,333.365,391.361,346.365 iscore=0.14                          :dissertation ‘Kayardild phonology, morphology  and  morphosyntax’. Here  I have
line=207 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.35,320.414,391.291,331.387 iscore=0.21                                                       :set the phonology  largely to one side and developed further the analysis of the
line=208 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.35,307.524,391.341,318.496 iscore=0.14                           :morphology,  especially the inﬂectional morphology, and its relationship to syntactic
line=209 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,294.573,391.361,305.546 iscore=0.15                                                        :structure. While much   remains the same  as in my   dissertation much has  also
line=210 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,281.672,391.351,292.645 iscore=0.15                            :progressed. Several analyses have been reﬁned and further consolidated. Counter-
line=211 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,268.722,391.311,279.694 iscore=0.17                                                        :arguments  to proposals in the literature have been strengthened where  I found
line=212 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,255.821,391.301,266.794 iscore=0.07                                                        :they  could be. In some  instances this has required  a treatment of aspects of
line=213 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,242.92,391.341,253.893 iscore=0.14                                                         :Kayardild syntax  which did not feature in the dissertation, such as clauses with
line=214 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,229.97,391.351,240.942 iscore=0.07                                                         :multiple verbal heads, and in some  cases it has been possible to identify new or
line=215 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,217.069,391.301,228.041 iscore=0.20                                                        :different data in my corpus in order to clarify certain empirical issues. One welcome
line=216 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,204.118,391.271,215.091 iscore=0.36                                                        :surprise was the emergence  of two additional, low-frequency adverbial embedded
line=217 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,191.217,391.311,202.19 iscore=0.25                             :VP  types in Kayardild. The speciﬁc syntactic properties of these suggested some
line=218 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,178.267,391.37,189.24 iscore=0.23                                                         :new  approaches to the question of where in the grammar certain observable upper
line=219 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,165.376,391.351,176.349 iscore=0.21                                                       :bounds  on syntactic complexity originate. I argue that they are not due to morpho-
line=220 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,152.425,242.594,163.398 iscore=0.07                                                       :logical limitations but are inherently syntactic.
line=221 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.349,139.535,391.321,150.507 iscore=0.09                                                      :   The book will assume familiarity with fundamental linguistic concepts and rigor-
line=222 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.39,126.644,391.37,137.616 iscore=0.14                            :ous approaches  to analysis, but not any speciﬁc formal theory. It will appeal to
line=223 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,113.693,391.37,124.666 iscore=0.21                                                        :professional linguists and advanced students who have an interest in morphological

doc_id=round-2013 page=14 block_id=14-1 bbox=332.1,621.417,391.577,632.943 label=t 224 224
line=224 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.5,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5 bbox=332.1,621.417,391.577,632.943:                                                                       Preface     xiii

doc_id=round-2013 page=14 block_id=14-2 bbox=57.55,540.063,391.501,602.718 label=b 225 229
line=225 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.481,602.718                                          :and syntactic typology, and formal theories thereof, as well as to those who would
line=226 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.491,589.768 iscore=0.14                              :simply like to hear more about the Kayardild language and its fascinating morph-
line=227 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,565.904,391.501,576.877 iscore=0.15  :ology and syntax. The ﬁnal chapter on morphological  realization will be relevant
line=228 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.55,552.954,391.491,565.954 iscore=0.17:to phonologists concerned  with the morphology–phonology    interface and with
line=229 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.57,540.063,349.717,551.036 iscore=0.11                             :correspondence theory within constraint-based grammar more generally.

line=287 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,315.904,391.531,326.877 iscore=0.07                                                   :afternoon of visiting traditional sites. This tranquil bank of the lake was a favourite
line=288 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.6,303.013,391.531,316.014 iscore=0.38:of May’s, and a great place for gathering lily roots. May was born around 1929 at
line=289 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,290.063,391.441,301.036 iscore=0.19                                                  :Thundiyi  in northern Bentinck Island, and married  Darwin  Moodoonuthi   after
line=290 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,277.172,391.451,288.145 iscore=0.08                                                  :moving  to Mornington  Island as a young woman.  Though  she had  no biological
line=291 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,264.221,391.461,275.194 iscore=0.43                                                  :children of her own, she helped raise many other Kaiadilt children. May became deaf
line=292 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,251.321,391.511,262.293 iscore=0.24                                                  :later in life but remained an active and proud story teller to the end. She passed away

line=410 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-8.8 bbox=57.493,443.424,195.612,454.471 iscore=0.67                                                       :μladen            morphomic laden
line=411 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-8.8 bbox=57.484,428.495,221.589,439.542 iscore=0.75                                                       :μlloc             morphomic long locative

doc_id=round-2013 page=22 block_id=22-1 bbox=93.4,563.391,102.923,585.338 label=tt 434 434
line=434 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.4,563.391,102.923,585.338:    1

doc_id=round-2013 page=22 block_id=22-2 bbox=93.4,511.683,194.768,533.63 label=tb 435 435
line=435 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.4,511.683,194.768,533.63:    Introduction

doc_id=round-2013 page=22 block_id=22-3 bbox=57.332,74.984,391.54,473.518 label=b 436 466
line=436 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,462.546,391.521,473.518                                                                      :Kayardild possesses one of the most exuberant systems of morphological concord,
line=437 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHKOP+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I+fb-9.5 bbox=57.6,449.655,391.501,461.731 iscore=0.23:and  Sufﬁxaufnahme,  yet attested. In part, this has come about historically as the
line=438 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,436.704,391.481,447.677 iscore=0.15                                                         :result of a major refunctionalization of the inherited proto-Tangkic morphological
line=439 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,423.813,391.471,434.786 iscore=0.23                             :inventory. Sufﬁxes which once marked  case now  attach to nominal and to verbal
line=440 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,410.863,391.54,421.836 iscore=0.08                                                          :stems to mark  case, two distinct systems of tense, and clausal complementization.
line=441 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,397.962,391.491,408.935 iscore=0.25                             :Sufﬁxes  which once  served solely as derivational nominalizers now  also mark
line=442 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,385.071,391.491,396.044 iscore=0.09                             :tense, and sufﬁxes which  once  functioned as derivational verbalizers now also
line=443 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,372.121,391.531,383.093 iscore=0.42                                                         :mark  case and subordinate clause tense. As a consequence, the synchronic grammar
line=444 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,359.23,391.54,370.202 iscore=0.25                                                           :of Kayardild is dominated by individual forms associated with multiple functions
line=445 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,346.279,391.491,357.252 iscore=0.27                             :across both  the derivational and inﬂectional components   of the morphology.
line=446 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,333.378,391.471,344.351 iscore=0.14                                                         :Explaining how  such similarities of form relate to a diversity of functions, and how
line=447 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,320.428,391.471,331.401 iscore=0.20                                                         :those in turn interlock with the intricacies of Kayardild syntax, is the task taken up
line=448 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,307.537,391.441,318.51 iscore=0.27                                                          :in this book. The challenge is substantial, but the reward is an illuminating insight
line=449 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,294.587,254.72,305.559 iscore=0.14                                                          :into an unusual and fascinating linguistic system.
line=450 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.519,281.696,391.491,292.668 iscore=0.17                                                        :   The approach  taken is one of formal analysis trained upon a comprehensive
line=451 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.56,268.795,391.391,279.767 iscore=0.23                             :empirical data set. The focus is not on fragments of the inﬂectional morphology
line=452 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.511,255.844,391.391,268.845 iscore=0.08                           :but on the entire system, including those aspects of Kayardild’s syntax and phon-
line=453 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.471,242.953,391.381,253.926 iscore=0.14                                                        :ology with which  it interfaces. In addition to formal analysis the book presents a
line=454 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.471,230.003,391.332,241.055 iscore=0.14  :signiﬁcant amount  of new primary data. The theoretical outlook is realizational in
line=455 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.371,217.112,391.252,228.979 iscore=0.14                                  :the sense of Stump  (2001:1). As such I assume that information passes from the
line=456 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.332,204.161,391.242,215.134 iscore=0.14                            :syntactic/semantic component of the grammar to the inﬂectional morphology, where
line=457 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,191.261,391.332,202.233 iscore=0.12                                                        :it is realized as the underlying phonological form of a word. As we will see, the classic,
line=458 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,178.31,391.242,189.283 iscore=0.24                                                         :structuralist notion of the morpheme as a minimal unit simultaneously of meaning
line=459 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,165.409,391.312,176.382 iscore=0.17                                                        :and  sound  is explicitly rejected as unsuitable for capturing the complexities of
line=460 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,152.459,391.212,163.431 iscore=0.17                                                        :Kayardild morphology.  In  this regard the present work continues and  expands
line=461 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,139.568,391.212,150.541 iscore=0.29                                                        :upon  a rich line of progress in morphological theory over the past several decades
line=462 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.381,126.677,391.252,139.677 iscore=0.14     :encompassing  Matthews’  (1974) seminal critique of classical morphemic theory,
line=463 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.411,113.727,391.302,125.594 iscore=0.22                                  :feeding into A-morphous    morphology  (Anderson   1992), Network  Morphology
line=464 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.342,100.826,391.212,112.693 iscore=0.18                                  :(Corbett and Frazer 1993), Distributed Morphology (Halle and Marantz 1993, 1994),
line=465 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.352,87.875,391.203,99.742 iscore=0.18                                    :Lexeme-morpheme    Base Morphology  (Beard 1995) and Paradigm Function Morph-
line=466 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.381,74.984,391.312,86.851 iscore=0.08        :ology (Stump  2001). Despite the strong afﬁnities of the present volume with these

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,139.248,633.882 label=tttt 467 467
line=467 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,139.248,633.882:2      Introduction

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-2 bbox=57.42,501.311,391.4,602.718 label=tttb 468 475
line=468 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.291,602.718                                        :theories, a familiarity with them will not be assumed. All of the requisite machinery
line=469 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,578.795,391.361,589.768 iscore=0.14:for analysing the inﬂectional system of Kayardild will be introduced explicitly over
line=470 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,565.904,391.341,576.877 iscore=0.28:the course of the book. The central aim here is not to ﬁt Kayardild data into any given
line=471 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,552.954,391.351,563.926 iscore=0.22                            :theory or to test a theory against the data, but to formulate an analysis which does
line=472 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,540.063,391.321,551.036 iscore=0.25                            :justice to the complex empirical facts of the language. Many morphologists will not
line=473 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,527.112,391.38,538.085 iscore=0.08 :be surprised, however, to see that Kayardild provides conﬁrmation  for the most
line=474 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,514.212,391.4,525.184 iscore=0.50                              :fundamental  developments  in recent scholarship as well as interesting and new lines
line=475 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,501.311,101.102,512.283 iscore=0.08                            :of support.

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-3 bbox=57.43,468.778,296.076,481.741 label=ttbt 476 476
line=476 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,468.778,296.076,481.741:1.1 The Kayardild language, its speakers, and sources

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-4 bbox=57.341,255.795,391.43,460.618 label=ttbb 477 492
line=477 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,449.646,391.361,460.618                                                                                                                     :Kayardild  is a member  of the non Pama-Nyungan,    Tangkic  family of languages,
line=478 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,436.695,391.38,447.668 iscore=0.08                                                                                                          :spoken  traditionally by the Kaiadilt people of the Southern Wellesley Islands located
line=479 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,423.794,391.37,434.767 iscore=0.12                                                                                                          :at the southern end of the Gulf of Carpentaria, off the north coast of Australia. At the
line=480 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,410.844,391.4,421.816 iscore=0.29                                                                                                           :time of writing Kayardild is spoken in its traditional form by just one speaker, aged in
line=481 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,397.953,391.38,408.926 iscore=0.25                                                                                                          :her mid-eighties. A cohort of younger speakers of around sixty years of age speak a
line=482 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,385.062,391.321,396.035 iscore=0.13                                                                                                         :variety of Kayardild which is similar to the traditional language but which departs from
line=483 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,372.112,391.39,383.084 iscore=0.21                                                                                                          :it in various respects. For an extended introduction to the linguistic situation in recent
line=484 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.43,359.221,391.4,372.221 iscore=0.13                                                        :times, see Evans (1995a:8–50). The object of study here will be the traditional variety of
line=485 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.42,346.27,391.43,357.322 iscore=0.33                                                                                 :Kayardild. Where  necessary the speakers of this variety will be referred to as senior
line=486 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.42,333.379,391.321,344.431 iscore=0.07                                                                               :speakers. Members   of the younger cohort will be referred to as younger speakers.
line=487 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,320.429,391.331,331.401 iscore=0.23                                                                                                         :Members   of both sets of speakers self-identify, and identify one another, consistently.
line=488 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.349,307.538,391.341,318.511 iscore=0.09                                                                            :   Genealogically speaking Kayardild is a Southern Tangkic language, which ﬁnds its
line=489 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.36,294.587,391.321,306.455 iscore=0.06                                                                                   :place within the Tangkic family as shown in Figure 1.1. It is the last of the Tangkic
line=490 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.341,281.687,168.896,292.659 iscore=0.06                                                                                                        :languages still to be spoken.
line=491 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.299,268.746,391.343,281.796 iscore=0.00:   The locus classicus of Kayardild is Evans’ (1995a) A Grammar  of Kayardild,1 a
line=492 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.423,255.795,391.353,268.795 iscore=0.00                                                     :revised version of Evans’  1985 Ph.D. dissertation from  the Australian National

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-5 bbox=167.7,220.409,196.056,232.522 label=tbtt 493 493
line=493 fonts=AGHLDA+MinionPro-Regular-12.1 bbox=167.7,220.409,196.056,232.522:                           Tangkic

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-8 bbox=57.43,112.001,348.52,139.822 label=tbb 496 497
line=496 fonts=AGHLDA+MinionPro-Regular-12.1 bbox=106.5,127.709,348.52,139.822                                                       :             Lardil         Yukulta   Nguburindi     Yangkaal      Kayardild
line=497 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-6.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-8.4 bbox=57.43,112.001,270.638,122.681 iscore=0.11:FIGURE 1.1 The Tangkic language family, after Evans (1995a)

doc_id=round-2013 page=23 block_id=23-9 bbox=114.0,75.397,334.847,85.489 label=b 498 498
line=498 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-5.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.5 bbox=114.0,75.397,334.847,85.489:                1 Reviews have been published as Dixon (1998) and Majewicz (1999).

doc_id=round-2013 page=24 block_id=24-1 bbox=250.6,621.417,391.644,633.987 label=tt 499 499
line=499 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.9 bbox=250.6,621.417,391.644,633.987:                                            1.1 The Kayardild language     3

doc_id=round-2013 page=24 block_id=24-2 bbox=57.365,178.263,391.699,602.718 label=tb 500 532
line=500 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.461,602.718                                                                                            :University. Primarily through this source Kayardild has become known as a language
line=501 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.521,589.768 iscore=0.27                                                    :with one of the most exuberant systems of inﬂectional concord in the world, a system
line=502 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.689,565.904,391.59,577.771 iscore=0.20                                                         :which  will be of considerable interest here. In addition to Evans (1995a), this book
line=503 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.719,552.954,254.661,563.926 iscore=0.14                                                                              :takes as its empirical basis three primary sources.
line=504 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.678,540.063,391.61,551.036 iscore=0.07                                                   :   The ﬁrst is a set of recordings produced on ﬁeld trips made during my doctoral
line=505 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.779,527.112,391.699,538.085 iscore=0.27                                                                              :studies. Three seasons were spent working with speakers who at the time were the last
line=506 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.779,514.212,391.65,525.184 iscore=0.27                                                                               :four in command   of the traditional variety of Kayardild, together with the younger
line=507 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.779,501.311,391.65,512.283 iscore=0.15                                                                               :speakers mentioned  above. Visits to Bentinck and Mornington Islands took place
line=508 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.779,488.346,391.544,500.911 iscore=0.20                               :over two months  in 2005, four months in 2006, and three months in 2007.2 During
line=509 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.574,475.455,391.504,486.427 iscore=0.19                                                  :the seasons in the ﬁeld it was not possible to work with senior speakers of Kayardild
line=510 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.574,462.504,391.445,475.504 iscore=0.19                                                 :in a manner  which  could be characterized as ‘elicitation’. Attempts at collecting
line=511 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,449.613,391.415,460.586 iscore=0.23                                                                              :citation forms of words, for example, proved to be frustrating to elderly consultants
line=512 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,436.663,391.425,447.636 iscore=0.23                                                                              :and were discontinued. The emphasis was placed instead on the recording of stories
line=513 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,423.772,391.395,434.745 iscore=0.23                                                                              :and accounts of traditional knowledge which were offered generously and delivered
line=514 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,410.821,391.335,421.794 iscore=0.25                                                                              :as spontaneous speech. Translations of these texts were prepared with the assistance
line=515 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,397.921,391.385,408.893 iscore=0.21                                                                              :of the younger cohort of speakers, with whom lexical elicitation was also carried out.
line=516 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.504,385.02,391.435,395.992 iscore=0.14                                                   :An  early ﬁnding was that the morphology and phonology of the variety of Kayardild
line=517 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,372.069,391.375,383.042 iscore=0.07                                                                              :spoken  by the younger cohort does not always match that of senior speakers, and
line=518 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.504,359.178,391.316,372.179 iscore=0.21                                                 :accordingly younger speakers’ forms have not been taken as the basis of description
line=519 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.504,346.228,159.091,357.201 iscore=0.15                                                                              :and analysis in this book.
line=520 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.463,333.327,391.395,344.3 iscore=0.08                                                    :   Three other signiﬁcant sets of recordings of Kayardild exist. The earliest was
line=521 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.514,320.377,391.395,332.244 iscore=0.14                                                        :produced  by Stephen Wurm   over the course of two months in 1960 in conjunction
line=522 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.445,307.476,391.306,319.343 iscore=0.14                                                        :with Kayardild speaker Alison Dundaman   (Wurm   1960). In conjunction with the
line=523 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.415,294.525,391.316,305.498 iscore=0.15                                                  :preparation of my dissertation these recordings were transcribed in full for the ﬁrst
line=524 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.365,281.634,81.19,294.211 iscore=0.08                                                       :time.3
line=525 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.55,268.746,391.532,279.718 iscore=0.00                                                   :   Nick Evans has generously made  available his complete set of ﬁeld recordings
line=526 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.661,255.845,391.532,267.712 iscore=0.20                                                        :made  by between 1984 and the present. These were transcribed to a lesser extent, and
line=527 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.661,242.954,157.57,255.511 iscore=0.07                                                      :also feature in the book.4
line=528 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.55,229.946,391.492,240.918 iscore=0.00                                                                               :   Anthropologist Normal B. Tindale collected two sets of recordings of Kayardild in
line=529 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.591,217.055,391.482,228.922 iscore=0.12                                                        :1960 and 1963 which are now housed at the South Australia Museum. I have had the
line=530 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.591,204.104,375.56,215.077 iscore=0.38                                                                               :opportunity to listen to these but for logistical reasons they do not feature here.
line=531 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.55,191.213,391.482,204.214 iscore=0.08:   Other secondary sources include Tindale’s ﬁeld journals (Tindale 1960, 1963), ﬁeld

doc_id=round-2013 page=24 block_id=24-3 bbox=57.581,75.397,391.563,142.189 label=b 533 539

line=534 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.589,122.611,391.563,131.389 iscore=0.12                                                              :Rausing Endangered  Languages  Project. Transcriptions of audio and video recordings produced during

doc_id=round-2013 page=25 block_id=25-3 bbox=57.43,546.378,218.779,559.341 label=bt 543 543
line=543 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,546.378,218.779,559.341:1.2 Novel contributions of the book

doc_id=round-2013 page=25 block_id=25-4 bbox=57.382,74.989,391.46,538.118 label=bb 544 579
line=544 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,527.146,391.361,538.118                                                                                          :This book makes several new contributions. An investigation of the division of words
line=545 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.43,514.195,391.361,527.195 iscore=0.38                                                 :into component  morphs  leads to a pivotal reanalysis of ‘thematic’ elements which
line=546 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,501.304,391.331,512.277 iscore=0.25                                                   :appear at the boundary between  verbal stems and their inﬂections. Evidence from
line=547 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.45,488.354,391.351,499.326 iscore=0.08                                                                              :both the phonology  and  morphology  support a revision of the analysis in Evans
line=548 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.45,475.463,391.42,487.33 iscore=0.38                              :(1995a) which shifts the thematic element out of the sufﬁx and into the base to which
line=549 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.48,462.512,391.46,473.485 iscore=0.19                                                   :the sufﬁx attaches. One consequence of this is the loss of one signiﬁcant motivation
line=550 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.51,449.612,391.42,460.584 iscore=0.21                                                   :for an analysis of Kayardild according to which it possesses inﬂectional sufﬁxes that
line=551 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.46,436.661,360.54,448.528 iscore=0.15                                                         :alter the word class of their base (Evans 1995a; Evans and Nordlinger 2004).
line=552 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.429,423.76,391.43,434.733 iscore=0.17                                                   :   In the domain of Kayardild syntax and inﬂectional morphology, a substantial body
line=553 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.44,410.81,391.44,421.782 iscore=0.20                                                    :of new empirical evidence is presented. With respect to syntax per se, the existence of
line=554 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,397.919,391.4,408.891 iscore=0.20                                                                                :focus DPs (descending diachronically from erstwhile ergative DPs) is a novel discov-
line=555 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,385.028,391.41,396.001 iscore=0.22                                                                               :ery, as is the clitic status of several particles, which align at the left and right edges of
line=556 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,372.077,391.351,383.05 iscore=0.22                                                   :clauses and DPs, and which fail to inﬂect. The DP is accorded a somewhat modiﬁed
line=557 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.44,359.177,391.38,371.044 iscore=0.27                                                         :analysis relative to the NP of Evans (1995a), and a consideration of DP juxtaposition
line=558 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.41,346.226,391.38,359.226 iscore=0.27                                                  :leads to the rejection of an analysis according to which DPs are sometimes ‘split’ and
line=559 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.45,333.335,115.464,344.308 iscore=0.07                                                                              :discontinuous.
line=560 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.409,320.385,391.43,331.357 iscore=0.00                                                  :   An extended study of inﬂection reveals an intricate structure to Kayardild clauses
line=561 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.46,307.494,391.37,318.466 iscore=0.21                                                                               :which  is manifested not in surface word order, but in the constituents whose words
line=562 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.46,294.543,391.39,305.516 iscore=0.29                                                   :inﬂect for certain features. This line of research continues and expands upon the
line=563 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.46,281.642,391.38,294.643 iscore=0.23:ﬁndings  in Evans  (1995a) and motivates a signiﬁcant reanalysis. Evans’ (1995a)
line=564 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,268.752,391.4,281.026 iscore=0.17                                                            :contrast between associating  case and modal  case  is dissolved, based partly on
line=565 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,255.801,391.351,268.076 iscore=0.23                              :the ﬁnding of a homologous  contrast that exists within the modal case category
line=566 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.41,242.91,391.44,253.883 iscore=0.23                                                    :itself, and partly upon non-trivial simpliﬁcations which result when the two categor-
line=567 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.5,229.96,391.46,240.932 iscore=0.21                                                     :ies are merged. In the reanalysed system Kayardild words inﬂect, in addition to the
line=568 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.49,217.059,391.44,229.333 iscore=0.14                                                           :typologically common  features of case and number, for two tense/aspect/mood
line=569 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.49,204.108,391.43,216.383 iscore=0.09                                                           :(tam) features, a negation feature and two features associated with complementized
line=570 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.45,191.207,391.313,203.482 iscore=0.09                                                          :clauses, complementization    and sejunct.  Other departures from  the analysis
line=571 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.392,178.295,391.323,190.57 iscore=0.09                                    :of Evans  (1995a) include the recasting of inﬂectional nominalization    as the
line=572 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.382,165.404,391.333,177.679 iscore=0.23                                                         :realization of a tam feature value, and the treatment of adnominal   case  and
line=573 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.402,152.454,391.373,164.728 iscore=0.15                                                         :relational  case as the same feature. Arguments are advanced for the existence of
line=574 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.402,139.563,391.323,150.536 iscore=0.14                                                                             :DPs  embedded  within matrix DPs whose NP lacks an N head. These structures, once
line=575 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.402,126.672,391.323,137.645 iscore=0.21                                                                             :recognized and integrated into the account of DP juxtaposition, enable the formula-
line=576 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.402,113.721,391.243,124.694 iscore=0.15                                                 :tion of a coherent and relatively simple analysis of the syntactically and inﬂectionally
line=577 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.392,100.831,391.333,111.803 iscore=0.07                                                 :most complex  phenomena  in the language, some of which are identiﬁed here for the
line=578 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.382,87.88,391.313,98.853 iscore=0.29                                                    :ﬁrst time. With respect to recursive syntactic structures, a claim that Kayardild
line=579 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.382,74.989,391.293,85.962 iscore=0.36                                                                               :syntax is constrained by its morphology will be disputed in favour of evidence for

doc_id=round-2013 page=26 block_id=26-1 bbox=243.7,621.417,391.624,633.987 label=ttt 580 580
line=580 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.9 bbox=243.7,621.417,391.624,633.987:                                          1.3 Structure of the grammar     5

doc_id=round-2013 page=26 block_id=26-2 bbox=57.6,540.063,391.56,602.718 label=ttb 581 585
line=581 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.431,602.718                                      :purely syntactic limits on syntactic complexity. At the heart of the entire analysis
line=582 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.531,589.847 iscore=0.27:will lie a general structure of the grammar in which a morphomic level of represen-
line=583 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.66,565.904,391.56,577.771 iscore=0.20    :tation (Aronoff 1994) plays a crucial, mediating role between morphosyntactic input
line=584 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.66,552.954,391.56,563.926 iscore=0.08                          :representations and phonological outputs. Since the structure of the grammar is a
line=585 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.66,540.063,342.233,551.036 iscore=0.14                         :matter of some complexity, a preview of what is to come will be useful.

doc_id=round-2013 page=26 block_id=26-3 bbox=57.6,507.578,189.689,520.541 label=tbtt 586 586
line=586 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,507.578,189.689,520.541:1.3 Structure of the grammar

doc_id=round-2013 page=26 block_id=26-4 bbox=57.6,410.821,391.531,499.318 label=tbtb 587 593
line=587 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,488.346,391.491,499.318                                  :Through  the course of the book an analysis of Kayardild will be developed in which
line=588 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,475.455,391.481,486.427 iscore=0.27                      :several distinct levels of representation play a crucial role. Levels are posited in order
line=589 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,462.504,391.461,473.477 iscore=0.14                      :to capture generalizations which otherwise would go systematically unexpressed. The
line=590 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,449.613,391.471,460.586 iscore=0.27                      :existence of each  is supported by  argumentation  at appropriate junctures and
line=591 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,436.663,391.481,447.636 iscore=0.31                      :motivated  in terms of empirical facts of the language. The levels of representation
line=592 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,423.772,391.531,435.639 iscore=0.20:which  will feature in the analysis are summarized in Table 1.1 and introduced in more
line=593 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.68,410.821,107.752,421.794 iscore=0.07                     :detail below.

doc_id=round-2013 page=26 block_id=26-5 bbox=57.67,318.409,391.61,397.96 label=tbb 594 599
line=594 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.68,385.994,296.991,397.96                :1.3.1 From syntax and semantics to morphosyntactic features
line=595 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.68,370.101,391.521,381.074 iscore=0.14                           :When   a Kayardild  word  appears in a given syntactic context and with a  given
line=596 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.68,357.201,391.61,368.173 iscore=0.14:semantic  force and discourse function  it takes an appropriately inﬂected form.
line=597 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.67,344.25,391.531,355.223 iscore=0.27                            :Thus  its morphological  structure, and consequently  its phonological structure,
line=598 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.67,331.359,391.6,342.332 iscore=0.23                             :will depend in a predictable way on its syntax, semantics, and discourse function.
line=599 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.67,318.409,391.57,329.381 iscore=0.23                            :By  the same token not every syntactic, semantic, or discourse distinction that can

doc_id=round-2013 page=26 block_id=26-13 bbox=167.142,89.702,391.634,256.624 label=bbbr 611 624
line=611 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.16,246.749,372.027,256.624                                         :                              For each sentence, all word order and related constituent
line=612 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.142,235.836,377.984,245.712 iscore=0.22                            :                              structure, all semantic and discourse relationships between
line=613 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.142,224.861,263.211,234.736 iscore=0.29                            :                              syntactically realized units.
line=614 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.16,210.951,391.59,220.827 iscore=0.09                              :                              For each syntactic word, a partially ordered set of feature value
line=615 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-6.4 bbox=167.142,200.038,383.79,209.914 iscore=0.08 :                              pairs, selected from a set of seven features, each with a ﬁnite
line=616 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.142,189.126,297.81,199.001 iscore=0.25                             :                              range of permissible, discrete values.
line=617 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.16,175.216,371.329,185.091 iscore=0.20                             :                              For each syntactic word, a fully ordered set of categories,
line=618 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-6.4 bbox=167.142,164.241,292.488,174.116 iscore=0.30:                              selected from a large, but ﬁnite set.
line=619 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.169,150.331,391.634,160.206 iscore=0.09                            :                              For each syntactic word, a string of allomorph sets, where each
line=620 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.169,139.418,390.659,149.293 iscore=0.09                            :                              allomorph  set contains one or more morphs  (i.e. phonological
line=621 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.169,128.505,195.918,138.381 iscore=0.11                            :                              strings).
line=622 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-6.4 bbox=167.195,114.587,379.755,124.462 iscore=0.12:                              For each syntactic word, a prosodiﬁed, phonological string,
line=623 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9 bbox=167.195,103.611,273.802,113.487 iscore=0.12                            :                              with morphological  structure.
line=624 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-6.4 bbox=167.222,89.702,360.729,99.577 iscore=0.14  :                              For each utterance, a prosodiﬁed, phonological string.

doc_id=round-2013 page=27 block_id=27-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,139.248,633.882 label=t 625 625
line=625 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,139.248,633.882:6      Introduction

doc_id=round-2013 page=27 block_id=27-2 bbox=57.331,87.884,391.4,602.718 label=b 626 663
line=626 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.38,602.718                                                                             :be made  in the grammar   of Kayardild will be reﬂected in the morphology of an
line=627 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.42,578.795,391.341,589.847 iscore=0.20                                                                  :individual word. The role of morphosyntactic features is to represent precisely the
line=628 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.42,565.904,391.361,578.904 iscore=0.23                                                               :information required by the morphology—no   more and no less—in order for a word
line=629 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,552.954,391.361,563.926 iscore=0.14                                                                :to be properly inﬂected. The appeal to a notion of morphosyntactic features as the
line=630 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,540.063,391.4,551.036 iscore=0.07                                                                                              :distillation of morphologically relevant information taken from the domains   of
line=631 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,527.112,391.39,538.085 iscore=0.17                                                                                             :syntax, semantics, and discourse, follows something of a consensus position in recent
line=632 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,514.212,391.4,525.184 iscore=0.25                                                                                              :formal  morphological theory and  of course has much   deeper roots in cognitive
line=633 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,501.311,391.341,512.283 iscore=0.17                                                                                            :science generally. Although individual schools of thought differ as to how such
line=634 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,488.36,391.331,499.333 iscore=0.21                                                                                             :features are derived, how they can be manipulated, and what they are named, features
line=635 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.43,475.459,391.351,487.327 iscore=0.14                                                                      :of this nature can be found in Matthews (1974), Anderson (1992), Corbett and Frazer
line=636 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,462.509,391.361,474.376 iscore=0.21              :(1993), Aronoff (1994), Stump (2001), inter alia. There are two signiﬁcant conse-
line=637 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,449.608,239.731,460.581 iscore=0.17                                                                                            :quences of this model that can be mentioned.
line=638 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.339,436.658,391.341,447.63 iscore=0.13                                                                                            :   First, if the syntax or semantics of Kayardild treats categories A and B as distinct
line=639 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,423.767,391.291,434.739 iscore=0.20                                                                                            :but that distinction has no morphological  corollary, then A and  B will not be
line=640 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,410.816,391.331,421.789 iscore=0.14                                                                                            :featurally distinct in the morphosyntactic representation. The morphosyntactic
line=641 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,397.925,391.311,408.898 iscore=0.11                                                                :representation therefore deliberately conﬂates distinctions which are pertinent else-
line=642 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,385.024,391.331,395.997 iscore=0.14                                                                                            :where in the grammar  but which play no part in the determination of morphological
line=643 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,372.074,391.331,383.047 iscore=0.24                                                                                            :form. This is not a failure of the analysis to be sensitive to categories elsewhere in the
line=644 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,359.183,391.331,370.156 iscore=0.24                                                                                            :system, but rather a desirable trait that makes it possible to express explicitly when
line=645 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,346.232,391.321,357.205 iscore=0.14                                                                                            :and  where the morphology  is isomorphic with or anisomorphic  with other gram-
line=646 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,333.342,391.37,344.314 iscore=0.08                                                                                             :matical systems. Formalization of this kind will establish a foundation for subse-
line=647 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.38,320.391,391.301,333.391 iscore=0.17                                                               :quent, rigorous investigations into topics such as ‘mismatches’ between grammatical
line=648 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,307.49,343.196,318.463 iscore=0.36                                                                                             :subsystems, or the robustness of a formal theory in the face of the data.
line=649 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.349,294.54,391.311,305.512 iscore=0.31                                                                                            :   Secondly, from the assumption that the morphosyntactic representation is passed
line=650 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,281.639,391.361,292.612 iscore=0.33                                                                                            :to the morphology  by a prior, syntactic/semantic component of grammar, it follows
line=651 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,268.688,391.331,279.661 iscore=0.31                                                                                            :that if categories F and G are distinct in the morphosyntactic representation then
line=652 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,255.798,391.291,266.77 iscore=0.23                                                                                             :they must be distinguishable in the prior syntactic/semantic component. This mode
line=653 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.39,242.897,391.291,255.897 iscore=0.20                                         :of reasoning will be employed to its greatest effect in Chapters 5–8 where it proves
line=654 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.36,229.946,391.37,240.919 iscore=0.20                                                                                             :possible to reconstruct a highly articulated, non-surface syntactic structure in Kayar-
line=655 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.36,217.045,391.291,230.046 iscore=0.23                                                               :dild based inferentially on the distribution throughout the clause of aspects of words’
line=656 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.36,204.095,190.205,215.068 iscore=0.08                                                                                            :morphosyntactic  representations.
line=657 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=67.319,191.204,391.271,202.256 iscore=0.00                                                                 :   Morphosyntactic  features will be  formalized  here as  feature value  pairs.
line=658 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.341,178.253,391.211,191.254 iscore=0.00                                          :The  ‘instrumental’ value of the case feature, for example, is written as case:instru-
line=659 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.331,165.363,391.321,177.637 iscore=0.15                                                                       :mental, in the format feature:value. Each  word  is associated with zero or more
line=660 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.37,152.412,391.301,164.279 iscore=0.27                                                                      :such  feature values. In Chapter 9 it is argued that sets of those feature values
line=661 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJOA+AdvP4C4E74-17.2 bbox=57.44,113.66,391.38,150.484 iscore=0.33:mayhassociative{casein:associativesome}i. Chapterscases} >be{number4ordered–8 set :outpluralwithin}considerableirespectis not toequivalentonedetailanothertheto hnature{,numberso thatof:thepluralfor syntacticexample, case:
line=662 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.402,100.835,391.372,111.808 iscore=0.27                                                                                           :representations from which morphosyntactic features are derived; these are complex
line=663 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.402,87.884,191.569,98.857 iscore=0.30                                                                                             :and will not be summarized here.

doc_id=round-2013 page=28 block_id=28-2 bbox=57.52,510.76,391.531,603.212 label=tbtt 665 671
line=665 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.6,591.246,299.227,603.212                                   :1.3.2 From morphosyntactic features to morphomic categories
line=666 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,575.353,391.481,586.326 iscore=0.25                  :In a signiﬁcant contribution to the understanding of how  systems of inﬂectional
line=667 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.61,562.403,391.501,574.27 iscore=0.42                         :morphology   can  be organized in  natural languages, Aronoff (1994) presents a
line=668 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.62,549.502,391.531,560.475 iscore=0.09                                              :monograph-length   argument  that in the general case morphosyntactic features are
line=669 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.62,536.551,391.511,548.419 iscore=0.15                        :realized not directly as phonological forms as illustrated in (1.1a) but rather are
line=670 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.6,523.66,391.501,535.528 iscore=0.08:interpreted via sets of intermediate categories termed morphomes,   as in (1.1b)
