doc_id=round-2013 page=28 block_id=28-4 bbox=57.492,163.969,391.597,459.218 label=tbb 674 696
line=674 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,448.246,391.451,459.218                                                                                                    :The  existence of a morphomic   level of representation, which mediates between
line=675 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,435.295,391.501,446.268 iscore=0.09                                                                                        :morphosyntactic  representations and underlying phonological  forms, is strikingly
line=676 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,422.394,391.511,433.367 iscore=0.08                                                                                        :apparent in the organization of morphology and phonology in Kayardild. To gain an
line=677 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,409.444,391.491,422.444 iscore=0.29                               :insight into this aspect of the language’s organization, let us brieﬂy examine a single
line=678 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,396.543,195.374,407.516 iscore=0.14                                                                                       :morphomic   category of Kayardild.
line=679 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=67.569,383.592,391.511,395.867 iscore=0.00                                                                  :   In Kayardild, the morphosyntactic feature value case:oblique is eventually real-
line=680 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,370.702,391.55,381.674 iscore=0.19                                                            :ized, in terms of its underlying phonological form, by a sufﬁx /inta/. So too is the
line=681 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.699,357.746,391.442,370.311 iscore=0.31                                         :feature value tamt:hortative,5 and  the feature value tama:continuous,  and  the
line=682 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.502,344.855,391.412,357.129 iscore=0.25                                                                  :feature value +sej. A formal analysis of Kayardild in which these morphosyntactic
line=683 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.492,331.954,391.392,342.927 iscore=0.25                                                                                      :feature values were all realized directly as underlying phonological forms would fail
line=684 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.492,319.003,391.373,329.976 iscore=0.21                                                                                      :to capture the rather obvious point of commonality,  that they all have the same
line=685 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.492,306.113,391.422,317.085 iscore=0.21                                                                                      :underlying phonological  realization. To express this fact, the analysis here is that
line=686 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.492,293.162,391.343,304.135 iscore=0.12                                                                                      :each of the four feature values is realized at the morphomic level by the same element
line=687 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.492,280.246,391.498,293.246 iscore=0.12            :termed  the  morphomic   oblique  (μobl),6 and  that it is μobl—a    morphomic
line=688 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=57.647,267.295,391.528,280.295 iscore=0.09:category—which   is then  realized as the underlying  phonological sufﬁx  /in̪t̪a/.
line=689 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.607,254.404,391.538,265.377 iscore=0.17                                                                                      :Other  generalizations can also be expressed in terms of the morphomic  category
line=690 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.607,241.454,259.866,253.728 iscore=0.17                                                                  :μobl  though these need not concern us right now.
line=691 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.566,228.553,391.597,241.553 iscore=0.21                                                         :   One might object that the notion of a ‘morphomic oblique’ category as distinct from
line=692 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.567,215.662,391.558,226.635 iscore=0.14                                                                                      :morphosyntactic feature values is misplaced, and that its postulation follows only from
line=693 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.567,202.712,391.548,215.712 iscore=0.23                             :a poor deﬁnition of the latter—that is, why not distil the relevant syntactic/semantic/
line=694 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.587,189.811,391.577,202.085 iscore=0.15                                                                  :discourse information directly into this μobl category (and call it a morphosyntactic
line=695 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.567,176.86,391.468,187.833 iscore=0.21                                                           :feature) rather than distilling it ﬁrst into four distinct feature values and only thereafter
line=696 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.597,163.969,391.548,174.942 iscore=0.21                                                                                      :into one morphomic   category? The reason for maintaining the distinction between

doc_id=round-2013 page=28 block_id=28-5 bbox=57.597,75.395,391.674,123.289 label=b 697 701
line=697 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-5.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9 bbox=65.57,113.157,391.571,123.289                                         :   5 tamt is the thematic tense/aspect/modality   morphosyntactic feature and tama the athematic
line=698 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9 bbox=57.597,103.711,164.092,113.53 iscore=0.00                                                      :tense/aspect/modality   feature.
line=699 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-5.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-8.8 bbox=65.57,94.287,391.578,104.379 iscore=0.06                       :   6 As a convention, if a morphomic category realizes a value x of the morphosyntactic case feature then
line=700 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-8.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4 bbox=57.652,84.841,391.674,95.241 iscore=0.17:its label will be ‘the morphomic x (μx)’. For example the morphomic oblique (μobl) realizes case:oblique,
line=701 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.716,75.395,233.234,84.173 iscore=0.12                                                                           :as well as several other morphosyntactic feature values.

doc_id=round-2013 page=29 block_id=29-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,139.248,633.882 label=t 702 702
line=702 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,139.248,633.882:8      Introduction

doc_id=round-2013 page=29 block_id=29-2 bbox=57.42,436.687,391.539,602.718 label=btt 703 715
line=703 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.38,602.718                                        :morphosyntactic  feature values and morphomic categories again relates to the captur-
line=704 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,578.795,391.43,589.768 iscore=0.09:ing of signiﬁcant generalizations. Any attempt to coherently describe the patterns
line=705 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.42,565.904,391.539,578.179 iscore=0.33       :which  exist in the distribution of μobl tokens across the words in a sentence will
line=706 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.47,552.954,391.43,565.228 iscore=0.27        :only be successful if those tokens of μobl are related back to the morphosyntactic
line=707 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.45,540.063,391.42,552.338 iscore=0.21        :feature values that underlie them: case:oblique (realized as μobl) stands in paradig-
line=708 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.44,527.112,391.49,539.387 iscore=0.08        :matic opposition to other case values and shares their distributional properties; tamt:
line=709 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.46,514.212,391.434,526.486 iscore=0.17       :hortative (also realized as μobl) stands in paradigmatic opposition to other tamt
line=710 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.47,501.321,391.48,513.595 iscore=0.15        :values and shares theirs; and likewise for tama:continuous and +sej. Any attempt to
line=711 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.49,488.37,391.49,499.343 iscore=0.23 :conﬂate  morphosyntactic  features and morphomic   categories in the description of
line=712 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,475.479,391.48,486.452 iscore=0.15                            :Kayardild dramatically decreases the range of facts that can be accounted for coher-
line=713 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,462.529,391.37,473.501 iscore=0.15                            :ently and  diminishes the insightfulness of the analysis. The generalizations which
line=714 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,449.638,391.39,460.611 iscore=0.27                            :would  be lost add up not merely to incidental facts but to pervasive patterns which
line=715 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,436.687,279.408,447.66 iscore=0.07                            :are fundamental to the structure of the linguistic system.

doc_id=round-2013 page=29 block_id=29-3 bbox=57.48,343.261,391.48,422.803 label=btbtt 716 721
line=716 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.48,410.836,319.77,422.803                                    :1.3.3 From morphomic  categories to underlying phonological forms
line=717 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,394.944,391.43,405.916 iscore=0.07                                                :At  the morphomic   level a syntactic word is represented as an ordered  set of
line=718 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,382.053,391.41,393.025 iscore=0.07                                                :morphomic   categories. In the mapping from morphomic   structure to underlying
line=719 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,369.102,391.361,380.075 iscore=0.09                                               :phonological form, most morphomic   categories spell out into a single phonological
line=720 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.48,356.211,391.48,368.078 iscore=0.25:string which will be referred to as a morph, as in (1.2a). The linearized string of
line=721 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,343.261,343.574,354.233 iscore=0.19                                               :morphs  then constitutes the underlying phonological form of the word.

doc_id=round-2013 page=29 block_id=29-5 bbox=57.43,242.103,391.361,291.818 label=btbb 724 727
line=724 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,280.846,391.341,291.818                                  :In some cases morphomic  elements are realized as a set of allomorphs, from among

line=731 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,174.518,391.341,185.491 iscore=0.20                          :that the phonology has been studied in depth means that we can be conﬁdent that

line=734 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,135.726,391.361,146.699 iscore=0.13                                                      :means  that it is clear what information the morphology itself must pass on to the

line=736 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.43,109.875,391.43,120.927 iscore=0.23                             :here is that the morphology outputs underlying phonological forms which are yet to
line=737 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.5,96.974,391.5,107.947 iscore=0.23                              :be further subjected to phonological modiﬁcations. In order for the phonology of

doc_id=round-2013 page=30 block_id=30-2 bbox=57.511,410.846,391.511,602.718 label=ttbt 739 753
line=739 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.421,602.718                                                             :Kayardild to be sensitive to morphological structure in a manner which the empirical
line=740 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.461,589.768 iscore=0.21                     :facts demand, it sufﬁces for underlying forms to consist of ordered strings of morphs
line=741 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,565.904,391.511,576.877 iscore=0.29                                                 :(or in some instances allomorph sets) divided from each other by certain types of
line=742 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,552.954,317.008,563.926 iscore=0.14                                                 :phonological juncture. Further diacritic features are unnecessary.

line=746 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.511,501.321,391.391,512.293 iscore=0.31                                               :component  corresponds more  or less to the phonemic level of structuralist linguistics
line=747 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.511,488.37,391.451,500.237 iscore=0.08                          :and Basic Linguistic Theory (Dixon 1997; Dryer 2006), the surface representation of
line=748 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.56,475.479,391.391,487.346 iscore=0.17                          :early generative phonology (Chomsky  and  Halle 1968), the lexical level of Lexical
line=749 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.52,462.529,391.411,474.396 iscore=0.08                          :Phonology  (Kiparsky 1982a, 1982b; Mohanan  1982), and the representational level
line=750 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.54,449.638,391.451,462.638 iscore=0.09                   :which  in practice corresponds to the phonological ‘outputs’ of much contemporary
line=751 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,436.687,391.491,447.66 iscore=0.15                                                 :research in Optimality Theory. It also corresponds to what is represented by the

doc_id=round-2013 page=30 block_id=30-3 bbox=57.53,188.253,391.586,397.021 label=ttbb 754 769
line=754 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.6,385.054,181.331,397.021                                               :1.3.5 On the lack of morphemes
line=755 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,369.102,391.491,380.075 iscore=0.08                              :A signiﬁcant theoretical construct which is absent from the grammatical model just
line=756 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,356.211,391.461,367.184 iscore=0.15                                                          :outlined is the morpheme. In structuralist theory the morpheme is a Saussurean sign
line=757 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,343.261,391.501,354.233 iscore=0.08                                                          :indissolubly uniting a meaning (or function) with a phonological form, and is the
line=758 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,330.36,391.471,342.227 iscore=0.15         :fundamental  unit of morphological analysis (Bloomﬁeld  1933; Harris 1942; Nida
line=759 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,317.469,391.362,329.336 iscore=0.15                                    :1946). Although the morpheme  continues to hold this central role in Basic Linguistic
line=760 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,304.519,391.471,316.386 iscore=0.29                                    :Theory  (Dixon 1997; Dryer 2006), and although it is often still assumed in research
line=761 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.53,291.628,391.451,303.495 iscore=0.21                                    :within generative phonology (e.g. Kenstowicz 1994; Kager 1999) it has been absent
line=762 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,278.677,391.411,289.65 iscore=0.23                                                           :from many  of the theoretical approaches to formal morphology to have emerged over
line=763 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,265.776,391.441,276.749 iscore=0.15                                                          :the past two decades following compelling arguments for its abandonment due to
line=764 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.53,252.826,391.481,264.693 iscore=0.25                                    :Matthews  (1974) and elaborated by Anderson (1992), Aronoff (1994), Beard (1995),
line=765 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.62,239.925,391.586,252.511 iscore=0.18     :and  others.7 A signiﬁcant difference, therefore, between the analysis of Kayardild
line=766 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.646,226.995,391.546,239.995 iscore=0.14      :presented here and the analysis by Evans (1995a) is that Evans’ analysis is morphemic
line=767 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.636,214.094,391.576,227.095 iscore=0.14:whereas  the present analysis does not work in the same theoretic conﬁnes. Evans’
line=768 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.646,201.203,391.526,212.176 iscore=0.23                             :innovative and inﬂuential morphemic approach to some of the Kayardild data will be
line=769 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.646,188.253,147.027,200.12 iscore=0.08                                    :reviewed in Chapter 2.

doc_id=round-2013 page=31 block_id=31-2 bbox=57.42,372.084,391.569,602.718 label=tb 776 793
line=776 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.351,602.718              :machinery  developed here, nor do I attempt to apply it to fragments of inﬂectional
line=777 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.48,578.795,391.39,589.768 iscore=0.38                               :systems of other languages. This is by no means  to imply that such work is not
line=778 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.48,565.904,391.38,577.771 iscore=0.19         :needed, only that it lies beyond the scope of the present work. See Round (2011a)
line=779 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,552.954,391.331,563.926 iscore=0.07                              :for extensions of the analysis to derivational morphology in Kayardild, Round (in
line=780 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,540.063,391.4,551.036 iscore=0.15                                :prep a., in prep. b.) for a more techinical and theoretically comparative discussion
line=781 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.43,527.112,391.301,540.113 iscore=0.15 :of Kayardild’s morphomic  structures, and Round  (in prep c.) for its implications
line=782 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,514.212,391.37,525.184 iscore=0.33                               :for the theory of morphomes   and  morphological complexity  more  generally. In
line=783 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,501.311,391.351,512.283 iscore=0.17                              :terms  of extensions to other languages, some obvious  candidates are the other
line=784 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.42,488.36,391.42,500.227 iscore=0.17          :Tangkic  languages, especially Lardil (Hale 1973; Klokeid 1976; Round 2011b, 2011c)
line=785 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.48,475.459,391.39,487.327 iscore=0.18         :and  Yukulta (Keen  1972, 1983; Round 2011c), whose morphologies  possess many
line=786 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.49,462.509,391.42,473.482 iscore=0.09   :superﬁcial similarities and no doubt several deeper similarities to Kayardild; also
line=787 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.49,449.608,391.42,461.475 iscore=0.18         :the several Australian languages discussed by Blake (1993) which like Kayardild
line=788 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.46,436.658,391.46,447.63 iscore=0.18    :employ  etymologically related sufﬁxes for multiple and diverse inﬂectional functions.
line=789 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.539,423.767,391.569,436.767 iscore=0.15:The analysis here may also have implications for interpretations of Dench and Evans’
line=790 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.539,410.816,391.44,422.683 iscore=0.23        :(1988) seminal paper on case stacking and the various functions of multiple case
line=791 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,397.925,391.49,408.898 iscore=0.15                              :markers  in Australian languages. Round  (in prep  c.) offers some comparisons
line=792 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,385.034,391.46,396.007 iscore=0.33                              :between  the morphomes   of Kayardild and those of the more  intensively studied
line=793 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.529,372.084,197.063,383.951 iscore=0.17       :romance  languages (Maiden 2005).

doc_id=round-2013 page=31 block_id=31-3 bbox=57.43,339.678,178.819,352.641 label=btt 794 794
line=794 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,339.678,178.819,352.641:1.5 Notational conventions

doc_id=round-2013 page=31 block_id=31-4 bbox=57.43,171.806,391.46,331.418 label=btb 795 806
line=795 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,320.446,391.38,331.418                                                                                        :Some  notational conventions may  be mentioned  now. All phonological representa-
line=796 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.43,307.545,391.46,318.518 iscore=0.15                                                :tions are expressed in IPA characters. Morphomic categories appear in the format μx
line=797 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,294.594,391.46,306.869 iscore=0.31                                                        :(e.g. μobl), while morphosyntactic feature values are written in the format feature:
line=798 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,281.703,391.351,293.978 iscore=0.33                                                       :value (e.g. case:locative), and features as a whole are referred to in small capitals, for
line=799 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,268.803,391.37,281.077 iscore=0.13                                                        :example  case. Interlinear glosses may contain up to six lines, though typically will
line=800 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.44,255.852,266.666,267.719 iscore=0.23                                                     :contain fewer. A maximal  example is shown  in (1.3).
line=801 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.44,236.451,316.748,248.318 iscore=0.11                         :(1.3) a. dankiya       kunawunaya                 barjijarranth!
line=802 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=81.313,223.55,312.375,236.282 iscore=0.60                                              :      b.  ankia        kunaunaja                  pa cicaran̪ta̪
line=803 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=81.323,210.6,341.576,223.332 iscore=0.71                         :      c.  an+ki-a      kuna+kuna+ki-a             pa ci-c+ ara-in̪ta̪ -�
line=804 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHMEC+AdvTT6120e2aa+20-10.9 bbox=81.373,196.897,350.398,209.984 iscore=0.43:      d. this-μloc-t   ‹childNL-childNL›-μloc-t   ‹fall-j›-μcons-μobl-t

doc_id=round-2013 page=31 block_id=31-5 bbox=57.515,86.867,391.485,162.413 label=bb 807 812
line=807 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.515,151.441,391.466,162.413:The  ﬁrst line (a) contains an orthographic form. The remaining lines display (b) a
line=808 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.515,138.49,391.485,149.463 iscore=0.07                 :surface (lexical level) phonological representation, then (c) an underlying phono-
line=809 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.515,125.599,391.446,136.572 iscore=0.18                :logical representation with morphs separated by juncture symbols, (d) a morphomic
line=810 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.515,112.708,391.446,123.681 iscore=0.18                :representation, and  (e) a semantic  and  morphosyntactic   gloss. For sentential
line=811 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.515,99.758,391.475,110.731 iscore=0.20                 :examples, a free translation (f) is given in English and the source of the example
line=812 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.515,86.867,391.436,97.84 iscore=0.13                   :is indicated. Given the parlous state of the traditional Kayardild language, many free

line=816 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.626,565.945,391.537,576.918 iscore=0.14                                                                               :and in some cases by me; free translations from secondary sources are reproduced as
line=817 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.626,552.994,391.606,563.967 iscore=0.07                                                   :they were given. Examples from my own  ﬁeld recordings are identiﬁed, for example,

line=821 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.676,501.361,391.567,513.228 iscore=0.36                             :referring to the ﬁrst digitized section of the third tape recorded in 1984. Examples
line=822 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.676,488.411,391.606,501.411 iscore=0.14:taken from Evans’ Grammar   are identiﬁed, for example, as [E472.ex.11-27], referring
line=823 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.706,475.52,391.636,488.52 iscore=0.25                              :to page  472, examples (11-27). Examples from Stephen  Wurm’s  1960  corpus are

line=826 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.656,436.728,364.96,447.701 iscore=0.33                                                                                :is transcribed orthographically and can be retrieved with a text-based search.

doc_id=round-2013 page=32 block_id=32-4 bbox=57.501,139.542,391.521,396.913 label=tbbb 828 847
line=828 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,385.046,391.521,396.913                                         :The  book  is divided into ten further chapters plus two appendices. Chapter 2
line=829 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,372.095,391.481,383.068 iscore=0.23                                                   :provides a general introduction to Kayardild word structure, outlining the kinds of
line=830 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,359.194,391.511,370.167 iscore=0.25                                                   :morphs   of which  words are composed,   their formal shapes, and principles of
line=831 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,346.244,391.481,357.216 iscore=0.17                                                   :combination, and  presents reasons for the choice of grammatical model in which
line=832 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,333.343,391.461,344.316 iscore=0.08                                                   :morphomic   representations mediate between morphosyntactic representations and
line=833 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,320.392,391.511,332.26 iscore=0.18  :underlying phonological forms. Chapter 3 treats several speciﬁc details of Kayardild
line=834 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.58,307.502,391.481,318.474 iscore=0.13                                                  :morphology  which are not central to the main theme of the book, but which appear
line=835 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.58,294.551,391.451,306.418 iscore=0.27                            :within the data which will support its main arguments. Chapter 4 sets the scene for
line=836 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.55,281.66,391.471,292.633 iscore=0.20                                                   :the next several chapters, supplying an overview of the ways in which Kayardild
line=837 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.55,268.759,391.451,279.732 iscore=0.23                      :syntax interfaces with the inﬂectional morphology. This is then explored in detail
line=838 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.501,255.809,391.461,267.676 iscore=0.33                           :in Chapter 5 on clause structure, Chapter 6 on DPs, Chapter 7 on DP juxtaposition,
line=839 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.52,242.918,391.481,254.785 iscore=0.20                            :and  Chapter 8 on the  formal model  of feature percolation. Chapter 9 considers
line=840 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.57,229.967,391.391,240.94 iscore=0.47                                                   :matters that arise from the chapters on syntax and  it is there that the present
line=841 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.57,217.077,391.521,228.944 iscore=0.20                            :analysis is compared most  closely with the analysis of Evans (1995a). Chapter 10
line=842 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.54,204.126,391.461,215.993 iscore=0.23:introduces the class of non-inﬂecting particles. Chapter 11 presents a complete
line=843 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.54,191.235,391.431,202.208 iscore=0.18                                                  :formal implementation  of the mappings  in Kayardild from  the morphosyntactic
line=844 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.54,178.285,391.411,189.257 iscore=0.30                                                  :representation through to underlying forms within a constraint-based framework.
line=845 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.54,165.384,391.461,176.356 iscore=0.08                                                  :Appendix  A  tables comparisions between the units of the current analysis and of
line=846 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,152.433,391.381,164.3 iscore=0.15                              :Evans  (1995a). Appendix B presents a large body of empirical evidence in support
line=847 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,139.542,233.57,151.41 iscore=0.08                              :of the syntactic argumentation in Chapter 5.

doc_id=round-2013 page=33 block_id=33-2 bbox=93.23,511.683,293.859,533.63 label=ttb 851 851
line=851 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.23,511.683,293.859,533.63:    Morphological  structures

doc_id=round-2013 page=33 block_id=33-3 bbox=57.291,268.727,391.43,473.518 label=tbt 852 867
line=852 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,462.546,391.4,473.518                                                                                             :This chapter introduces the morphological constituents of syntactic words in Kayar-
line=853 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.43,449.655,391.331,460.707 iscore=0.21                                                     :dild and the arguments supporting them. A Kayardild word consists of a lexical stem
line=854 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0,AGHMMP+AdvOT5e4d79fc+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,436.704,391.42,447.756 iscore=0.14                          :which  is potentially followed by inﬂectional sufﬁxes, and ends obligatorily with a
line=855 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0,AGHMMP+AdvOT5e4d79fc+fb-7.1 bbox=57.49,423.746,391.351,436.411 iscore=0.25:termination  element.1 Lexical stems consist of roots, sufﬁxes, and thematic elem-
line=856 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,410.795,391.38,421.768 iscore=0.07                                                                                :ents. Each lexical stem falls into one of two morphological classes, refered to as
line=857 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.42,397.904,391.361,409.771 iscore=0.21                               :nominal  and  verbal, following Evans (1995a) and standard Australianist practice.
line=858 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,385.003,391.291,395.976 iscore=0.29                                                   :Roots too are classiﬁed as nominal or verbal. A nominal lexical stem is minimally
line=859 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,372.053,391.43,383.026 iscore=0.21                                                                                :comprised  of a single nominal root, while a verbal lexical stem is minimally com-
line=860 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,359.162,391.4,370.135 iscore=0.14                                                                                 :prised of a verbal root plus a lexically associated thematic. In the following discussion
line=861 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.44,346.212,391.39,357.264 iscore=0.25                                                      :I will use the term morph to refer to any underlying phonological string which has a
line=862 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,333.321,391.38,344.293 iscore=0.12                                                                                :morphological  identity. The chapter is organized as follows. The phonology   of
line=863 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.43,320.37,391.351,332.267 iscore=0.08                                       :Kayardild is summarized  in }2.1. Arguments are provided in }2.2 for the structure
line=864 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.36,307.469,391.341,320.47 iscore=0.08                                                   :of Kayardild’s simplest nominal and verbal stems, consisting of roots and thematics.
line=865 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.36,294.519,391.261,306.416 iscore=0.17          :Sufﬁxes  are discussed in }2.3, and the termination element  speciﬁcally in }2.4.
line=866 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.331,281.618,391.261,293.515 iscore=0.08         :Section 2.5 examines the suppletive allomorphy of three sufﬁxes and }2.6 discusses
line=867 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.291,268.727,107.523,279.7 iscore=0.08                                                                                :morphomes.

doc_id=round-2013 page=33 block_id=33-4 bbox=57.421,178.295,391.411,249.241 label=tbb 868 872
line=868 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,236.278,168.763,249.241                                               :2.1 Kayardild  phonology
line=869 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.43,217.046,391.331,230.046 iscore=0.17       :The phonemic  inventory of Kayardild is given in Tables 2.1–2.2. The representation
line=870 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.43,204.095,345.67,216.711 iscore=0.17                                  :of phonemes  in the Kayardild practical orthography is shown in italics.2
line=871 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.38,191.246,391.391,202.218 iscore=0.19                                                          :   Words in Kayardild all begin with a consonant and end with a vowel except for the

doc_id=round-2013 page=34 block_id=34-12 bbox=57.481,75.3,391.511,370.518 label=bbb 895 917
line=895 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,359.546,391.501,370.518                                                              :representation will be deleted. Restrictions on the shapes of individual morphs are
line=896 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,346.655,239.275,357.627 iscore=0.17                                                  :discussed individually in subsequent sections.
line=897 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.559,333.704,391.511,344.677 iscore=0.00                                                :   The phonological phenomenon   of greatest interest when our central concern is
line=898 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.6,320.813,391.481,331.866 iscore=0.09                        :morphology  is phonological juncture. It will be assumed, following arguments in
line=899 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.56,307.913,391.491,319.78 iscore=0.18:Round  (2009), that phonological modiﬁcations to underlying forms in Kayardild can
line=900 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.55,294.962,391.461,305.935 iscore=0.07                     :be grouped into two major classes. The application of modiﬁcations from one class or
line=901 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,282.071,391.371,293.044 iscore=0.07                                                :the other is determined by the kind of phonological juncture which appears at the
line=902 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,269.121,391.381,280.093 iscore=0.36                                                :boundary  between  two morphs.  This entails that there are two avenues through
line=903 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,256.23,391.431,267.202 iscore=0.17                                                 :which morphological information can feed into phonological forms: in its determin-
line=904 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,243.279,391.411,254.252 iscore=0.23                                                :ation of which morphs  appear, and in its determination of which junctures appear
line=905 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,230.378,149.605,241.351 iscore=0.15                                                :between those morphs.
line=906 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.459,217.428,391.471,229.295 iscore=0.00                          :   The key differences in the effects of the two junctures are summarized in Table 2.3.
line=907 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,204.527,391.411,216.394 iscore=0.13                           :The  leftmost column and topmost row  of Table 2.3 display segments in underlying
line=908 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,191.577,391.491,202.549 iscore=0.14                                                 :phonological strings which lie respectively to the left and right of a juncture. Filled
line=909 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,178.686,391.491,189.658 iscore=0.29                     :cells display the surface outcomes of phonological modiﬁcations in those cases where
line=910 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.58,165.785,391.461,176.758 iscore=0.23                     :the outcomes differ depending on the juncture. The signiﬁcant point is that surface
line=911 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,152.834,391.441,163.807 iscore=0.29                                                 :outcomes  often differ when the same string of segments spans a regular versus an
line=912 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,139.934,391.411,150.906 iscore=0.36                                                 :exceptional juncture. Thus, because juncture matters to the phonology,  it also
line=913 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,126.983,391.441,137.956 iscore=0.25                                                 :matters to the morphology.  The output  from the morphology  must  contain not
line=914 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,114.092,316.054,125.065 iscore=0.17                                                 :only the correct segmental morphs but the correct junctures too.
line=915 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.489,101.142,391.401,112.114 iscore=0.08                                                :   Much  more could be said about the segmental and prosodic phonology of Kayar-
line=916 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.53,88.251,391.431,99.223 iscore=0.12                       :dild but this need not concern us in any detail here. Stated brieﬂy, there are many
line=917 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.481,75.3,391.352,86.273 iscore=0.19                        :modiﬁcations  to underlying  consonant clusters in addition to those shown  in

doc_id=round-2013 page=35 block_id=35-7 bbox=57.36,281.662,391.351,358.113 label=bbt 949 954
line=949 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,346.246,391.351,358.113:Table 2.3, as well as modiﬁcations to vowels in hiatus and the deletion of underlying
line=950 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,333.345,391.331,344.318 iscore=0.20          :word-ﬁnal  consonants. All of these modiﬁcations involve assimilation, coalescence,
line=951 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.36,320.454,391.311,331.427 iscore=0.38                                      :or deletion, but never epenthesis. The  stress system of Kayardild is sensitive to
line=952 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.36,307.503,391.351,318.476 iscore=0.23          :morphological  structure, but since stress itself conditions neither segmental modiﬁ-
line=953 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.36,294.613,391.311,305.585 iscore=0.27                                      :cations nor the distribution of junctures, it can be safely abstracted away from. For an
line=954 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.36,281.662,329.719,293.529 iscore=0.07                :extensive coverage of the phonology of Kayardild see Round (2009).

doc_id=round-2013 page=35 block_id=35-8 bbox=57.43,249.178,167.309,262.141 label=bbbttt 955 955
line=955 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,249.178,167.309,262.141:2.2 Roots and thematics

doc_id=round-2013 page=35 block_id=35-9 bbox=57.43,229.946,391.361,240.918 label=bbbttb 956 956
line=956 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,229.946,391.361,240.918:This section examines roots and thematics as they appear in Kayardild lexical stems.

doc_id=round-2013 page=35 block_id=35-10 bbox=57.43,175.311,391.39,216.121 label=bbbtbt 957 959
line=957 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.43,204.154,247.464,216.121                                      :2.2.1 The simplest nominal stems: nominal roots
line=958 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,188.202,391.39,199.175 iscore=0.25                                                   :The  simplest nominal stems  consist of a single root. Representative examples are
line=959 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,175.311,374.484,187.178 iscore=0.23:shown  in (2.1) where the ﬁrst line is orthographic and the second phonological.

doc_id=round-2013 page=36 block_id=36-4 bbox=57.441,167.92,391.61,492.91 label=bbtb 975 999
line=975 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.6,480.943,272.799,492.91                                                                                                        :2.2.2 The simplest verbal stems: verbal root + thematic
line=976 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,465.051,391.471,476.023 iscore=0.19                                                                                                                  :In this section I argue that the simplest verbal stems are bipartite, consisting of a root
line=977 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,452.16,391.511,463.132 iscore=0.38                                                                                       :plus a lexically speciﬁed thematic element.  Since the interpretation of Kayardild
line=978 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,439.209,391.481,450.182 iscore=0.20                                                                                      :inﬂection in later chapters will make signiﬁcant use of this analysis, care is taken to
line=979 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,426.318,161.8,437.291 iscore=0.07                                                                                                                    :motivate it in some detail.
line=980 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.569,413.368,391.56,424.34 iscore=0.00                                                                                       :   The surface phonological  forms of two maximally  simple  verbal stems inﬂected
line=981 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.62,400.477,252.484,412.344 iscore=0.27                                                                :with a selction of sufﬁxes are shown in Table 2.5.
line=982 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=67.539,387.526,391.55,401.222 iscore=0.06      :   In the analysis adopted here, the stems in Table 2.5 are buruth- /pu ut̪/ ‘gather’ and
line=983 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.58,374.635,391.471,387.636 iscore=0.31:badij- /patic/ ‘carry’ while the sufﬁxes (on the surface) are /-a, -uː, -ara, -ia/. More
line=984 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,361.685,391.58,372.658 iscore=0.33                                                                                                                   :generally, all verbal stems in the Kayardild lexicon end in either a laminal dental
line=985 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0,AGHMMP+AdvOT5e4d79fc+fb-7.1 bbox=57.56,348.784,391.61,359.836 iscore=0.35                                                             :plosive /t/ or a laminal palatal /c/. I will refer to this as the laminal-ﬁnal analysis of
line=986 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,335.893,391.481,346.866 iscore=0.06                                                                                      :verbal stems. Under a laminal-ﬁnal analysis the sufﬁxes which attach to verbal stems
line=987 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,322.943,391.501,333.915 iscore=0.11                                                                                                                  :are always blind to whether the stem ends in /t/ versus /c/: there is no need to posit
line=988 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.53,310.052,389.185,321.024 iscore=0.22                                                                                      :allomorphy  which is sensitive to the distinction between /t/-ﬁnal and /c/-ﬁnal stems.
line=989 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.529,297.101,391.56,308.968 iscore=0.21                                                                                            :   An alternative analysis of verbal stems is pursued in Evans (1995a), which I will
line=990 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0,AGHMMP+AdvOT5e4d79fc+fb-7.1 bbox=57.56,284.2,391.471,295.253 iscore=0.14                                  :refer to as the vowel-ﬁnal analysis. Under the vowel-ﬁnal analysis the consonants /t/
line=991 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.501,271.25,391.411,283.117 iscore=0.18                                                                :and /c/ in Table 2.5 are understood as belonging to the sufﬁx, while the stems /pu u/
line=992 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.441,258.345,391.498,271.349 iscore=0.18                                                        :‘gather’ and /pati/ ‘carry’ are vowel-ﬁnal. There are several consequences of analysing
line=993 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.548,245.394,391.479,257.262 iscore=0.06                                                               :verbal stems as vowel-ﬁnal in this way. First, the sufﬁxes in Table 2.5 will all exhibit
line=994 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.568,232.503,391.409,244.689 iscore=0.38                                                                                    :allomorphy,  as /{-ta, -ca} {-tuː, -cuː}, {-tara, -cara}, {-tia, -cia}/. Secondly, verbal
line=995 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.558,219.553,391.429,230.526 iscore=0.40                                                                                                                 :stems  will need to be assigned to one of two declensions, one selecting for dental
line=996 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.558,206.662,391.429,217.635 iscore=0.20                                                                                     :initial sufﬁxes and the other for palatal initial. As it happens, in many cases the
line=997 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.558,193.761,391.399,204.734 iscore=0.27                                                                                                                 :declensional membership   of a verbal stem can be predicted on phonological grounds
line=998 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.558,180.811,391.449,191.783 iscore=0.25                                                                                     :from  its ﬁnal vowel. Stems ending in /i/ always belong to the palatal declension, as do
line=999 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.558,167.92,391.459,178.892 iscore=0.19                                                                                                                  :polysyllabic stems ending in a long vowel, while simple roots (though not all complex

doc_id=round-2013 page=37 block_id=37-7 bbox=57.261,191.253,391.528,512.318 label=btb 1015 1039
line=1015 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,501.346,391.4,512.318                                                                       :stems) ending in /u/ predictably belong to the dental declension. Nonetheless there
line=1016 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,488.395,391.41,499.368 iscore=0.33                                                          :remains  a substantial portion of cases in which declensional membership cannot be
line=1017 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,475.504,391.331,486.477 iscore=0.33                                                         :predicted and  must  be lexically listed. Prominent among  these are verbal stems
line=1018 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.43,462.554,218.004,474.421 iscore=0.17                                   :ending in /a/, such as those in Table 2.6.
line=1019 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.349,449.663,391.311,460.636 iscore=0.08                            :   The vowel-ﬁnal analysis incurs the cost of positing abstract stem declensions and
line=1020 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.39,436.712,391.291,447.685 iscore=0.00                             :sufﬁxal allomorphy. To  appreciate its principal beneﬁt we must consider inﬂected
line=1021 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.341,423.812,176.758,435.679 iscore=0.18                                  :forms of the type in Table 2.7.
line=1022 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.25,410.861,391.231,422.728 iscore=0.00       :   The inﬂected forms in Table 2.7 are representative of a wider set of cases in which
line=1023 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=57.271,397.97,391.192,411.606 iscore=0.12:the verbal sufﬁx begins either with a laminal nasal /n̪/ or / /, or with an apical-
line=1024 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.311,385.069,391.331,396.042 iscore=0.39                                                        :alveolar /t/ or /n/. In every one of these cases the laminal plosives /t/ and /c/, seen in
line=1025 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.321,372.119,391.221,383.986 iscore=0.28      :Table 2.5 and 2.6, fail to appear in the surface forms of the inﬂected verbs. This fact is
line=1026 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.321,359.218,391.271,370.191 iscore=0.11                            :straightforwardly accounted for if we assume that verbal stems are vowel ﬁnal and
line=1027 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.311,346.267,391.251,358.135 iscore=0.17      :that the plosives /t/ and /c/ in Table 2.5 and 2.6 belong to sufﬁxes. In Table 2.7 the
line=1028 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.311,333.377,391.261,344.349 iscore=0.22                            :vowel-ﬁnal  verbal stems all appear as expected. The apprehensive sufﬁx has allo-
line=1029 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=57.281,320.426,391.241,334.122 iscore=0.14                           :morphs  /{-n̪ara, - ara}/, beginning with a dental and palatal nasal, which are selected
line=1030 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.291,307.535,391.261,318.508 iscore=0.07                            :for according to declension as usual. The apical-initial sufﬁxes such as desiderative
line=1031 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.341,294.585,391.251,306.83 iscore=0.20                            :/-ta/ and negative potential /-na kuː/ have just one form which attaches to stems of
line=1032 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.321,281.684,126.208,292.656 iscore=0.13                                                        :both declensions.
line=1033 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.28,268.733,391.201,279.706 iscore=0.00                             :   Although the vowel-ﬁnal analysis has immediate appeal, the laminal-ﬁnal analysis
line=1034 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.261,255.832,391.182,266.805 iscore=0.13                                                        :is preferable for several reasons. So far we have seen that both analyses account for
line=1035 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.261,242.932,391.359,254.799 iscore=0.24      :the ﬁrst sets of data in Tables 2.5 and 2.6, although at the cost of positing declensions
line=1036 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.498,229.995,391.449,240.968 iscore=0.24                            :and  sufﬁxal allomorphy in the case of the vowel-ﬁnal analysis, and that the data in

line=1122 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.332,382.594,391.282,393.567 iscore=0.08                                                                             :analysis of verbal stem reduplication. Verbal stem reduplication in Kayardild is

line=1125 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.292,343.792,391.222,354.765 iscore=0.27                                                                             :multiple repetition of an action, either sequentially, or simultaneously by distributed

line=1128 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.292,305.06,391.302,318.06 iscore=0.17:shown  in Table 2.10, examples (a–k). Note that phonological modiﬁcations  more
line=1129 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.272,292.159,391.113,303.132 iscore=0.15                                                                             :often than not  will obscure the underlying form to some  degree. Under  certain

line=1181 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.62,165.863,391.501,176.836 iscore=0.14                                                   :unrelated to the morphology  of simple stems and their sufﬁxes. Under the laminal-
line=1182 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,152.972,391.431,165.972 iscore=0.33:ﬁnal analysis of verbal stems, the data in Table 2.10 (a–k) follow naturally from the
line=1183 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,140.021,391.481,150.994 iscore=0.29                                                                                :reduplication of the full stem. The fact that it is a laminal plosive appearing at the end
line=1184 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,127.131,391.421,140.131 iscore=0.24 :of the ﬁrst copy is principled. The minority of the data in Table 2.10 (l–o) require
line=1185 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.58,114.18,391.451,125.153 iscore=0.38                                                    :stipulation under either analysis. The vowel-ﬁnal analysis must stipulate that laminal
line=1186 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.63,101.279,391.6,112.252 iscore=0.23                                                     :insertion fails to occur, while the laminal-ﬁnal analysis must stipulate that the ﬁnal
line=1187 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.67,88.329,215.242,99.301 iscore=0.23                                                                                 :laminal of the verbal stem fails to copy.

line=1206 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.401,405.954,170.358,416.927 iscore=0.07                                                                                                           :expressing negative polarity.
line=1207 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.36,393.003,391.332,403.976 iscore=0.00                                                                                :   On the surface the negative sufﬁx appears as [na ] or [na]. In (e,f) the underlying
line=1208 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.421,380.113,391.282,391.085 iscore=0.25                                                                               :consonant  / / undergoes regular word-ﬁnal deletion and in all forms the initial nasal
line=1209 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.381,367.162,391.322,378.135 iscore=0.14                                                                               :appears as the non-retroﬂex  [n]. This is problematic for the vowel-ﬁnal analysis
line=1210 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.461,354.261,391.411,365.234 iscore=0.12                                                                               :of verbal stems due to the conﬂuence of two facts. First, there is good evidence that
line=1211 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.451,341.311,391.342,355.762 iscore=0.25                                                  :the underlying form  of the negative sufﬁx is /ɳa /, with an initial retroﬂex nasal.
line=1212 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.401,328.41,391.342,339.383 iscore=0.07                                                                                                            :Secondly, under  no other circumstances in Kayardild phonology  does underlying
line=1213 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.401,315.459,391.391,326.432 iscore=0.14                                                                               :/V-  /, with a retroﬂex nasal, yield surface [Vn] with non-retroﬂex [n]. The under-
line=1214 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.441,302.568,391.332,314.436 iscore=0.13                                                         :lying form of the verbs in Table 2.11 therefore cannot consist of a vowel-ﬁnal stem
line=1215 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.451,289.668,391.411,300.64 iscore=0.07                                                                                :followed directly by the negative sufﬁx, at least under any regular reading of the
line=1216 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,276.717,207.48,287.69 iscore=0.07                                                                                                             :phonology.  The details are as follows.
line=1217 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.46,263.816,391.401,275.683 iscore=0.12                                                                                      :   We  saw above in Table 2.8 that underlying strings of a laminal plosive plus / /
line=1218 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.431,250.866,391.332,262.733 iscore=0.44                                                                                     :yield surface [n], in which case the forms in Table 2.11 are predicted correctly by the
line=1219 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.361,237.975,391.262,248.948 iscore=0.38                                                                               :laminal-ﬁnal analysis. Of concern for the vowel-ﬁnal  analysis is that underlying
line=1220 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.322,225.024,303.759,236.892 iscore=0.15                                                                                     :sequences of /V- / yield surface [V ], as shown in Table 2.12.
line=1221 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.231,212.134,391.232,223.106 iscore=0.17                                                                               :   This is problematic because evidence indicates that the negative sufﬁx does begin

line=1223 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.212,186.282,391.13,197.255 iscore=0.33                                                                                                            :anything  other than verbal stems but it is occasionally encountered on nominals
line=1224 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.212,173.246,391.428,186.332 iscore=0.25:(Evans 1995:374–5). Evans transcribes the sufﬁx as surface-nang- [na ] after vowel-

doc_id=round-2013 page=42 block_id=42-11 bbox=57.481,263.363,391.511,326.018 label=bbbt 1253 1257
line=1253 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,315.046,391.511,326.018                                                                                                    :However,   there are two verbal stems  in Lardil which  descend historically from
line=1254 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.6,302.155,391.501,315.155 iscore=0.12                                                           :nominals,  ‘say’ /ka / and ‘cry’ / ik/. In Lardil phonology the velar segments / /
line=1255 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,289.204,391.451,300.177 iscore=0.12                                                                                       :and  /k/ typically delete when followed underlyingly by a nasal. As such, when /ka /
line=1256 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.481,276.313,391.381,290.765 iscore=0.35:and  /ɻik/ are inﬂected with /ɳe /, the velars / / and /k/ delete and the sufﬁx’s
line=1257 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.491,263.363,298.79,275.23 iscore=0.18                                      :underlying retroﬂex / / (not /n/) surfaces, as shown in (2.5).

doc_id=round-2013 page=42 block_id=42-14 bbox=57.57,94.55,391.58,208.918 label=bbbbb 1260 1268
line=1260 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,197.946,391.58,208.918                                     :Thus, there are sound internal and comparative reasons to analyse the negative sufﬁx
line=1261 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,184.995,391.54,195.968 iscore=0.28                                                    :in Kayardild as underlyingly / a / and not /na /, which in turn entails that a vowel-
line=1262 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.64,172.094,391.54,183.067 iscore=0.22                        :ﬁnal analysis of verbal stems fails to predict the correct surface form of negatively
line=1263 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.64,159.144,291.236,170.116 iscore=0.14                       :inﬂected verbs without recourse to exceptional stipulation.
line=1264 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.589,146.243,391.56,158.11 iscore=0.13  :   In sum, the vowel-ﬁnal analysis handles the initial data sets in Tables 2.5 and 2.6
line=1265 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.62,133.352,391.521,144.325 iscore=0.07                       :only by positing abstract declensions and sufﬁxal allomorphy. It must stipulate that a
line=1266 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.67,120.402,391.501,133.402 iscore=0.23:laminal plosive is inserted into reduplicated verbal stems (Table 2.10 (a–k)), and must
line=1267 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.59,107.501,391.481,120.501 iscore=0.15:stipulate that certain reduplicated stems lack such insertion (Table 2.10 (l–o)). It must
line=1268 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.57,94.55,391.461,105.523 iscore=0.23                         :also provide a non-regular means of deriving surface, non-retroﬂex [n] in negatively

doc_id=round-2013 page=43 block_id=43-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,189.308,633.882 label=tt 1269 1269
line=1269 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,189.308,633.882:22     Morphological structures

doc_id=round-2013 page=43 block_id=43-2 bbox=57.35,527.112,391.37,602.718 label=tbt 1270 1275
line=1270 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.341,602.718            :inﬂected  verbs. In contrast, the laminal-ﬁnal analysis of verbal stems must only
line=1271 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,578.795,391.311,589.768 iscore=0.21 :stipulate that in certain reduplicated forms the ﬁnal laminal fails to copy. All other
line=1272 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.35,565.904,391.271,576.877 iscore=0.29                            :data are accounted for regularly, both phonologically and morphologically. Since the
line=1273 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.35,552.954,391.311,563.926 iscore=0.08:one stipulation required by the laminal-ﬁnal analysis is also required by the vowel-

line=1275 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,527.112,90.547,538.085 iscore=0.07                             :analysis.

doc_id=round-2013 page=43 block_id=43-3 bbox=57.36,214.074,391.48,513.287 label=tbb 1276 1298
line=1276 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.39,501.321,228.57,513.287                                            :2.2.3 Morphological autonomy  of thematics
line=1277 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=57.4,485.369,391.38,499.055 iscore=0.06:Next  we  establish that the ﬁnal laminal plosive /t̪/ or /c/ of a verbal stem is a
line=1278 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.39,472.478,391.361,483.53 iscore=0.18                              :morphological  unit unto  itself, which I refer to as a thematic (see also Evans
line=1279 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.36,459.587,140.878,472.587 iscore=0.07    :1995:254–6, 399–401).
line=1280 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.319,446.636,391.351,457.609 iscore=0.00                                                      :   We saw above that the question of which of two thematics, /t/ and /c/, appears at the
line=1281 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,433.735,391.361,444.708 iscore=0.24                                                       :end of a stem cannot in general be predicted from the shape of the remainder of the
line=1282 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,420.785,391.341,431.758 iscore=0.24                                                       :stem; thus the lexicon needs to list stems and their thematics together. One might
line=1283 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,407.884,391.4,418.857 iscore=0.33                             :suppose at ﬁrst that the thematics /t/ and /c/ are merely the ﬁnal phonological segments
line=1284 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,394.934,391.42,405.906 iscore=0.27                                                         :of their stems, but there are three morphological constructions in which the behaviour
line=1285 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,382.043,387.802,393.015 iscore=0.46                                                        :of thematics points to their being morphological, and not merely phonological, units.
line=1286 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.359,369.092,391.351,380.065 iscore=0.27                          :   The ﬁrst construction is verbal reduplication, where the lexically associated the-
line=1287 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.41,356.201,391.321,367.174 iscore=0.27                           :matic was missing from  the ﬁrst copy of a reduplicated stem even at the underlying
line=1288 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.4,343.251,391.4,356.251 iscore=0.20       :phonological level in Table 2.10 (l–o). The second and third constructions are middle
line=1289 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.47,330.35,391.4,342.217 iscore=0.14                                    :and reciprocal stems, examples of which are shown in Table 2.14. Here, the thematic
line=1290 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.49,317.459,391.44,328.432 iscore=0.29                                                        :associated with the plain stem appears to be missing from the underlying phono-
line=1291 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.49,304.509,249.114,315.481 iscore=0.08                                                       :logical form of the middle and reciprocal stems.
line=1292 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.449,291.618,391.48,302.59 iscore=0.20                            :   We  can ﬁrst establish that in the general case, the absence of thematics from these
line=1293 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.5,278.667,391.38,289.64 iscore=0.13                                                          :three constructions is not amenable to a phonological account, which fails on several
line=1294 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.5,265.766,391.46,276.739 iscore=0.23                                                         :fronts. For one, laminal plosives never delete before a labial plosive elsewhere in
line=1295 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.5,252.816,391.43,263.788 iscore=0.15                                                         :Kayardild phonology  but the thematic /t/ is absent before labials in reduplications
line=1296 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.51,239.915,391.44,251.782 iscore=0.08                                  :(2.6a). Likewise, laminal plosives never delete between vowels elsewhere in Kayardild
line=1297 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.51,226.964,391.43,237.937 iscore=0.21                            :phonology  but both thematics are absent before the /i/ vowel of the middle sufﬁx
line=1298 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.5,214.074,89.106,225.941 iscore=0.07                                   :(2.6b,c).

doc_id=round-2013 page=44 block_id=44-4 bbox=57.471,279.552,391.56,536.018 label=tbb 1321 1340
line=1321 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,525.046,391.531,536.018                                                               :A phonological account can be ruled out, but we have yet to establish the plausibility of
line=1322 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,512.155,391.501,523.127 iscore=0.25                                                   :a morphological account according to which one constituent of a stem (the thematic)
line=1323 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,499.204,391.471,510.177 iscore=0.31                                                   :fails to appear when that stem occurs in certain larger morphological constructions.
line=1324 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,486.313,391.501,497.286 iscore=0.23                                                   :Such  an analysis is lent credibility by the fact that comparable behaviour occurs
line=1325 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,473.363,391.531,484.336 iscore=0.31                                                   :elsewhere in the morphological system. For example, the elements /tu/, /cu/ appear
line=1326 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.66,460.472,391.56,471.445 iscore=0.35                       :at the end of many kin-denoting stems, and a locative sufﬁx /ki/ appears at the end of
line=1327 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,447.521,391.471,458.494 iscore=0.18                                                  :certain place names. All three morphs are absent, either optionally or obligatorily,
line=1328 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,434.621,298.919,446.488 iscore=0.17:when  certain other sufﬁxes follow, as illustrated in Table 2.15.
line=1329 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.479,421.67,391.481,432.643 iscore=0.00                      :   The failure of /tu/, /cu/ to appear before certain sufﬁxes parallels the failure of
line=1330 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.57,408.769,391.471,419.742 iscore=0.21                      :thematics to appear before the sufﬁxes that form the middle and reciprocal stems. As
line=1331 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,395.819,391.421,406.791 iscore=0.21                                                  :for reduplication, the fact that the thematic sometimes appears and sometimes does
line=1332 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,382.928,391.481,393.901 iscore=0.25                                                  :not suggests that reduplication copies a morphologically complex string (consisting
line=1333 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,370.037,391.451,381.01 iscore=0.17                                                   :of root+thematic) on some  occasions, and a morphologically simple unit on others.
line=1334 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,357.087,391.481,368.059 iscore=0.23                                                  :In fact this is generally true of Kayardild reduplication, which routinely copies both
line=1335 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.56,344.186,317.952,356.083 iscore=0.23         :simple and complex  morphological constituents (cf }2.2.5 below).
line=1336 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.479,331.235,391.421,342.208 iscore=0.08                                                 :   In sum, a morphological analysis of the absence of thematics in verbal reduplica-
line=1337 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.52,318.344,391.431,329.317 iscore=0.23                                                  :tion, middle stems, and reciprocal stems accords well with the general nature of
line=1338 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.52,305.394,391.401,316.366 iscore=0.15                      :the morphological  system, provided  we  view thematics not  merely as  the ﬁnal
line=1339 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.471,292.503,391.342,303.476 iscore=0.08                                                 :phonological  segment  of verbal stems, but as autonomous   morphological  units.
line=1340 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.471,279.552,295.311,290.525 iscore=0.40                                                 :A  phonological analysis of missing thematics lacks support.
