doc_id=round-2013 page=45 block_id=45-2 bbox=57.301,471.958,391.42,603.322 label=tbt 1359 1368
line=1359 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHKOP+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I+fb-9.5,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.43,591.246,306.342,603.322:2.2.4 Thematic-ﬁnal lexical stems are all verbal, and vice-versa
line=1360 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,575.353,391.42,586.326 iscore=0.25                                                                     :We  have established that the simplest of lexical, verbal stems consist of a root plus a
line=1361 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,562.403,391.341,573.375 iscore=0.25                                                                    :thematic. For lexical stems in Kayardild the implicational relationship between being
line=1362 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,549.502,391.42,560.475 iscore=0.17                                         :verbal and being thematic-ﬁnal is biunique: all thematic-ﬁnal lexical stems are verbal,
line=1363 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,536.551,391.331,547.524 iscore=0.08                                        :and  all verbal lexical stems are thematic ﬁnal. This generalization ensures that
line=1364 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.41,523.66,391.38,534.633 iscore=0.25                                                                      :whenever  complex  lexical stems are built of multiple morphological components
line=1365 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.41,510.76,391.331,523.76 iscore=0.06                                         :we need only inspect the stem’s right edge to determine whether it is verbal (in which
line=1366 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.331,497.809,391.281,508.782 iscore=0.19                                                                   :case it will end with a thematic) or nominal (it will not). An important restriction
line=1367 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.331,484.908,391.281,495.96 iscore=0.38                                          :here is that the biunique relationship is true only of lexical stems. When we come to
line=1368 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.301,471.958,309.582,482.93 iscore=0.19                                        :inﬂected stems the implication breaks down in both directions.

doc_id=round-2013 page=45 block_id=45-3 bbox=57.301,301.094,391.37,458.073 label=tbbtt 1369 1380
line=1369 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.301,446.106,245.883,458.073                                                               :2.2.5 More complex stems of roots and thematic
line=1370 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.311,430.214,391.291,441.187 iscore=0.23                                                                           :The  Kayardild lexicon is richly populated with more complex stems also built of
line=1371 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.311,417.323,391.291,428.296 iscore=0.23                                                                           :roots and thematics. Reduplicated verbal stems were introduced  above. Here we
line=1372 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.311,404.373,391.341,417.373 iscore=0.27                                              :survey reduplicated nominal stems, compounds,  ‘cranberry’ roots, and more com-
line=1373 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.311,391.482,170.039,402.454 iscore=0.10                                                                           :plex reduplicated structures.
line=1374 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.27,378.531,391.271,389.504 iscore=0.00                                                                            :   Nominal  root reduplication in Kayardild is common and has a range of idiosyn-
line=1375 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.311,365.63,391.291,378.631 iscore=0.08                         :cratic and regular meanings (Evans 1995a:200–1). Phonologically it consists of the
line=1376 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.301,352.68,391.261,363.653 iscore=0.21                                                                            :concatenation of two underlying copies of the root across either kind of juncture, as
line=1377 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.301,339.779,391.36,352.846 iscore=0.18:in (2.7) and (2.8).4 In glosses, short angled brackets ‘‹›’ will be used as a convention to
line=1378 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.409,326.945,391.37,337.918 iscore=0.12                                                                            :group multiple elements on one line which correspond to just one element on the line
line=1379 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.409,313.994,391.37,324.967 iscore=0.13                                                                            :immediately above or below. Orthographic forms are given in italics. Surface phono-
line=1380 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.409,301.094,302.177,312.066 iscore=0.08                                                                           :logical forms appear next, and underlying forms below them.

doc_id=round-2013 page=46 block_id=46-2 bbox=57.512,540.046,391.542,602.718 label=tbtt 1411 1415
line=1411 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.55,591.746,391.482,602.718                                                                                        :   Nominal compounds   are also common and highly productive. Semantically most
line=1412 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.591,578.795,391.542,591.795 iscore=0.10                        :Kayardild compounds  are exocentric (Evans 1995a:197–200), with X-Y denoting ‘an
line=1413 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.611,565.904,391.448,578.904 iscore=0.16                                              :entity whose X is ((like) a) Y’ or the property of ‘having an X which is (like) Y’. An
line=1414 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.512,552.954,391.392,565.954 iscore=0.26                                              :endocentric minority arguably denote ‘an X entity which is Y’. Only regular phono-
line=1415 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.531,540.046,347.63,553.063 iscore=0.31:logical junctures ‘-’ appear in compounds.5 Examples are shown in (2.9).

doc_id=round-2013 page=46 block_id=46-6 bbox=57.405,274.695,391.534,391.081 label=tbtbbbt 1431 1439
line=1431 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.412,378.07,391.534,391.081                                                             :The  Kayardild lexicon contains just one verbal–verbal compound,  kabathaath-  ‘go
line=1432 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6,AGHPFD+AdvP7627-9.4 bbox=57.603,365.13,391.464,378.766 iscore=0.27:and  hunt (and return)’, built on /kapa-t̪-/ ‘ﬁnd; hunt’ plus /t̪aa-t̪-/ ‘go and do and
line=1433 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.593,352.239,86.903,365.239 iscore=0.07                                                                             :return’.
line=1434 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.542,339.289,391.477,350.261 iscore=0.00                                                                                                         :   Nominal  roots productively compound  with verbal stems, in which case the verbal
line=1435 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.504,326.388,391.432,337.361 iscore=0.08                                                                             :stem always appears rightmost, therefore resulting in a thematic-ﬁnal, hence verbal stem.
line=1436 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.524,313.437,391.42,326.438 iscore=0.23                                                       :The semantics of such compounds  are varied (see Evans 1995a:290–6) and nominal roots
line=1437 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.494,300.537,391.413,311.509 iscore=0.23                                                                                                         :can contribute adverbial as well as entity-based meanings. The phonological junctures
line=1438 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.494,287.586,391.376,300.586 iscore=0.20                                                      :between nominal  roots and verbal stems are regular ‘-’. Examples are shown in (2.10). In
line=1439 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.405,274.695,350.058,286.97 iscore=0.06                                                                                      :glosses the thematics appear as th for the dental /t/ and j for the palatal /c/.

line=1585 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.429,164.412,391.45,175.384 iscore=0.07                                                                            :   In instances conditioned purely by the phonology of the stem to which it attaches,

line=1587 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.47,138.56,391.41,149.533 iscore=0.12                                                                              :end  in a low vowel and after stems that end in /uu/, the termination has no overt
line=1588 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.47,125.669,391.44,136.642 iscore=0.12                                                 :realization. After all other vowel-ﬁnal stems it appears as /a/. After consonant-ﬁnal
line=1589 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.51,112.768,338.326,123.741 iscore=0.15                                                                            :stems, it appears as /ta/ following a coronal and /ka/ following a velar.

line=1663 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.601,578.795,391.472,591.07 iscore=0.15                           :only the strong allomorphs  are used. When   μcons  realizes case:consequential,
line=1664 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.541,565.904,391.432,578.179 iscore=0.30                          :tamt:antecedent, or  tama:antecedent  only the strong form  is used. Otherwise
line=1665 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.502,552.954,391.363,563.926 iscore=0.12                                              :whether the strong or the weak form is used depends on a number of factors, listed
line=1666 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.502,540.063,391.422,552.338 iscore=0.35    :in Table 2.20 as conditions C, P1, and P2. For μprop, the strong form may always be
line=1667 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.482,527.112,269.073,538.98 iscore=0.18                         :used as an alternative for the weak (Evans 1995a:145).
line=1668 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.5,514.212,391.522,526.486 iscore=0.00:   Condition C  is morphological and applies to realizations of case, speciﬁcally
line=1669 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.591,501.321,391.442,513.595 iscore=0.23                          :case:proprietive by μprop and case:ablative by μloc-μabl. It is met if the μprop
line=1670 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.591,488.37,391.522,500.645 iscore=0.23                           :or μabl morphome   that realizes case fails to appear immediately before the termin-

doc_id=round-2013 page=54 block_id=54-5 bbox=57.557,204.102,391.668,396.033 label=tbbb 1777 1791
line=1777 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.697,385.06,391.668,396.033                                                        :Before concluding, I wish to draw attention to the speciﬁc nature of the phonological
line=1778 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.787,372.11,391.668,383.977 iscore=0.29                                                  :conditions P1 and P2. These conditions are met when a surface phonological form
line=1779 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAC+AdvP49A1D-7.2 bbox=57.777,359.219,391.457,370.218 iscore=0.31                                                  :would  contain the dispreferred strings VÆVÆV or VÆVÆS. Importantly, it is only the
line=1780 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.557,346.295,391.467,359.295 iscore=0.15                    :surface form which matters. For example in (2.23a–c) all of the underlying phono-
line=1781 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAC+AdvP49A1D-7.2 bbox=57.557,333.346,391.532,344.367 iscore=0.14                                                  :logical forms contain VÆVÆV strings, yet this is unproblematic; the word in each case
line=1782 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAC+AdvP49A1D-7.2 bbox=57.561,320.395,391.524,331.418 iscore=0.21                                                  :is well-formed because there is no VÆVÆV string at the surface. Likewise in examples
line=1783 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.574,307.545,391.425,319.412 iscore=0.14                                                 :(2.21a,b) the words containing weak  allomorphs were  dispreferred because they
line=1784 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAC+AdvP49A1D-7.2 bbox=57.574,294.546,391.484,305.567 iscore=0.08                                                  :contained VÆVÆS   strings on the surface; in the underlying forms there were no
line=1785 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKAC+AdvP49A1D-7.2 bbox=57.583,281.646,391.474,293.513 iscore=0.14:dispreferred VÆVÆS strings but this did not rescue them. The inﬂuence of P1 and
line=1786 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.643,268.755,391.524,280.622 iscore=0.14                                                 :P2 on  the choice of allomorphs is thus a case of phonologically conditioned allo-
line=1787 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.633,255.804,391.563,266.777 iscore=0.14                                                                       :morphy   driven not by  underlying forms but  by phonologically derived surface
line=1788 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.633,242.903,391.504,253.876 iscore=0.23                                                                       :forms. Although the existence of such allomorphy has long been noted in generative
line=1789 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.633,229.953,391.524,241.82 iscore=0.08                                                  :phonology  (Anderson  1975; Carstairs 1987, 1998) it has recently been claimed not to
line=1790 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.653,217.052,391.524,228.919 iscore=0.23                                                 :exist (Paster 2006, 2012). Kayardild provides counter-evidence to that recent claim
line=1791 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.663,204.102,243.085,217.102 iscore=0.09                    :(for further discussion see Round 2009:223–8).

line=1793 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.6,152.446,391.491,164.313 iscore=0.09:Aronoff (1994) argues for the linguistic signiﬁcance of morphomic categories, categor-

doc_id=round-2013 page=56 block_id=56-4 bbox=57.657,422.793,391.715,537.161 label=bttb 1847 1855
line=1847 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.657,526.189,391.554,537.161                                                              :Morphomes    capture  more  than just identities of individual forms. They also
line=1848 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.657,513.238,391.629,524.211 iscore=0.27                                                  :capture  identities of shared, multiple forms,  identities of aspects of forms,
line=1849 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.657,500.337,391.577,511.31 iscore=0.27                                                   :identities of subparts of forms, and identities of restrictions on morphotactics.
line=1850 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.657,487.447,391.715,498.419 iscore=0.09                                                  :The  following subsections discuss each  of these facts. More theoretically and
line=1851 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.657,474.496,391.637,486.363 iscore=0.15                            :technically oriented treatments of these issues can also be found in Round (2011;
line=1852 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.707,461.595,391.677,472.568 iscore=0.24                                                  :in prep a.; in prep b), where I show that other apparatus such as rules of referal
line=1853 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.707,448.645,391.5,460.512 iscore=0.35                              :(Zwicky  1985; Stump 1993) and the divorcing of function from realization (Beard
line=1854 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.707,435.744,391.665,447.611 iscore=0.23:1995) do  not on  their own  afford sufﬁcient power  to adequately  express the
line=1855 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.766,422.793,197.416,433.766 iscore=0.08                                                  :morphological  facts of Kayardild.

line=1858 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.726,368.159,391.577,380.026 iscore=0.06                          :tions /ki/ and /inta/. When any of the features from Figure 2.1 is realized next to

line=1863 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.746,303.575,391.647,314.548 iscore=0.31                                                :phonological forms, but are elements whose  relationship to phonological forms is
line=1864 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.746,290.625,391.687,301.597 iscore=0.07                                                :one of mapping,  where the mapping  may be one-to-one, or may be more  complex.
line=1865 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.746,277.724,391.657,290.008 iscore=0.18                            :That  features map to μloc or to μobl captures the fact that they share not just a
line=1866 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.716,264.773,364.265,275.746 iscore=0.24                                                :single phonological realization but identical sets of phonological realizations.

line=1927 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.481,604.02                                                              :The  analysis here is that the morphomic units which  realize case:privative and

line=1931 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.64,540.063,391.58,553.063 iscore=0.38                    :a ‘regular’ juncture feature, while the realization of {+neg, tamt:actual} is μpriv with
line=1932 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.63,527.112,391.511,540.113 iscore=0.23                                       :an ‘exceptional’ juncture feature. To avoid visual clutter morphomic juncture fea-
line=1933 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.63,514.212,391.501,525.184 iscore=0.12                                                                    :tures are not indicated in the morphomic gloss line. Their effect can be seen on the
line=1934 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.63,501.311,164.872,512.283 iscore=0.12                                                                    :phonological line however.
line=1935 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=67.589,488.36,391.57,500.257 iscore=0.00                            :   A similar formal treatment can be extended to allomorphy. As introduced in }2.5,
line=1936 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,475.459,391.521,486.432 iscore=0.15                                                                    :some  morphomes   are realized as different allomorphs under various conditions. In
line=1937 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.64,462.509,391.511,474.376 iscore=0.18                                              :Chapter 11 it is argued that the nature of the system is that under some conditions the
line=1938 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,449.608,391.511,460.581 iscore=0.24                                                                    :morphology  passes an allomorph set (containing strong and weak allomorphs) to the
line=1939 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,436.658,391.491,447.63 iscore=0.17                                                                     :phonology, from which the phonology selects one allomorph; under other conditions
line=1940 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,423.767,391.491,434.739 iscore=0.09                                                                    :the morphology   just passes one allomorph (always the strong allomorph). This
line=1941 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.64,410.816,391.54,421.868 iscore=0.14                                           :means  that in the general case a morphomic unit must also carry an allomorphy
line=1942 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.64,397.925,391.55,408.977 iscore=0.14                                           :feature which indicates whether one allomorph or two will be passed to the phon-
line=1943 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,385.024,391.501,395.997 iscore=0.21                                                                    :ology when it is realized. Allomorphy features are represented in morphomic glosses
line=1944 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,372.074,391.56,383.047 iscore=0.20                                                                     :by a double acute accent above the μ in instances where the phonology passes two
line=1945 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,359.183,391.531,370.156 iscore=0.40                                                                    :allomorphs  (although the phonological gloss only shows the allomorph which the
line=1946 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.64,346.232,391.531,358.507 iscore=0.27                          :phonology  ends up selecting). Examples are shown in (2.29), where case:proprietive
line=1947 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.57,333.342,391.471,345.209 iscore=0.14                                              :is realized in (2.29a) with a morphomic allomorphy feature that results in it passing
line=1948 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.56,320.391,391.481,332.666 iscore=0.43                                                :to the phonology just one allomorph, the strong form /ku u/; tama:future is realized
line=1949 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.57,307.49,391.481,319.357 iscore=0.36                                               :in (2.29b) such that it passes two allomorphs, from which the phonology in this
line=1950 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,294.54,205.303,305.512 iscore=0.14                                                                     :instance selects the weak form /kuu/.

doc_id=round-2013 page=59 block_id=59-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,189.308,633.882 label=t 1965 1965

doc_id=round-2013 page=59 block_id=59-2 bbox=57.43,449.608,391.51,604.02 label=bt 1966 1977
line=1966 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.331,604.02                    :appear before t, μobl, μall, or μabl. How these restrictions are obeyed varies from
line=1967 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.49,578.795,391.51,591.07 iscore=0.44         :case to case. The μdes simply blocks any expected morphome to its right other than t
line=1968 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.559,565.904,391.49,578.179 iscore=0.25       :from  being realized; μobl shifts its linear position to the right edge of the word
line=1969 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.539,552.954,391.45,565.228 iscore=0.38       :immediately before t, and the μloc simply fails to be realized if it would be followed
line=1970 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,540.063,391.5,551.036 iscore=0.25                            :by  the realization of an illicit morphome. The crucial observation is that these
line=1971 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,527.112,391.46,538.085 iscore=0.29                           :generalizations can be stated in such a simple manner only in terms of morphomic
line=1972 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,514.212,391.45,525.184 iscore=0.21                           :categories, not in terms of the multiple, disparate features which those morphomic
line=1973 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,501.311,391.49,512.283 iscore=0.29                           :categories may realize, and not in terms of the disparate set of phonological morphs
line=1974 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.529,488.36,391.47,499.333 iscore=0.21                            :which  the morphomes   are realized as. To my knowledge  Kayardild provides the
line=1975 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.529,475.459,391.4,486.432 iscore=0.17:clearest example yet of a linguistically signiﬁcant morphomic level of representation,
line=1976 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.48,462.509,391.4,473.482 iscore=0.21 :in the sense that a signiﬁcant range of generalizations are accorded their simplest and

doc_id=round-2013 page=59 block_id=59-3 bbox=57.421,149.504,391.549,436.041 label=bbt 1978 1999

line=1980 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.47,394.924,391.43,405.896 iscore=0.27                                                   :inﬂectional feature, for example number, receives a realization at all, to depend on

line=1983 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.51,356.191,391.42,367.164 iscore=0.27                                                                               :on  the phonological form of the stem on which  it would be realized. Thus, given
line=1984 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.51,343.241,391.51,354.214 iscore=0.13                                                   :that realization can depend on other inﬂectional features, that is, it can depend on
line=1985 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.559,330.34,391.47,341.313 iscore=0.21                                                                               :the nature of the morphosyntactic  representation, and given that it can depend
line=1986 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.559,317.439,391.45,328.412 iscore=0.27                                                                              :on  the phonological shape of a stem, that is, on the nature of the phonological
line=1987 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.559,304.489,391.52,315.461 iscore=0.20                                                  :representation, it should not be surprising if inﬂectional realization in Kayardild also
line=1988 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.549,291.598,362.378,302.57 iscore=0.50                                                                              :depended  on the nature of the morphomic  representation, as indeed it does.
line=1989 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.508,278.647,391.529,289.62 iscore=0.00                                                  :   A signiﬁcant point of differentiation between the present analysis and that of
line=1990 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.559,265.746,391.51,277.614 iscore=0.27                                                        :Evans (1995a) is that here the shape of the stem in its morphomic representation will
line=1991 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.559,252.796,391.52,265.071 iscore=0.27                                                          :play a crucial role in regulating the realization of the two tense/aspect/mood (tam)
line=1992 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.539,239.895,391.549,252.895 iscore=0.08:features in the inﬂectional system. One feature, the ‘thematic’ tam feature, will be

line=1994 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.559,214.054,391.529,227.054 iscore=0.19                            :while the ‘athematic’ tam feature will be realizable only on stems which do not end in
line=1995 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.559,201.153,391.47,212.126 iscore=0.19                                                                              :a thematic. By stating the generalization in this way it is possible to dispense with one
line=1996 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.559,188.202,391.52,201.203 iscore=0.12                           :of the  more  striking aspects of Evans’ (1995a) analysis of Kayardild, in which
line=1997 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.579,175.312,391.362,188.346 iscore=0.23                    :inﬂectional sufﬁxes are analysed as altering a stem’s ‘morphological word class’,
line=1998 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.431,162.395,391.292,173.368 iscore=0.27                                                 :from  morphological  nominal  to morphological verbal or vice versa. Reasons for
line=1999 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.421,149.504,333.427,161.371 iscore=0.27                                                       :abandoning  that analysis will be discussed more closely in Chapter 9.

doc_id=round-2013 page=59 block_id=59-4 bbox=57.441,94.81,391.411,135.619 label=bbb 2000 2002

doc_id=round-2013 page=60 block_id=60-2 bbox=57.56,178.299,391.64,604.746 label=tb 2004 2036
line=2004 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.511,604.746               :and  in particular the reasoning behind Evans’ treatment of case are signiﬁcantly
line=2005 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.62,578.795,326.052,589.768 iscore=0.17                                                                               :different to the treatment here. We may begin with the similarities.
line=2006 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.579,565.904,391.511,576.877 iscore=0.09                                                                              :   A number   of morphosyntactic features which are analysed here as something
line=2007 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.62,552.954,391.511,565.228 iscore=0.07                                     :other than case are analysed in Evans (1995a) as functions of case morphemes. In
line=2008 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.63,540.063,391.531,553.063 iscore=0.14                              :certain respects, Evans’ case morphemes  approximate the level of representation
line=2009 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.64,527.112,391.531,538.085 iscore=0.07                                                   :which is identiﬁed here as the morphome. For example the range of forms identiﬁed
line=2010 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.62,514.212,391.54,526.486 iscore=0.14                                      :in Evans (1995a) as containing the oblique case morpheme   comes close to those
line=2011 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.63,501.321,391.501,513.595 iscore=0.23                               :identiﬁed here as containing the morphomic  oblique (μobl) morphome;  compare
line=2012 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.68,488.37,391.63,501.37 iscore=0.29           :Figure 2.2 above with a  similarly laid out diagram of Evans’ oblique case, its
line=2013 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.719,475.479,391.58,487.346 iscore=0.29                                                         :functions, and its phonological realizations in Figure 2.3. (The right side of the
line=2014 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,462.529,391.58,473.501 iscore=0.23                                                                                :diagram  lists surface phonological variants rather than a single underlying form,
line=2015 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.64,449.638,287.141,460.611 iscore=0.09                                                   :which  for present purposes is an insigniﬁcant difference.)
line=2016 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.628,436.687,391.54,448.555 iscore=0.17                                                         :   The approach  taken by Evans (1995a) and formulated originally in Evans (1985)
line=2017 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,423.796,391.441,434.769 iscore=0.08                                                                               :appears during a period of theoretical development in the Australianist literature
line=2018 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.56,410.846,391.511,422.713 iscore=0.23                                                         :occurring around the same time, notably in Dench and Evans (1988), Dench (1995),
line=2019 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,397.955,391.511,409.822 iscore=0.23                             :and  Austin (1995), which tackled issues in the analysis of sufﬁxes in Australian
line=2020 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.66,385.054,391.61,397.329 iscore=0.08                                                            :languages which  mark case  and have  distinctive polyfunctionality. The approach
line=2021 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.68,372.104,391.64,383.076 iscore=0.33                                                    :replicates much of the mapping achieved with morphomes  but with one signiﬁcant
line=2022 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.729,359.213,391.64,372.213 iscore=0.23  :gap: Evans’ tense sufﬁxes are treated differently, even though they share with case
line=2023 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.759,346.262,391.6,359.263 iscore=0.23          :all of properties listed in }}2.6.1–2.6.4 above. Since Evans provides a careful articula-
line=2024 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.699,333.371,391.59,345.646 iscore=0.33                                                           :tion of the arguments underlying his model of case it is possible to compare them
line=2025 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.739,320.421,259.054,331.394 iscore=0.20                                                                              :with the basis of the morphomic model used here.
line=2026 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.698,307.51,391.552,319.785 iscore=0.15                                     :   The conceptual basis of case in Evans (1995a) is fundamentally different from that
line=2027 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.671,294.595,391.522,305.568 iscore=0.23                                                                              :of morphomes  in the present analysis. In addition to observations regarding similar-
line=2028 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.671,281.694,391.542,294.695 iscore=0.15                           :ities and identities of form, Evans (1995a:117–19) presents a set of semantic and
line=2029 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.661,268.744,391.562,279.716 iscore=0.23                                                                              :syntactic arguments  for positively identifying and grouping his morphome-like
line=2030 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.661,255.843,391.592,268.118 iscore=0.08                                                          :elements as case markers, and another set of semantic and syntactic arguments for
line=2031 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.671,242.952,391.552,255.227 iscore=0.27                                                          :excluding tense. In contrast, the notion of a morphome employed here is that of a
line=2032 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.661,230.002,391.562,240.974 iscore=0.07                                                  :category which  speciﬁcally is not coherently grounded in semantics, syntax, or
line=2033 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.661,217.101,391.542,228.073 iscore=0.18                                                                              :phonological form, one  which instead is a purely morphological category which
line=2034 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.661,204.15,391.572,215.123 iscore=0.27                                                   :ﬁgures  prominently  in the organization of the morphological  system (Aronoff
line=2035 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.661,191.249,391.482,204.25 iscore=0.08:1994). Let us brieﬂy consider then whether Evans’ semantic and syntactic arguments
line=2036 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.671,178.299,346.319,190.574 iscore=0.17                                                          :for grouping the functions of case and excluding tense are compelling.

doc_id=round-2013 page=61 block_id=61-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,189.308,633.882 label=tt 2043 2043
line=2043 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,189.308,633.882:40     Morphological structures

doc_id=round-2013 page=61 block_id=61-2 bbox=57.332,165.345,391.481,604.746 label=tb 2044 2077
line=2044 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.38,591.746,391.411,604.746                                           :   In order to unite into one category the many functions of case, including ‘modal
line=2045 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.431,578.795,391.342,591.795 iscore=0.14                              :case’ which  will be analysed in this book as a tense/aspect/mood feature, Evans
line=2046 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.431,565.904,391.391,578.904 iscore=0.14:(1995a:117–18) appeals to a deﬁnition of case due to Mel’cuk (1986). Key criteria are
line=2047 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,552.954,391.381,563.926 iscore=0.29                                                                               :that the phenomenon  in question should display morphological concord, and that it
line=2048 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.441,540.063,391.312,553.063 iscore=0.21                              :be used to distinguish types of syntactic dependency. All of Evans’ functions of case
line=2049 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.401,527.112,391.262,540.113 iscore=0.41:do meet these criteria, but as we will see in Chapters 4–7 so do all inﬂectional features
line=2050 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.352,514.212,391.262,527.212 iscore=0.29                              :in Kayardild  including number   and  the equivalent of Evans’ tense. Thus  the
line=2051 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.332,501.321,391.262,513.595 iscore=0.12                                                           :positive reasons for grouping case fail to stop at just case; they extend to all features
line=2052 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.361,488.37,232.248,499.343 iscore=0.12                                                                                :and so fail to distinguish any proper subset.
line=2053 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.32,475.479,391.252,487.754 iscore=0.15          :   The uniﬁcation of tense  with case  is rejected by Evans (1995a:255) for three
line=2054 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.381,462.529,391.312,474.803 iscore=0.19                               :reasons. The ﬁrst is that there fails to exist a matching case value, with a similar
line=2055 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.451,449.638,391.411,461.913 iscore=0.19                                                           :set of phonological realizations, for each value of tense. Problematic here is that
line=2056 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.501,436.687,391.411,448.962 iscore=0.29                                                           :among  the different functions of case the same failure applies, and applies often. For
line=2057 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.501,423.796,391.461,436.071 iscore=0.29                                                           :example  there is no value of complementizing case to match the proprietive value
line=2058 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.501,410.846,391.431,423.121 iscore=0.31                                                           :of relational  case. If this criterion is applied uniformly, the single case category
line=2059 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.491,397.955,391.342,408.928 iscore=0.23                                                                               :will be dissolved. The second reason is that there exists a one-to-many relationship
line=2060 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.491,385.064,391.481,397.339 iscore=0.29                                                           :between  certain case and tense values. That is, in terms of its phonological realiza-
line=2061 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.451,372.114,391.362,384.388 iscore=0.21                                                           :tion and its diachronic source, the consequential case matches both the precondition
line=2062 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.481,359.223,391.441,371.497 iscore=0.20                                                           :tense  and the past tense (in the terms of the morphomic  analysis here, all three
line=2063 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.491,346.272,391.481,358.547 iscore=0.13                               :inﬂectional features are realized by μcons). Again however, the same, supposedly
line=2064 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.54,333.381,391.481,345.656 iscore=0.33                                                            :problematic relationship can be found among the functions of case. The relational
line=2065 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.511,320.431,391.421,332.706 iscore=0.15                                                           :ablative  shares its forms with two kinds of modal ablative. Although the modal
line=2066 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.441,307.53,391.341,319.805 iscore=0.33                                      :ablative  is given a unitary label in Evans (1995a), it has two distinct functions, each
line=2067 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.36,294.595,391.291,307.595 iscore=0.13                             :with distinctive allomorphy (Evans  1995a:260–1). Thus if the second criterion is
line=2068 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.38,281.694,391.261,293.969 iscore=0.07                                                            :applied uniformly, it will also dissolve the single case category. The third is that
line=2069 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.35,268.744,391.311,281.744 iscore=0.21   :‘the meanings of the [tense] inﬂections are sometimes difﬁcult to relate synchronic-
line=2070 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.37,255.843,391.271,268.843 iscore=0.08         :ally’ to case (Evans 1995a:255). This semantic argument carries little force. Both
line=2071 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,242.952,391.361,255.227 iscore=0.07                                 :tense  and the modal  function of case relate to the semantic ﬁeld of tense/aspect/
line=2072 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,230.002,391.4,242.276 iscore=0.13                                  :mood  and  their afﬁnities are therefore closer to one another than modal case is to
line=2073 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,217.101,391.38,229.375 iscore=0.33                                                             :either of relational case (which corresponds to a more tradition notion of case) or
line=2074 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.48,204.15,391.43,216.425 iscore=0.07                                                              :complementizing    case (which indexes relationships between clauses). If the third
line=2075 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.48,191.249,391.37,203.811 iscore=0.23                                    :criterion is applied uniformly, the single case category will once again be dissolved.6
line=2076 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=67.38,178.246,391.411,190.52 iscore=0.15                                                             :   Neither the positive arguments for grouping the functions of case together nor the
line=2077 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.461,165.345,391.372,177.62 iscore=0.00                                                            :negative arguments for dissociating them from tense are convincing. The approach

doc_id=round-2013 page=61 block_id=61-3 bbox=57.427,75.382,391.472,142.457 label=b 2078 2084
line=2078 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-5.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4 bbox=65.4,132.057,391.424,142.457           :   6 It might appear that this predicament can be avoided by returning to Evans’ semantic grounds for
line=2079 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.427,122.611,391.401,131.389 iscore=0.12                                                  :grouping  case functions together. The claim is made that case systems are often semantically more
line=2080 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.427,113.165,391.401,121.943 iscore=0.13                                                  :heterogeneous than canonical descriptions of case suggest: the case systems of most languages abound
line=2081 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4 bbox=57.427,103.719,391.464,114.119 iscore=0.12:in such problematic polysemy’ (Evans 1995a:118), and this might be cited to justify tolerating a greater
line=2082 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.474,94.273,391.472,103.051 iscore=0.35                                                   :degree of semantic divergence in case categories than in others. However the question then arises as to
line=2083 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.474,84.828,391.464,93.606 iscore=0.17                                                    :whether one  can ever draw a semantic boundary between case and other features. If not, then we cannot
line=2084 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.474,75.382,264.375,84.16 iscore=0.22                                                     :dissociate tense from case on semantic grounds as was proposed.

doc_id=round-2013 page=62 block_id=62-1 bbox=298.4,621.417,391.577,633.987 label=tt 2085 2085
line=2085 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.9 bbox=298.4,621.417,391.577,633.987:                                                 2.6 Morphomes     41

doc_id=round-2013 page=62 block_id=62-2 bbox=57.6,565.904,391.501,602.718 label=tbt 2086 2088
line=2086 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.501,602.718            :presented in this volume proceeds instead from the recognition that there exists no
line=2087 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.501,589.768 iscore=0.08:coherent, synchronic semantic or morphosyntactic basis to morphomic categories in
line=2088 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,565.904,98.747,576.877 iscore=0.10 :Kayardild.

doc_id=round-2013 page=62 block_id=62-3 bbox=57.491,252.794,391.799,552.536 label=tbbt 2089 2111
line=2089 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJHM+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I+20-9.9,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4,AGIAJA+AdvP94B5-9.8 bbox=57.6,540.053,307.357,552.536                :2.6.7 Realization for Evans’ (1995a) case values is not uniform
line=2090 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,524.16,391.461,535.133 iscore=0.07                                                  :Here I make a short but signiﬁcant observation regarding the degree to which values
line=2091 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.58,511.21,391.501,524.21 iscore=0.21                              :for Evans’ unitary case category have uniform  phonological exponences. At one
line=2092 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.54,498.309,391.451,511.309 iscore=0.21:juncture Evans states that case sufﬁxes ‘have the same form and range of allomorphy
line=2093 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.491,485.346,391.467,498.359 iscore=0.29:regardless of their function’ (Evans 1995a:118).7 This statement has at times been
line=2094 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.606,472.446,391.451,485.011 iscore=0.38                                                   :taken at face value by other researchers,8 but it is not correct. Two facts have been
line=2095 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.63,459.555,391.541,472.555 iscore=0.19                            :abstracted away from. First, the allomorphy of Evans’ ablative case morpheme is
line=2096 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.6,446.604,391.561,458.879 iscore=0.17                                                          :different when it takes a modal function (signalling tense/aspect/mood) in precon-
line=2097 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.66,433.713,391.591,445.581 iscore=0.18                                                       :dition clauses, compared  against its other uses (Evans 1995a:261). Secondly, the
line=2098 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.75,420.763,391.68,433.038 iscore=0.14                                                          :allomorphy  of the proprietive case morpheme is not the same in its modal function
line=2099 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.74,407.862,343.873,419.729 iscore=0.21                                                       :as in its relational and adnominal functions generally (Evans 1995a:145).
line=2100 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.758,394.912,391.67,405.884 iscore=0.13                                                                             :   In passing, it may be of interest to scholars of morphemic theory to observe the
line=2101 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.799,382.011,391.76,395.011 iscore=0.20                          :extended  notion of the morpheme   which  is implicitly at play in Evans’ (1995a)
line=2102 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.809,369.06,391.71,381.335 iscore=0.15                                                          :analysis of Kayardild case. First, case morphemes  have multiple functions. Sec-
line=2103 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.839,356.169,391.77,367.142 iscore=0.25                                                                             :ondly, many  of them have multiple forms, entailing the existence of many-to-many
line=2104 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.839,343.219,391.72,355.493 iscore=0.25                                                         :relationships between form and function. Finally, for case morphemes such as the
line=2105 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.889,330.328,391.779,341.301 iscore=0.31                                                                            :ablative and proprietive, some of their multiple forms relate exclusively to only some
line=2106 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.889,317.427,391.76,328.4 iscore=0.08                                                                               :of their multiple functions, a situation which prototypically would call for the
line=2107 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.889,304.477,391.76,315.449 iscore=0.08                                                                             :postulation of separate morphemes. Arguably  this indicates just how deeply non-
line=2108 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.889,291.586,391.789,304.586 iscore=0.18                                               :morphemic   the morphology  of Kayardild is. Despite Evans’ innovative approach to
line=2109 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.909,278.635,391.779,290.91 iscore=0.23                                                         :the case  morpheme    as an analytical device and the insights which have been
line=2110 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.909,265.744,391.799,276.717 iscore=0.15                                                :obtained by applying it, there are signiﬁcant additional insights which do not emerge
line=2111 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.899,252.794,199.4,263.766 iscore=0.08                                                                              :until a morphomic  analysis is used.

line=2164 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.63,214.078,391.461,226.352 iscore=0.21                                                                                                          :of phonological juncture, as for example by a hiatus juncture feature on μmid. The
line=2165 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.62,201.187,391.481,213.461 iscore=0.13                                                                                                          :morphome    μmid has several uses. When used to form  the middle stem of a verb

line=2167 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.61,175.335,230.37,187.911 iscore=0.13                                                                                :phonological forms illustrated in Table 3.1.1

doc_id=round-2013 page=64 block_id=64-6 bbox=57.581,75.428,391.571,133.057 label=bbb 2170 2175

line=2171 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.581,113.211,391.547,121.989 iscore=0.11                                                                                                         :occur. The middle  form of an intransitive verb will appear in nominalizations referring to places where

line=2518 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.62,289.111,391.531,301.584 iscore=0.29                          :second, the string μpl-t is realized as /palaː/. One analysis of the latter is that μpl has
line=2519 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.56,276.16,391.511,288.435 iscore=0.24                                                        :an allomorph  /pala/ before t, which idiosyncratically selects the /-a/ allomorph of t.
line=2520 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.58,263.27,391.491,275.544 iscore=0.15                                                        :This would  accord with the historical picture, where μpl descends from an erstwhile
line=2521 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=57.57,250.346,391.54,264.005 iscore=0.15:particle /walat̪/ ~ /wala/ (Round 2011c)12 which would have selected phonologically
line=2522 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.619,237.395,391.58,249.67 iscore=0.23                                                        :regular allomorphs  /-ta/ and /-a/ for t. An alternative synchronic analysis is that
line=2523 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9 bbox=57.629,224.494,391.49,236.968 iscore=0.19                          :/palaː/ is the cumulative realization of μpl and t. I am not aware of any synchronic
line=2524 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.609,211.544,259.49,222.516 iscore=0.19                                                                           :grounds  for preferring one analysis over the other.

line=2872 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,590.778,300.185,603.741:3.3 Song forms and their place in Kayardild grammar

doc_id=round-2013 page=81 block_id=81-3 bbox=57.371,429.411,391.42,582.518 label=tbtbtt 2873 2884
line=2873 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,571.546,391.38,582.518                                                        :Kayardild has not been documented   as possessing any special spoken registers in
line=2874 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,558.595,391.42,569.568 iscore=0.25                                            :which the phonology, morphology,  or syntax departs from normal everyday speech.
line=2875 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,545.704,391.39,556.677 iscore=0.18                                            :However,  the morphology   of Kayardild song  is distinctive. From a diachronic
line=2876 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.43,532.754,159.841,545.311 iscore=0.09                  :perspective it is archaic.17
line=2877 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.38,519.846,391.342,530.818 iscore=0.00                                           :   There are two points on which the morphology of Kayardild song departs from the
line=2878 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.421,506.895,391.342,517.868 iscore=0.00              :morphology   of the spoken register. The ﬁrst departure relates to the morphomic
line=2879 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.371,493.994,391.332,506.269 iscore=0.12                      :allative (μall) which in spoken Kayardild has just one allomorph / i / but in song
line=2880 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.411,481.103,391.362,492.076 iscore=0.33                                          :has / u / in addition (the latter form is etymologically prior, cf Yukulta / u /). The
line=2881 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.431,468.153,391.322,480.428 iscore=0.22                      :second departure pertains to the allomorphy of μprop, μabl, and μcons, introduced
line=2882 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.431,455.262,391.381,467.159 iscore=0.23 :in }2.5 above. As mentioned,  song  permits only the use of strong allomorphs,
line=2883 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.431,442.312,391.372,454.586 iscore=0.13                      :never weak. This is illustrated in the case of μprop which realizes the feature value
line=2884 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.401,429.411,186.549,441.685 iscore=0.07:tama:future, in (3.21) and (3.22).

line=2900 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.262,195.869,391.202,208.144 iscore=0.15      :realizes tamt:precondition and case:consequential, as in (3.23b,c). In song, although

doc_id=round-2013 page=82 block_id=82-3 bbox=57.441,385.022,391.441,512.271 label=btb 2919 2928
line=2919 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.55,501.298,391.441,512.271                                    :Signiﬁcantly, it is only in the comparison of the two  registers that we ﬁnd the
line=2920 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.511,488.347,391.381,501.348 iscore=0.27                      :evidence that / arpa/ and / ara/ are related as strong–weak allomorphs, since in
line=2921 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.481,475.456,391.362,486.429 iscore=0.20                                                   :neither register taken on its own is there is a morphosyntactic feature value which is
line=2922 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.481,462.506,391.292,473.479 iscore=0.12                                                   :realized by both / arpa/ and / ara/. Since it appears that all adults in traditional
line=2923 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,449.615,391.302,460.588 iscore=0.25                                                   :Kayardild society both composed and sang songs and thus had mastery over both the
line=2924 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,436.665,391.332,447.637 iscore=0.21                                                   :spoken  and sung registers, and since the morphological system in both registers is so
line=2925 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,423.764,391.332,434.736 iscore=0.29                                                   :similar, it is reasonable to assume that speakers possessed a single grammar which
line=2926 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,410.813,391.322,421.786 iscore=0.31                                                   :underlay all forms. Accordingly, when analysing Kayardild morphology, evidence is
line=2927 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,397.912,391.332,408.885 iscore=0.10                                                   :considered from both registers. The correct derivation of register-appropriate forms
line=2928 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.441,385.022,391.352,398.022 iscore=0.25:is included in the formal account Kayardild’s realizational morphology in Chapter 11.

doc_id=round-2013 page=82 block_id=82-4 bbox=57.6,352.478,149.565,365.441 label=bbt 2929 2929
line=2929 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,352.478,149.565,365.441:3.4 The termination

doc_id=round-2013 page=82 block_id=82-5 bbox=57.6,84.851,391.62,345.312 label=bbb 2930 2949
line=2930 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.6,333.346,272.968,345.312                                            :3.4.1 The termination is not a nominative case marker
line=2931 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,317.453,391.471,328.426 iscore=0.13                                                        :In the analysis proposed in this book, all Kayardild words end at the morphomic level
line=2932 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.6,304.503,391.491,316.777 iscore=0.27                                    :of representation with a meaningless morphome t, the termination. The termination
line=2933 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,291.612,391.531,302.584 iscore=0.17                                                       :is posited in order to account for a set of phenomena all related to the right edge of
line=2934 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.61,278.661,391.55,290.528 iscore=0.17                                  :the Kayardild word.  Some  of these are treated by Evans (1995a) in terms of a
line=2935 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.68,265.77,391.62,278.771 iscore=0.07:‘nominative’ sufﬁx and some  in terms of special, word-ﬁnal allomorphs of mor-
line=2936 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.749,252.82,391.58,265.095 iscore=0.13                                    :phemes.  Here I provide an argument for why t is not a nominative morpheme and
line=2937 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.699,239.919,391.61,252.194 iscore=0.28       :why  the ﬁnal /a/ vowel of certain verb forms is better analysed as t than as a tamt
line=2938 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.689,226.969,97.346,237.941 iscore=0.06                           :inﬂection.
line=2939 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.638,214.078,391.59,226.352 iscore=0.00       :   Let us refer to an analysis of Kayardild which invokes a nominative (nom) sufﬁx
line=2940 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.66,201.187,391.6,214.187 iscore=0.14        :rather than t as one which adopts a ‘nominative (nom) hypothesis’. The nominative
line=2941 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.66,188.236,391.58,200.103 iscore=0.31                                  :hypothesis gains initial plausibility from a set of observations listed in Table 3.18.
line=2942 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.65,175.335,391.57,187.61 iscore=0.17                                     :A  key fact here is that the phonological realization of t is zero if it follows a double
line=2943 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,162.385,347.282,173.358 iscore=0.33                                                       :vowel /aa/ or /uu/, or an /a/ vowel after a stem of more than two morae.
line=2944 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.609,149.484,391.55,161.351 iscore=0.20     :   The ﬁrst observation (Table 3.18(a)) is that all verbal words are minimally three
line=2945 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.68,136.534,391.56,147.506 iscore=0.17                                                        :morae  in length and since most end in /a/ or /uu/ they do not end in any overt
line=2946 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.68,123.643,391.59,135.917 iscore=0.11                                    :exponent  of t. The nominative hypothesis supposes that nom is simply not present
line=2947 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.66,110.692,391.58,121.665 iscore=0.31                                                        :at the end of these words. Of course this makes sense given that they are verbs.
line=2948 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.66,97.801,391.58,109.668 iscore=0.19                                   :The  second observation (Table 3.18(b)) is that most (non-nominative) case marked
line=2949 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,84.851,391.471,95.823 iscore=0.11                                                         :nominal  words also end in /a/ or /uu/, and so also do not end in any overt exponent

doc_id=round-2013 page=83 block_id=83-7 bbox=57.329,124.021,391.45,433.42 label=bt 2969 2992
line=2969 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.43,421.146,391.271,433.42                                                                                           :of t, and so the nominative hypothesis supposes that nom is not present there either.
line=2970 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,408.245,391.331,420.52 iscore=0.20                             :The  ﬁnal observation (Table 3.18(c,d)) is that overt t appears on two classes of
line=2971 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,395.354,391.361,407.629 iscore=0.36                                                  :nominals: those which are otherwise case-less, and which are taken to be inﬂected
line=2972 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.41,382.403,391.351,395.404 iscore=0.13                     :for nom, and those which are inﬂected with the set of ‘adnominal’ case values, which
line=2973 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,369.513,391.331,382.513 iscore=0.13:are then taken to be inﬂected for ‘adnominal case’ plus nom (Evans 1995a:136–7). The
line=2974 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.35,356.562,391.321,368.837 iscore=0.36                                                  :nom  hypothesis then is that the nom sufﬁx is a morphologically meaningful sufﬁx
line=2975 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,343.661,391.301,354.634 iscore=0.23                                                                                                  :whose  distribution is governed by  morphological  categories. However  a closer
line=2976 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,330.711,366.702,341.683 iscore=0.09                                                                                                  :examination  of the facts shows that the true generalizations are phonological.
line=2977 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.349,317.81,391.37,330.81 iscore=0.20                                           :   First we can note that the ‘adnominal case’ sufﬁxes often end in consonants or the
line=2978 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.42,304.859,391.4,317.134 iscore=0.13                                                                                :short high vowel /i/ or /u/. Examples are the origin case realized phonologcially (via
line=2979 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.49,291.968,391.39,304.243 iscore=0.21                                                                               :μorig)  by /wa  /, the privative case realized phonologcially (via μpriv) by /wari/
line=2980 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.48,279.018,391.44,291.293 iscore=0.46                                                                               :and  associative case realized phonologically (via μassoc) by  / uru/. These all
line=2981 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.48,266.127,391.38,278.402 iscore=0.31                                                                               :require an overt realization of t after them on phonological grounds (though once
line=2982 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,253.226,391.37,264.199 iscore=0.25                                                                       :ﬁnal /i/ and /u/ are followed by /a/, the resulting strings /ia/ and /ua/ often reduce
line=2983 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.42,240.276,391.341,251.248 iscore=0.25                                                                      :phonetically to [i] and [u]). When we take a second look at the few other inﬂectional
line=2984 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.47,227.385,391.45,238.358 iscore=0.22                                                                       :sufﬁxes in Kayardild which also end in /i/ or /u/ we ﬁnd that they too are followed by
line=2985 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.549,214.434,296.888,225.418 iscore=0.22                                                                     :overt /a/. (No other inﬂectional sufﬁxes end in consonants.)
line=2986 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=67.446,201.555,391.428,213.829 iscore=0.14                                                                             :   What  I have analysed in this book as the morphomic locative (μloc) is usually
line=2987 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.468,188.604,391.339,201.604 iscore=0.14                  :the ‘locative case’ in Evans’ (1995a) system, a sufﬁx which functions as the (relational)
line=2988 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.438,175.713,391.348,186.686 iscore=0.07                                                                                                 :locative case, the modal locative, and complementizing locative cases, none of which
line=2989 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.438,162.763,391.368,175.038 iscore=0.07                                                                             :are adnominal  cases. The phonological realization of μloc is /ki/ which ends in /i/
line=2990 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.428,149.862,391.348,162.862 iscore=0.32                          :and  so is followed regularly by t /a/ at the end of a word, as in (3.25a). On Evans’
line=2991 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.418,136.971,391.289,149.246 iscore=0.16                                                                             :analysis that /a/ vowel is not nom, but rather part of an allomorph of μloc which
line=2992 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.329,124.021,236.539,135.888 iscore=0.19                                                                           :ends in /ia/, as shown for example in (3.25b).

doc_id=round-2013 page=83 block_id=83-8 bbox=57.329,65.878,287.128,116.487 label=bb 2993 2996
line=2993 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.329,104.62,216.114,116.487    :(3.25)  a. dathinkiya    b. dathinkiya
line=2994 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=107.083,91.729,211.482,105.365 iscore=0.00            :            at̪in+ki-a       at̪in+kia
line=2995 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=103.068,78.828,287.128,91.103 iscore=0.00                      :           that-μloc-t      that-complementizing.loc
line=2996 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=103.018,65.878,248.545,78.152 iscore=0.50:           that-cmp         (after Evans 1995a)

line=3075 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,462.546,391.54,473.518                                                                                            :When   a Kayardild word appears in a syntactic setting it appears in an appropriately
line=3076 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,449.655,391.461,462.655 iscore=0.14                      :inﬂected form. Since a word’s syntactic environment partly determines its form, it
line=3077 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,436.704,391.461,447.677 iscore=0.14                                                                              :makes  sense to speak of a transfer of information between the syntactic and the
line=3078 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,423.813,391.471,434.786 iscore=0.14                                                                              :morphological  components  of the Kayardild grammar. The  remainder of this book
line=3079 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,410.863,391.481,421.836 iscore=0.23                                                                              :will be concerned with the morphological and syntactic correlates of that transfer and
line=3080 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,397.962,391.481,408.935 iscore=0.23                                                  :will progressively adduce a  formal account  of the inﬂectional system. For  the
line=3081 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.58,385.071,391.471,396.123 iscore=0.08                                                    :purposes of formalization, it will be assumed that a morphosyntactic representation
line=3082 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.58,372.121,391.471,383.093 iscore=0.36                                                                              :is calculated for each word in a  sentence. This provides all of the information
line=3083 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.58,359.23,391.54,370.282 iscore=0.21                          :required by the realizational morphology for spelling out an appropriately inﬂected
line=3084 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,346.279,378.173,357.252 iscore=0.20                                                                               :form  of the word, in a manner which can then be interpreted by the phonology.
line=3085 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.559,333.378,391.501,344.351 iscore=0.14                                                                             :   The current chapter provides a preliminary orientiation to the issues which will be

line=3090 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.421,268.795,391.302,280.692 iscore=0.40                                    :features in }4.1, morphological realization in }4.2, feature co-occurence restrictions

doc_id=round-2013 page=86 block_id=86-5 bbox=57.54,87.795,391.567,202.218 label=bbb 3094 3102
