line=5369 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.39,527.112,391.291,538.085 iscore=0.21                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    :matrix argument  for which the VP supplies a second predicate). The nominals jaya
line=5370 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.39,514.212,391.331,527.212 iscore=0.23                                                                                                                                                                                                       :dukurdukuya  ‘with wet feet’ and mirray ‘in comfort’ are second predicate DPs which
line=5371 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.44,501.321,391.44,512.293 iscore=0.21                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 :pertain to the semantic argument that is both the matrix object and the implicit
line=5372 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,488.37,391.39,500.645 iscore=0.07                                                                                                                                                                                      :embedded   subject. line=5373 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.46,475.479,391.38,487.754 iscore=0.27                                                                                                                                                                                                                 :instantiated and neither inﬂect for embedded tama:continuous. line=5513 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.429,552.994,391.4,563.967 iscore=0.21                                                                                            :meaning  the situation is different. Kayardild has several classes of inherently loca-

line=5517 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.479,501.361,391.4,513.636 iscore=0.07                                            :heads  the NP  in a predicate DP, the DP  does not inﬂect for tama:instantiated

doc_id=round-2013 page=155 block_id=155-4 bbox=57.301,113.643,391.42,473.518 label=bb 5622 5649
line=5622 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,462.546,391.331,473.518                                                                                         :Many  Australian languages freely permit the juxtaposition of multiple, coreferential,
line=5623 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.43,449.655,391.4,461.522 iscore=0.36                                                         :nominal  constituents within the same clause (Blake 1987:92,106; Sadler and Nordlin-
line=5624 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.45,436.704,391.361,449.704 iscore=0.20                          :ger 2006a) and this is also true of Kayardild (see Evans 1995a:250–1; and Chapter 7).
line=5625 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,423.813,391.351,434.786 iscore=0.20                                                                             :Given  that such multiple, coreferential nominal constituents can be adjacent to one
line=5626 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,410.863,391.37,421.836 iscore=0.20                                                                              :another, one might  question the need to posit a DP constituent at all. While the
line=5627 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,397.962,391.351,408.935 iscore=0.31                                                                             :argument  that there is no evidence for DP (or NP) can be upheld for some Australian
line=5628 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.43,385.071,391.37,396.938 iscore=0.19                                                        :languages (e.g. Kalkutungu, Blake 1979, 1983; Warlpiri, Hale 1981; Jiwarli, Austin
line=5629 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.41,372.121,391.301,383.988 iscore=0.12                                                       :2001), this is not the case for Kayardild, in which clear evidence can be found for
line=5630 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.41,359.23,391.38,370.202 iscore=0.25                                                   :DP  from the ﬁxed interpretation of nominal words based upon their position within
line=5631 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.41,346.279,391.311,359.279 iscore=0.23                          :the phrase (Evans 1995a:233–5; see also similar arguments with respect to Gooniyandi
line=5632 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.45,333.378,391.42,345.246 iscore=0.17                                                        :in McGregor   1990; and Martuthunira  in Dench 1995). Consider the two syntactic

line=5636 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.369,281.696,391.361,293.563 iscore=0.13                                                      :   The reliability of the interpretations in Table 6.1 stems from the fact that within a
line=5637 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.36,268.795,391.311,279.767 iscore=0.00                                                 :DP,  determiners are followed by numbers,  which are followed by modiﬁers.  The

line=5640 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.311,230.003,210.173,240.976 iscore=0.23                                                :the fact that modiﬁers precede a head.
line=5641 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.26,217.112,391.291,230.112 iscore=0.15                          :   Data as in Tables 6.1–6.2 support the conclusion that nominal words appear within
line=5642 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.301,204.161,391.251,215.134 iscore=0.08                                                                            :contiguous units, inside of which function is restricted according to relative linear

line=5644 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.301,178.31,391.201,189.283 iscore=0.13                                                                             :that unit is referred to here as the DP. Presumably too, although the language permits

line=5649 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.46,113.643,391.39,124.616 iscore=0.08                                                                              :from  the DP under the analysis proposed here. The constituent which occupies this

doc_id=round-2013 page=172 block_id=172-4 bbox=57.491,365.68,391.391,416.28 label=btbt 6246 6249

doc_id=round-2013 page=172 block_id=172-5 bbox=57.491,307.537,391.441,358.146 label=btbbt 6250 6253
line=6250 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.491,346.279,391.441,358.146:An  initial example of juxtaposition is given in (7.2), in which the juxtaposed DPs
line=6251 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,333.378,391.371,344.351 iscore=0.27          :are shown  in bold type (the polylexemic DP is also bracketed). The two DPs share
line=6252 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,320.428,391.381,331.401 iscore=0.27          :the same  morphosyntactic   features, they are coreferential, and both are direct
line=6253 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,307.537,102.703,318.51 iscore=0.09           :object DPs.

line=6261 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.547,177.853,391.448,188.825 iscore=0.08                                                                      :revision is made. The relationship of juxtaposition to passivization, topicalization,

line=6264 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.567,139.061,391.408,152.061 iscore=0.29:phrase’ in the non-surface syntax, to which the answer is negative. In }7.5 juxtapos-

doc_id=round-2013 page=178 block_id=178-2 bbox=57.6,591.078,323.625,604.041 label=tbt 6450 6450
line=6450 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,591.078,323.625,604.041:7.4 Juxtaposed DPs do not constitute a domain of concord

doc_id=round-2013 page=178 block_id=178-3 bbox=57.53,158.455,391.6,582.818 label=tbb 6451 6483
line=6451 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,571.846,391.471,582.818                                                                                                   :The  existence of sets of DPs that share a similar function and identical morphosyn-
line=6452 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,558.945,391.481,569.918 iscore=0.29                                                                                       :tactic features raises the question of whether there is some top-down principle which
line=6453 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,545.994,391.481,556.967 iscore=0.15                                                           :ensures that similarly functioning DPs are inﬂected identically, or instead whether
line=6454 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,533.094,391.531,544.066 iscore=0.14                                                          :the identity in the inﬂections is merely an epiphenomenal reﬂection of the fact that
line=6455 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,520.143,391.491,531.116 iscore=0.29                                                                                      :each DP  has acquired identical features independently of the others, by virtue of its
line=6456 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,507.252,391.521,518.225 iscore=0.36                                                                                      :function. Within the framework  being used here, the former view would be oper-
line=6457 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.61,494.351,391.441,507.352 iscore=0.23                                                         :ationalized by positing something like a ‘juxtapositional phrase’ (JP) in the non-
line=6458 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,481.401,391.511,492.373 iscore=0.25                                                                                      :surface syntax, which would dominate all DPs with similar function; features would
line=6459 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.61,468.5,391.531,479.473 iscore=0.31                                                                                        :attach directly to the JP node and from there would percolate down to the DPs below,
line=6460 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.61,455.549,391.471,466.522 iscore=0.12                                                          :thereby ensuring that they were inﬂected similarly. The latter view would reject the
line=6461 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,442.659,146.057,453.631 iscore=0.15                                                                                      :existence of such a JP.
line=6462 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.519,429.708,391.451,440.681 iscore=0.00                                                                                     :   The question can be settled on empirical grounds. We began the chapter with a
line=6463 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,416.817,391.431,427.79 iscore=0.36                                                                                       :prelimary proposal that juxtaposed DPs share features and functions, but it is not the
line=6464 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,403.867,391.491,414.839 iscore=0.29                                                                                      :case that DPs always share their morphosyntactic features just because they are co-
line=6465 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,390.966,391.471,401.938 iscore=0.23                                                                                      :referential/coordinated and share the same semantic/grammatical role. There are two
line=6466 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.56,378.075,391.411,389.972 iscore=0.13                                             :reasons for this. In }5.6.2 we saw that there exist certain lexical classes of nominals
line=6467 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.53,365.124,391.461,378.125 iscore=0.27                                                         :which, if they occupy the head N position in NP, will override the DP’s semantic/
line=6468 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.59,352.234,391.521,365.234 iscore=0.33                                                         :grammatical  role (i) as the determinant of the DP’s  mother  VP  node, thereby

doc_id=round-2013 page=189 block_id=189-3 bbox=57.43,410.678,118.977,423.641 label=bt 6853 6853
line=6853 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,410.678,118.977,423.641:7.8 Summary

doc_id=round-2013 page=189 block_id=189-4 bbox=57.43,94.23,391.877,402.418 label=bb 6854 6877
line=6854 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,391.446,391.38,402.418                                                                                                               :This chapter began  with a survey of the functions of juxtaposition in Kayardild in
line=6855 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.43,378.495,391.39,390.392 iscore=0.31                              :}7.1. At that point the DPs which collocated with one another in order to fulﬁl such
line=6856 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.539,365.594,391.48,378.595 iscore=0.19:functions shared identical inﬂectional features. In }7.2–}7.4 a range of cases were
line=6857 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.569,352.644,391.51,365.644 iscore=0.17                                         :considered in which  the same  functions resulted even when the DPs’  inﬂectional
line=6858 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.639,339.743,391.609,350.716 iscore=0.27                                                                                                 :features differed, leading us to reject an analysis in which the sharing of features is
line=6859 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.639,326.842,391.539,339.842 iscore=0.20                                                                    :due to the presence of a ‘juxtapositional phrase’ node in the non-surface syntax, from
line=6860 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.688,313.892,391.579,324.864 iscore=0.36                                                                                                 :which  the common  features would all percolate. Instead, the sharing of features arises
line=6861 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.688,300.991,391.659,311.963 iscore=0.08                                                                                                 :epiphenomenally   as an indirect consequence of shared semantic and grammatical
line=6862 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.688,288.04,391.639,299.013 iscore=0.27                                                                      :characteristics. Crucially, these shared characteristics on their own are not sufﬁcient
line=6863 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.738,275.139,391.659,286.112 iscore=0.09                                                                     :to guarantee shared inﬂection in every instance, because under deﬁnable conditions
line=6864 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.738,262.189,391.679,273.162 iscore=0.17                                                                     :their effect on inﬂection is overridden, leading predictably to the discrepancies that
line=6865 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.738,249.298,116.647,260.271 iscore=0.17                                                                                                 :were observed.
line=6866 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=67.697,236.348,391.718,248.245 iscore=0.08                                                        :   In the second half of the chapter beginning with }7.5, juxtaposition was employed
line=6867 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.798,223.457,391.698,234.429 iscore=0.18                                                                                                 :as a tool for interpreting the syntactic structure of DPs lacking a head N of NP. This
line=6868 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.798,210.506,391.768,221.479 iscore=0.29                                                                     :enabled  the existence of a range of syntactic structures to be conﬁrmed, whose
line=6869 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.847,197.605,391.758,208.578 iscore=0.31                                                                                                 :validity had been assumed  in earlier chapters but not yet demonstrated. The logic
line=6870 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.847,184.714,391.828,196.611 iscore=0.21                                                        :was extended  to narrow scope negation in }7.6 and second predicates in }7.7. Taking
line=6871 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.917,171.764,391.867,182.737 iscore=0.06                                                                                                 :a broader view, an insight into the nature of DP juxtaposition in Kayardild leads to a
line=6872 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.917,158.873,391.848,169.846 iscore=0.12                                                                     :highly uniﬁed  analysis of attested syntactic structures in the language, pivoting
line=6873 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.917,145.923,391.798,156.895 iscore=0.14                                                                     :around  the fact that a large number  of structural positions may be left unﬁlled.
line=6874 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.907,133.022,391.877,143.994 iscore=0.14                                                                     :The  counterpoint to this is that the facts of inﬂection, driven by feature attachment
line=6875 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.857,120.071,391.828,131.044 iscore=0.14                                                                     :and  downwards  percolation, are blind to whether terminal nodes are ﬁlled or not,
line=6876 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.847,107.18,391.738,118.153 iscore=0.15                                                                      :and therefore remain fully commensurate across a broad range of superﬁcially rather
line=6877 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.798,94.23,135.839,105.202 iscore=0.08                                                                                                   :different structures.

doc_id=round-2013 page=190 block_id=190-1 bbox=93.4,563.391,102.923,585.338 label=tt 6878 6878
line=6878 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.4,563.391,102.923,585.338:    8

doc_id=round-2013 page=190 block_id=190-2 bbox=93.4,511.683,247.808,533.63 label=tb 6879 6879
line=6879 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.4,511.683,247.808,533.63:    Feature percolation

doc_id=round-2013 page=190 block_id=190-3 bbox=57.54,397.962,391.54,473.518 label=bt 6880 6885
line=6880 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,462.546,391.411,473.518                                                     :This chapter sets out in more detail the nature of feature percolation, the mechanism
line=6881 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.6,449.655,391.461,461.552 iscore=0.21:proposed  in }4.5.4 to regulate the transfer of morphosyntactic features from the non-
line=6882 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,436.704,391.421,447.677 iscore=0.23            :surface syntactic nodes to which  they ﬁrst attach, down  to the terminal nodes
line=6883 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.54,423.813,391.491,436.814 iscore=0.08           :corresponding  to individual words. We   begin with  a discussion of Kayardild’s
line=6884 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,410.863,391.54,421.836 iscore=0.33                                          :realizational morphology, the component of the grammar that will have to interpret
line=6885 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,397.962,250.238,408.935 iscore=0.17                                         :the feature structures that percolation generates.

doc_id=round-2013 page=190 block_id=190-4 bbox=57.6,365.478,300.891,378.441 label=bbt 6886 6886
line=6886 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,365.478,300.891,378.441:8.1 Considerations from the realizational morphology

doc_id=round-2013 page=190 block_id=190-5 bbox=57.381,87.822,391.511,357.218 label=bbb 6887 6907
line=6887 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,346.246,391.471,357.218                                                                 :A question that must be addressed by any theory that relates the syntax of a language
line=6888 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,333.345,391.501,344.318 iscore=0.19                                                     :to its realizational morphology is how much if any of the linear ordering that appears
line=6889 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,320.394,391.461,331.367 iscore=0.22                                                     :in the latter ought to be derived from the former and how much ought to be a matter
line=6890 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,307.494,391.471,318.466 iscore=0.22                                                     :for the morphology  alone. Without doubt some languages exist in which morpho-
line=6891 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,294.543,391.431,305.516 iscore=0.17                                                     :logical order corresponds in a non-trivial manner to syntactic structure, and Kayar-
line=6892 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,281.652,391.501,292.625 iscore=0.29                                                     :dild is among them.  The basic empirical observation, that a parallel can often be
line=6893 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.6,268.751,391.471,281.752 iscore=0.14                        :found  between the linear order of features’ morphological realizations (from the
line=6894 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.62,255.801,391.491,266.773 iscore=0.15                                                    :lexical stem outwards) and the relative embedding of the syntactic objects with which
line=6895 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.62,242.9,391.511,255.9 iscore=0.21                           :the features are associated (from the terminal node upwards) is the core of Baker’s
line=6896 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.62,229.949,391.471,242.95 iscore=0.14  :(1985) Mirror Principle, Sadock’s (1991) Linearity Constraints, and Evans’ (1995a:107)
line=6897 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.491,217.059,391.441,228.031 iscore=0.33                       :Concentric Scoping  Principle which applies to Kayardild; it also ﬁgures in Ander-
line=6898 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.481,204.108,391.431,217.108 iscore=0.23:son’s (1992:94ff ) Layering Principle, and falls out by default in Nordlinger’s (1998)
line=6899 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.451,191.217,391.362,202.19 iscore=0.21                                                    :Constructive Case theory. On the other hand there is no shortage of languages in
line=6900 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.451,178.267,391.381,189.239 iscore=0.14                       :which  the relationship between the order of inﬂectional morphs  and  syntax is
line=6901 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.441,165.366,391.371,177.233 iscore=0.33                             :tenuous at best and theories such as Paradigm Function Morphology (Stump  2001)
line=6902 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.391,152.415,391.332,163.388 iscore=0.36                                                   :do  not assume any  ordering to be supplied by the syntax. Thus, although many
line=6903 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.391,139.514,391.232,152.515 iscore=0.21                      :languages’ realizational morphology could be described in such a way as to relate
line=6904 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,126.624,391.292,137.596 iscore=0.14                                                   :morphological  order to syntactic structure, few of them must be. In the case of
line=6905 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,113.673,391.272,124.646 iscore=0.29                                                   :Kayardild, though, there is no question: syntax will have to provide at least some
line=6906 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,100.772,391.322,111.745 iscore=0.36                                                   :information about ordering to the realizational morphology, a point also made by
line=6907 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.381,87.822,306.234,99.689 iscore=0.17                               :Sadler and Nordlinger (2006b). The argument runs as follows.

doc_id=round-2013 page=191 block_id=191-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,167.207,633.882 label=tt 6908 6908
line=6908 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,167.207,633.882:170    Feature percolation

doc_id=round-2013 page=191 block_id=191-2 bbox=57.421,514.212,391.401,602.718 label=tbtt 6909 6915
line=6909 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.38,591.746,391.372,602.718                                                               :   In the general case the relative order of the realization of two feature values in
line=6910 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.421,578.795,391.381,589.768 iscore=0.07                                                  :Kayardild cannot be predicted on the basis of the identity of those values alone. The
line=6911 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.421,565.904,391.381,577.771 iscore=0.19:two words  in (8.1a,b) are inﬂected for exactly the same feature values yet the order is
line=6912 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.441,552.954,391.381,564.821 iscore=0.19                            :contrastive. The reason is that the word forms  in (8.1a,b) correspond to different
line=6913 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.461,540.063,391.391,551.93 iscore=0.23                             :syntactic structures, summarized diagrammatically in Figure 8.1(a,b), which displays
line=6914 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.481,527.112,391.401,538.085 iscore=0.21                                                  :the key syntactic nodes that are superordinate to the terminal, lexical node and the
line=6915 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.481,514.212,276.318,525.184 iscore=0.14                                                  :attachment  of morphosyntactic feature values to them.

doc_id=round-2013 page=191 block_id=191-3 bbox=57.481,443.178,382.476,506.678 label=tbtb 6916 6920
line=6916 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.481,494.811,282.609,506.678            :(8.1) a. karndirnurruwalad        b. karndiwalanurru
line=6917 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6 bbox=93.301,481.92,293.452,495.556 iscore=0.33                      :         ka  i- uru+palat̪-ta        ka  i+palat̪- uru-a
line=6918 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=93.331,468.969,290.68,481.244 iscore=0.33                               :         wife-μassoc-μpl-t           wife-μpl-μassoc-t
line=6919 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=93.331,456.068,272.004,468.343 iscore=1.00                              :         wife-assoc-pl               wife-pl-assoc
line=6920 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=93.39,443.178,382.476,456.178 iscore=0.22:         ‘many (men) with wives’     ‘(man) with many  wives’ (E106.ex.3-23a,b)

doc_id=round-2013 page=191 block_id=191-4 bbox=121.5,421.609,147.126,433.722 label=tbbt 6921 6921
line=6921 fonts=AGHLDA+MinionPro-Regular-12.1 bbox=121.5,421.609,147.126,433.722:               num:pl

doc_id=round-2013 page=191 block_id=191-5 bbox=57.37,343.801,351.317,382.07 label=tbbb 6922 6923
line=6922 fonts=AGHLDA+MinionPro-Regular-12.1 bbox=164.314,369.932,348.679,382.07                                                                         :                           N                                            N
line=6923 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-6.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-9.9,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-8.4 bbox=57.37,343.801,351.317,354.848 iscore=0.00:FIGURE 8.1 Attachment of case and number features to syntactic nodes in (8.1a,b)

line=6932 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.375,205.395,391.296,218.395 iscore=0.21                                        :features are higher than ‘1’ features, and in the realizational morphology we can say
line=6933 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-6.6,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.365,192.494,391.345,205.495 iscore=0.14                      :that the linear order of features’ realization must be num1>case1>num2>case2. Such

line=6936 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.394,153.803,391.335,164.776 iscore=0.21                                                                                           :on  embedding   in Kayardild which  would  ensure  this. Nevertheless, beyond its
line=6937 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.394,140.853,391.305,153.853 iscore=0.27                                                              :bare technical feasibility there are questions over how coherently an ‘order-free
line=6938 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.315,127.952,391.176,140.952 iscore=0.25                                  :diacritic’ analysis could capture the nature of the system. Speciﬁcally, the diacritic

line=6940 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-6.2 bbox=57.285,102.046,391.389,114.375 iscore=0.14                                                 :between  feature values to the correct features (for example to case1 then case2 and

doc_id=round-2013 page=192 block_id=192-2 bbox=57.461,501.311,391.511,603.613 label=tb 6944 6951
line=6944 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.511,603.613                     :subscripts 1 and 2, these stipulations would need to be repeated independently for
line=6945 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.511,589.768 iscore=0.14                               :each pair of features, and the fact that syntactic and morphological ordering align in

doc_id=round-2013 page=192 block_id=192-4 bbox=57.59,191.252,391.739,460.618 label=bbt 6953 6973
line=6953 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,449.646,391.501,460.618                                        :Notwithstanding  the discussion above regarding ordering, the guiding assumption
line=6954 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,436.695,391.491,447.668 iscore=0.27                            :made  here is that the representation which is passed from the syntax to the realiza-
line=6955 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,423.794,391.491,434.767 iscore=0.13                            :tional morphology is as minimal as possible. For that reason, information related to
line=6956 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,410.844,391.511,421.816 iscore=0.27                            :syntactic hierarchy will be kept to a bare minimum, and a relatively large amount of
line=6957 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,397.953,391.491,408.926 iscore=0.27:sufﬁx ordering will need to be determined by the realizational morphology on its
line=6958 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,385.062,391.511,396.035 iscore=0.23                            :own.  (An alternative account would place more of the information about syntactic
line=6959 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,372.112,391.54,383.084 iscore=0.25                             :embedding   into the representation generated by feature percolation, and thereby
line=6960 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,359.221,391.511,370.193 iscore=0.09                            :lighten the load of the realizational component.) The realizational morphology itself
line=6961 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,346.27,165.637,358.137 iscore=0.09       :is formalized in Chapter 11.
line=6962 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.549,333.379,391.531,344.352 iscore=0.17                          :   In addition to keeping track of ordering, the representation generated by feature
line=6963 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,320.429,391.471,331.401 iscore=0.17                           :percolation will need to convey which features potentially enter into antagonistic
line=6964 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.59,307.538,391.54,319.813 iscore=0.25        :relationships. Recall that tama stands in an antagonistic relationship to tamt and
line=6965 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.709,294.587,391.55,306.862 iscore=0.12       :neg, but only if the features involved correspond to the same clause. As we will see
line=6966 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.709,281.687,391.59,292.659 iscore=0.31                           :shortly, it will be possible to deal with both ordering and antagonism in a single stroke.
line=6967 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.668,268.796,391.63,279.768 iscore=0.20                           :   The kinds of features for which multiple values can be contrastively ordered on
line=6968 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.709,255.845,391.67,268.12 iscore=0.20        :one Kayardild word are tama, tamt, and neg (attaching to VP nodes in two clauses,
line=6969 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.729,242.944,391.67,255.219 iscore=0.12       :one of which is embedded  in the other) and case and number (attaching to DP or
line=6970 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.799,229.994,391.709,240.966 iscore=0.31                          :NP  nodes  in two DPs, one  of which is embedded  in the other). All instances of
line=6971 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.799,217.093,391.739,228.066 iscore=0.19                          :contrastive ordering will therefore involve either embedded VPs or embedded DPs.
line=6972 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.799,204.142,391.68,215.115 iscore=0.15                           :Since we  have already found  good  support for analysing all embedded  VPs  as
line=6973 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.799,191.252,310.2,203.119 iscore=0.15      :occurring inside a DP we can simplify this observation to (8.2).

doc_id=round-2013 page=193 block_id=193-8 bbox=57.373,124.453,391.483,355.118 label=btbbb 7000 7014
line=7000 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,344.146,391.361,355.118                                                                                                                                           :Feature  percolation will be construed as a  process which  calculates an ordered
line=7001 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJOA+AdvP4C4E74-17.2 bbox=57.43,318.364,391.37,342.227 iscore=0.17                                                                             :collectionexample, asofh({unordereda,b}>{c,d,e)}>{setsf,g}ofi, wherefeatureavaluesthrough. Theseg areorderingsfeature valueswill ,beandwrittenin which, for
line=7002 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.46,305.413,391.37,316.386 iscore=0.14                                                                                                    :the sets {a,b}, {c,d,e} and {f,g} are each internally unordered, but are ordered with
line=7003 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-7.3 bbox=57.42,291.597,391.392,303.495 iscore=0.29                                                                                                    :respect to one another. During feature percolation, one such collection, Ci, will be
line=7004 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-7.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.451,278.697,391.346,290.547 iscore=0.23                                                                         :calculated for every syntactic node ni in the syntactic tree. The collections associated
line=7005 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.415,266.645,391.296,277.618 iscore=0.46                                                                                                                              :with terminal nodes are the ones which are passed to the realizational morphology.
line=7006 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.415,253.694,391.326,264.667 iscore=0.31                                                                                                                              :Collections that are constructed during feature percolation are distinct from the sets
line=7007 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-7.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.415,239.997,391.407,251.798 iscore=0.20                                                                         :of features, Ai, which will have attached to a node ni before percolation begins. The
line=7008 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-7.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.506,226.997,391.283,238.818 iscore=0.27                                                                       :calculations themselves are deﬁned in an iterative fashion, so that Ci always depends
line=7009 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-6.2,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.373,214.097,391.334,225.998 iscore=0.12                          :on Ai and  on Ci-1, where Ci-1 is the collection associated with node ni-1, which is the

line=7155 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,449.655,391.501,460.627 iscore=0.08                                                                                :notions: a non-surface syntactic structure; antagonism between certain features in
line=7156 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,436.704,391.471,447.677 iscore=0.17                                                                                :terms of their overt realization; and concord of features within predictable domains,

line=7158 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,410.863,391.511,421.836 iscore=0.15                                                                                :non-surface syntax. The purpose of this chapter is to compare that with alternative

line=7160 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.58,385.071,391.491,398.071 iscore=0.06:of Chapters 5–8 are sufﬁcient to account for the data by arguing against the need for

doc_id=round-2013 page=200 block_id=200-3 bbox=57.474,143.502,391.638,443.268 label=bt 7231 7253

line=7234 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.553,389.041,391.464,400.908 iscore=0.23                                   :(Chapter 5). Under the present analysis no special mechanism is required to account
line=7235 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.553,376.09,391.454,387.063 iscore=0.38                                                          :for these facts. Instead the semantic/grammatical functions of the DPs cause them to
line=7236 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.553,363.189,391.484,374.162 iscore=0.15                                                         :occupy  identical structural positions in the non-surface syntax, as a consequence of
line=7237 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.553,350.239,391.454,361.211 iscore=0.25                                                         :which  concord,  implemented  in terms  of feature percolation, causes the DPs to
line=7238 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.553,337.348,391.364,350.348 iscore=0.25                            :inherit the same features as one another—independently and in parallel. An alterna-
line=7239 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.553,324.447,391.424,337.447 iscore=0.17      :tive, non-concordial analysis is that of ‘referential case’ (Austin 1981; Dench and
line=7240 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.573,311.497,237.856,323.364 iscore=0.08                                   :Evans  1988), which requires extra machinery.
line=7241 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.522,298.596,391.501,309.568 iscore=0.07                                                         :   The notion of referential case is applied to the analysis of juxtaposed DPs and second
line=7242 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.563,285.645,391.424,296.618 iscore=0.13                                                         :predicates in Kayardild among other Australian languages in a seminal paper on case
line=7243 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.563,272.754,391.435,285.755 iscore=0.12      :stacking by Dench and Evans (1998), who state that it involves ‘the marking of some NP
line=7244 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.484,259.804,391.54,272.804 iscore=0.12       :or adverb in agreement with some other (usually core) NP in the same clause’ (1988:13).
line=7245 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.474,246.855,391.472,257.886 iscore=0.20                                                         :The key characteristic of referential case for the present purposes is that the acquisition of
line=7246 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.611,233.904,391.481,244.877 iscore=0.13                                                         :features by DPs is not always parallel and independent; rather some DPs acquire features
line=7247 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.611,221.013,391.548,233.611 iscore=0.14                                :only dependently,  subsequent to the acquisition of features by others.2 Using the
line=7248 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.606,208.145,391.458,221.145 iscore=0.17      :terminology  ‘case linkage’ Evans (1995a:331) invokes what appears to be the same
line=7249 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.636,195.194,391.571,206.167 iscore=0.23                             :mechanism   to account for the inﬂection of second predicates in Kayardild, though no
line=7250 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.656,182.294,391.638,195.294 iscore=0.23:deﬁnition is provided: ‘[I] assume that object complements are distinct constituents, and
line=7251 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.656,169.343,390.057,182.343 iscore=0.21      :that their agreement with the object is accounted for by case linkage’ Evans (1995a:331).
line=7252 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.655,156.452,391.586,167.425 iscore=0.00                                                         :   The present analysis of Kayardild does not require referential case or case linkage,
line=7253 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.696,143.502,391.586,154.474 iscore=0.21                                                         :as the same effects follow automatically from concord and the placement of DPs in

doc_id=round-2013 page=201 block_id=201-3 bbox=57.182,187.218,391.4,538.632 label=btb 7264 7290

line=7265 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.43,510.196,391.38,522.063 iscore=0.09                               :Here  I supply counterarguments to suggestions in Evans (1995b:409, 2003:221) that
line=7266 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,497.305,391.4,508.278 iscore=0.17                                                       :the opposition between sejunct and nonsejunct complementized clauses is a form of
line=7267 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,484.414,246.221,495.387 iscore=0.17                                                     :agreement  with the person value of the subject.
line=7268 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=67.359,471.464,391.361,483.361 iscore=0.17          :   To recap }5.1, complementized clauses in Kayardild will be nonsejunct when the
line=7269 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.41,458.573,391.39,469.546 iscore=0.20                         :subject is (i) ﬁrst person inclusive, or (ii) second person and the speaker wishes to
line=7270 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.41,445.622,391.38,456.595 iscore=0.20                                                     :express solidarity with the addressee; and are sejunct otherwise. In nonsejunct clauses
line=7271 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.41,432.732,391.321,445.006 iscore=0.57                                :all constituents other than topic DPs are associated with a feature +comp. In sejunct
line=7272 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.46,419.781,391.361,430.754 iscore=0.14                                                    :clauses all constituents other than focus DPs and topic DPs are in addition associated
line=7273 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.46,406.88,391.321,419.155 iscore=0.21                                 :with +sej. On constituents associated with both +comp and +sej only +sej is overtly
line=7274 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.35,393.93,391.261,405.797 iscore=0.20                               :realized due to feature antagonism. In Table 9.2 I lay out this arrangement as a
line=7275 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.281,381.029,391.261,392.002 iscore=0.19                                                   :pairing of two systems. The speaker opts between system A and system B in order to
line=7276 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.281,368.078,391.152,379.051 iscore=0.19                                                   :express solidarity with the addressee or not, though systems A and B are materially
line=7277 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.281,355.188,248.229,366.16 iscore=0.29                                                    :distinct only when the subject is second person.
line=7278 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.24,342.287,391.162,353.259 iscore=0.25                                                    :   System A  groups inclusives against all others, while system B groups second
line=7279 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.281,329.336,391.182,340.309 iscore=0.29                                                   :persons and  inclusives together in opposition to others. As far as I can ascertain
line=7280 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.281,316.435,391.211,329.436 iscore=0.13                      :the syncretisms in system A do not appear elsewhere in the world’s languages as a
line=7281 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.201,303.485,391.132,314.458 iscore=0.20                                                   :pattern of person/clusivity marking; the pattern is not mentioned for example in the
line=7282 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.201,290.594,391.192,303.594 iscore=0.15:extensive survey of person system syncretisms by  Seweirska (2004:75–81). Nor is
line=7283 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.201,277.643,391.112,288.616 iscore=0.08                                                   :system B a natural or particularly common system: from a survey of clusivity-based
line=7284 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.201,264.753,391.112,276.62 iscore=0.23                              :syncretisms Cysouw   (2005) concludes that syncretism of the second person with
line=7285 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.182,251.802,391.122,264.802 iscore=0.33                      :inclusives is just as common as with exclusives, and that neither is ‘natural’. In terms
line=7286 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.191,238.901,391.162,249.874 iscore=0.27                                                   :of their internal oppositions then, there is nothing to suggest that either system A or
line=7287 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.191,226.01,380.716,236.983 iscore=0.13                                                    :B is a system of person or clusivity marking in any typologically grounded sense.
line=7288 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.15,213.06,391.142,226.06 iscore=0.17                         :   The idiosyncrasy of the Kayardild sejunct–nonsejunct system extends also to the

line=7311 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.461,488.37,391.391,500.645 iscore=0.21                                     :number   (and  not, for example, person). The  purported link between  Kayardild
line=7312 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.451,475.479,391.342,488.479 iscore=0.21                           :sejunct–nonsejunct and  person or clusivity is not at all parallel. That is, when the
line=7313 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.451,462.529,391.342,473.501 iscore=0.27                                                        :speaker in Kayardild chooses system A or B, that choice conveys a construal of the
line=7314 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.451,449.638,391.362,460.611 iscore=0.20                            :addressee not as ﬁrst person inclusive, or exclusive, or third person, but as someone
line=7315 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.451,436.687,260.057,447.66 iscore=0.07                                                         :with whom   the speaker expresses solidarity or not.
line=7316 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.41,423.796,391.242,435.664 iscore=0.00                                   :   In sum, I am  inclined to agree with Cysouw   (2005:100), that if a typological
line=7317 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.381,410.846,391.252,423.846 iscore=0.07                           :‘phenomenon   is rare cross-linguistically, then the explanation should not invoke
line=7318 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.381,397.955,391.272,410.955 iscore=0.08       :universal characteristics’. Kayardild’s +sej system is not only rare but almost certainly
line=7319 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.342,385.054,391.203,396.027 iscore=0.14                                                        :unique. It should be analysed not as person agreement but as a binary opposition
line=7320 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.342,372.104,355.134,383.076 iscore=0.14                                                        :which  idiosyncratically entangles aspects of person, clusivity and solidarity.

doc_id=round-2013 page=202 block_id=202-3 bbox=57.533,74.865,391.707,352.641 label=b 7321 7340
line=7321 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,339.678,191.416,352.641                                                                                                                                :9.2  Parsimony   of the analysis
line=7322 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,320.446,391.507,333.446 iscore=0.07                                        :The analysis of tam inﬂection presented in Chapters 4–9 is that each Kayardild clause is
line=7323 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.64,306.697,391.533,319.82 iscore=0.27                                                                    :associated with a set, TC, comprising two tam features (the thematic tamt and athematic
line=7324 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.573,294.595,391.484,306.87 iscore=0.14                                                                                                                      :tama)  and sometimes  +neg. Some  words  in the Kayardild clause inherit and hence
line=7325 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.533,280.797,391.468,292.747 iscore=0.18                                                          :inﬂect for none of the features in TC while others inherit them, and then may inﬂect for
line=7326 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.582,268.695,391.56,280.97 iscore=0.18                                                                                                                       :either tama or tamt/neg. The disjunctive choice between tama on the one hand and
line=7327 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.602,255.804,391.705,268.079 iscore=0.20                                                                                                                     :tamt/neg  on the other is due to feature antagonism. Precisely which of tama or tamt/
line=7328 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.691,242.854,391.632,255.128 iscore=0.13                                                                                                                     :neg  gets realized is determined by the morphomic form  of the stem to which the
line=7329 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.691,229.963,391.648,242.238 iscore=0.20                                                                                         :inﬂection will attach. Stems ending morphomically in a thematic element (glossed th
line=7330 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.711,217.012,391.632,229.287 iscore=0.12                                                                   :and  j) inﬂect for tamt/neg while others inﬂect for tama. In Chapter 2 I argued that
line=7331 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.691,204.112,391.632,216.386 iscore=0.33                                                                                                                     :th and j are morphomic units which occur at the ends of lexical verbal stems, the ends of
line=7332 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.701,191.161,391.671,203.436 iscore=0.28                                                                                         :thematic case sufﬁxes, and the end of markers for the incipient values of tama and tamt.
line=7333 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.68,178.26,391.691,189.233 iscore=0.27                                                                                                                                           :   One potential concern with this analysis is circularity: have thematics been postulated
line=7334 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.721,165.369,391.622,176.342 iscore=0.06                                                                                                             :in a post hoc manner in just those places where they will lead to correct predictions about
line=7335 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.721,152.419,391.701,163.391 iscore=0.18                                                                                                             :inﬂection? The answer is no. The presence of thematics is detectable independently
line=7336 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.721,139.518,391.701,150.491 iscore=0.08                                                                                                                                         :through their phonological realization. In underlying phonological forms they appear
line=7337 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.721,126.567,391.632,137.54 iscore=0.21                                                                                                                                          :uniformly as /t/ and /c/. According to the regular phonological rules of Kayardild those
line=7338 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.721,113.667,391.632,124.639 iscore=0.07                                                                                                                                         :underlying segments may surface unchanged or may leave indirect phonological traces
line=7339 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHJOA+AdvP4C4E74-17.2,AGHLOB+AdvTT6120e2aa+03-11.6,AGHMDA+AdvTT6120e2aa+02-11.9,AGHMEB+AdvOT1ef757c0+01-12.2 bbox=57.721,87.815,391.707,111.689 iscore=0.17:ofderetrotheirﬂpresenceexion in, thesuchderivationsas when the/ . .retro. t̪+ɳﬂaexŋ/,-initial/ . . . c+negativeɳaŋ/ !suf[ .ﬁ. .xna/-ŋ .a. ./].undergoesThe only
line=7340 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.701,74.865,391.671,87.139 iscore=0.33                                                                                                                       :times th and j fail entirely to appear on the surface is in cases where they are expected

line=7348 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.341,514.212,391.297,526.486 iscore=0.33                                                       :begin with μn. Diachronically these trace back to case-marked nominalizations of verbs,
line=7349 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.341,501.321,391.281,513.218 iscore=0.12                                  :but as I remarked in }2.6.8 much of the system which is ancestral to modern Kayardild
line=7350 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.331,488.37,391.434,501.37 iscore=0.06                    :inﬂection has undergone ‘morphomicization’. Erstwhile verbal thematics have become
line=7351 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.39,475.479,391.539,487.754 iscore=0.17                                                        :morphomic   th and j; erstwhile case markers have become morphomic categories that
line=7352 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,462.529,391.524,473.501 iscore=0.17                                                                             :now  realize case, tense/aspect/mood, and complementization; and erstwhile nominali-
line=7353 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.4,449.638,352.769,461.913 iscore=0.09                                                         :zers and case have become morphomic categories which realize tamt values.
line=7354 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.329,436.687,391.331,448.555 iscore=0.00                         :   The analysis of Kayardild inﬂection  in Evans (1995a) adopts  what could  be
line=7355 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,423.796,391.341,436.071 iscore=0.25                            :characterized as a more historicizing view according to which tamt sufﬁxes always
line=7356 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,410.846,391.38,423.846 iscore=0.25:attach to ‘morphologically verbal’ words, and thus thematically case-inﬂected nouns
line=7357 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.44,397.946,391.37,410.955 iscore=0.17   :must  be regarded as ‘morphologically verbalized’;3 secondly the marker μn in tamt

line=7359 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.48,372.046,391.387,384.711 iscore=0.08                       :certain tense-inﬂected verbs must be regarded as morphologically nominalized.4 In
line=7360 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.397,359.155,391.367,370.127 iscore=0.29                                                                           :the following sections I argue that this leads to an unnecessarily complex picture of

line=7363 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.357,320.363,391.377,333.363 iscore=0.08                  :inﬂectional selection which is forced to search inside a stem’s layered composition

line=7377 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.459,113.219,391.464,121.997 iscore=0.20                                                                    :inherently classed and their class changes despite there being no alteration of the syntactic environment;

doc_id=round-2013 page=206 block_id=206-4 bbox=57.604,267.753,391.565,395.896 label=bbtt 7477 7486
line=7477 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.624,384.029,391.555,395.896                                      :The clause in (9.6) contains a syntactic verb (whose stem is morphologically verbal),

line=7479 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.614,358.188,391.465,370.463 iscore=0.23:tically a DP but which carries inﬂection for verbalizing case (my thematic case),
line=7480 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.604,345.287,391.475,356.26 iscore=0.23                                                 :which  converts it into a morphologically verbal unit. The assignment of features is
line=7481 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.604,332.337,391.555,344.611 iscore=0.08:straightforward. Morphologically verbal stems inﬂect for tense and morphologically
line=7482 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.624,319.436,391.465,331.71 iscore=0.25 :nominal  stems inﬂect for modal case which is assigned to DPs. Unproblematically,
line=7483 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.624,306.485,391.565,318.76 iscore=0.23                             :although modal  case is generally assigned to DPs, it presumably cannot be assigned

doc_id=round-2013 page=208 block_id=208-3 bbox=57.59,327.845,391.739,562.426 label=bbtt 7543 7560

line=7544 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,534.567,391.69,547.567 iscore=0.14:The analysis of Kayardild tam inﬂection proposed in Chapters 4–9 does not invoke the
line=7545 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.749,521.666,391.69,532.638 iscore=0.21                                                                                                  :notion of a morphological word  class which is distinct from syntactic class. Conse-
line=7546 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.749,508.715,391.68,521.715 iscore=0.29                                                                     :quently, if there were content to Evans’ notion of morphological word class beyond its
line=7547 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.749,495.814,391.739,506.787 iscore=0.21                                                                     :use as an inﬂection-conditioning diacritic, then the analysis proposed here could be
line=7548 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.739,482.864,391.709,495.864 iscore=0.25                                              :considered wanting. Evans (1995a:177–80) argues that morphologically verbalized nom-
line=7549 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,469.973,391.024,480.946 iscore=0.07                                                                                                 :inals are indeed contentfully verbal in two respects. Here I argue against that position.
line=7550 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.688,457.023,391.64,470.023 iscore=0.15                                         :   The  ﬁrst of Evans’ two arguments   relates to verbal argument structure. It is
line=7551 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.729,444.132,391.63,457.132 iscore=0.15                                                                     :claimed  that ‘one may treat the verbal[izing] case as governing NP arguments  in
line=7552 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.729,431.181,391.56,444.181 iscore=0.08                                               :various grammatical functions’ (Evans 1995a:177), and that ‘[a] satisfactory represen-
line=7553 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.68,418.28,391.58,431.281 iscore=0.10                                                                       :tation of verbal[izing] case, then, requires verb-like argument structures’ (Evans
line=7554 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.68,405.33,391.56,417.197 iscore=0.21                                                  :1995a:178). Two lines of evidence are offered, the ﬁrst relating to main verb elision
line=7555 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.66,392.429,287.698,403.402 iscore=0.07                                                                      :and  the second to non-conﬂicting grammatical functions.
line=7556 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=67.599,379.538,391.531,391.813 iscore=0.00                                                                             :   The semantics of thematic case (verbalizing case) pertains to events of motion and
line=7557 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.63,366.588,391.461,378.485 iscore=0.20                                                         :transfer (cf }4.1.1) and it is a true observation that Kayardild main verbs in motion
line=7558 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.63,353.687,391.491,364.659 iscore=0.07                                                                                                  :and  transfer clauses are frequently omitted if the clause contains syntactic nominals
line=7559 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.63,340.736,391.54,353.011 iscore=0.14                             :inﬂected for thematic case. An example is (9.9) in which the highlighted, dative DP
line=7560 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.59,327.845,252.305,340.846 iscore=0.14                                                                     :is morphologically verbalized on Evans’ account.

doc_id=round-2013 page=208 block_id=208-4 bbox=57.6,256.743,317.975,320.312 label=bbtb 7561 7565

line=7568 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.434,210.527,391.384,221.499 iscore=0.47                                                                       :ngijinmarutha  are semantically rich enough that the nature of the event can be
line=7569 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.434,197.636,391.384,208.608 iscore=0.08                                                                                                   :recovered pragmatically. Evidence supports a pragmatic account. Kayardild main

line=7572 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.493,158.844,391.509,171.844 iscore=0.15                                          :movement  is inferable from the lexical semantics of jinarungku ‘where to’ and balungku
line=7573 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.493,145.943,391.523,158.943 iscore=0.27:‘to the west’, and in (9.11) where movement is inferable from the allative case inﬂection.

doc_id=round-2013 page=209 block_id=209-3 bbox=57.327,274.218,391.45,532.702 label=btbt 7585 7604
line=7585 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.42,519.702,391.351,532.702                                      :As  Evans notes  with respect to examples like this, ‘the meaning of certain case
line=7586 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.44,506.751,391.4,519.751 iscore=0.07:sufﬁxes includes a movement  component,  and provided that the meaning of “move-
line=7587 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.45,493.85,391.45,506.851 iscore=0.21:ment”  is expressed, whether by case sufﬁx, verb, or both, the sentence is grammatical’
line=7588 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.42,480.9,391.38,492.767 iscore=0.07                                    :(1995a:319). This account extends  without problem  to  clauses denoting transfer
line=7589 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.42,468.009,391.321,481.009 iscore=0.23      :events, and the thematic case values (Evans’ verbalizing case). The elision of main
line=7590 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.35,455.058,391.271,466.926 iscore=0.15                                 :verbs in sentences such as (9.9) furnishes no positive evidence for thematic cases
line=7591 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,442.158,225.409,453.13 iscore=0.08                                                         :possessing a verb-like argument structure.
line=7592 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.359,429.267,391.41,440.239 iscore=0.00                                                       :   The second line of evidence offered by Evans relates to the requirement on multiple
line=7593 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.4,416.316,391.327,428.213 iscore=0.07               :verb heads of Kayardild clauses discussed in }5.5.1, that they have non-contradictory
line=7594 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.357,403.455,391.357,416.455 iscore=0.08   :argument  structures. Evans’ claim (1995a:178–80) is that these restrictions on argument
line=7595 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.327,390.504,391.357,401.477 iscore=0.27                                                      :structure apply also to morphologically verbalized nominals. For example, the dative
line=7596 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.327,377.613,391.407,389.481 iscore=0.25    :sufﬁx in (9.9) governs a direct object which must be the theme (i.e. the moved or
line=7597 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.327,364.663,391.417,377.663 iscore=0.12   :transferred entity) in an event of caused movement or transfer (Evans 1995a:177–80). If
line=7598 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.327,351.762,391.367,362.735 iscore=0.07                                                      :this is true then two predictions follow. First the dative presumably should not appear in
line=7599 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.327,338.812,391.357,349.784 iscore=0.13                                                      :passivized clauses in which the theme has been promoted to subject, since the dative
line=7600 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.327,325.911,391.298,336.883 iscore=0.19                                                      :requires the theme to be an object. Secondly, dative DPs should not appear in the same
line=7601 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.327,312.96,391.397,325.235 iscore=0.12                                   :clause as DPs in the (thematic/verbalizing) donative case, since the donative requires
line=7602 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.347,300.069,391.347,311.936 iscore=0.23                                :the direct object to be the recipient (Evans 1995a:180). My corpus however contains
line=7603 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.367,287.168,391.288,298.141 iscore=0.31                                                      :examples of both constructions in the spontaneous speech of speakers in full command
line=7604 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.367,274.218,312.78,286.085 iscore=0.23                                 :of the traditional language, shown in (9.12) and (9.13) respectively.

doc_id=round-2013 page=210 block_id=210-1 bbox=249.2,621.417,391.654,634.102 label=tt 7620 7620
