doc_id=round-2013 page=210 block_id=210-2 bbox=57.441,178.311,391.699,603.613 label=tb 7621 7653
line=7621 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.531,603.613                                                                   :Sentences  (9.12) and (9.13) counterexemplify the hypothesis that morphologically
line=7622 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.62,578.795,391.531,589.768 iscore=0.25                                                                            :verbalized nominals have verb-like argument  structures. I suggest that what we are
line=7623 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.62,565.904,391.491,576.877 iscore=0.14                                                                            :witnessing in Kayardild is an instance of the phenomenon  referred to in the gram-
line=7624 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.62,552.954,391.501,564.821 iscore=0.14:maticalization literature as persistence (Hopper 1991), in which sufﬁxes that have
line=7625 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,540.063,391.55,551.036 iscore=0.25                                                                             :evolved from erstwhile free lexemes continue to exhibit quirks of synchronic behav-
line=7626 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.64,527.112,391.491,539.387 iscore=0.27                            :iour retained from their older function. It is for this reason that thematic case sufﬁxes
line=7627 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.66,514.212,391.55,525.184 iscore=0.19                                                                             :behave for the most part in a manner which is consistent with their possessing a verb-
line=7628 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.66,501.311,391.54,513.178 iscore=0.25                                                       :like argument structure. Examples such as (9.12) and (9.13) are illuminating because
line=7629 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,488.36,391.491,499.333 iscore=0.15                                                 :they show  that the sufﬁxes in modern  Kayardild have decoupled  from  their prior
line=7630 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,475.459,391.521,486.432 iscore=0.20                                                                            :status as verbs and have begun  to accrue a more  extended  range of usage. More
line=7631 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,462.509,391.531,474.784 iscore=0.20                            :generally, while it is true that thematic case inﬂections are semantically rich, and rich
line=7632 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.59,449.608,391.501,460.581 iscore=0.36                                                                            :in a sense which pertains to argument-like roles, it should be remembered that even
line=7633 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,436.658,391.491,447.63 iscore=0.29                                                 :sufﬁxes with no  verbal pedigree participate in this kind of semantic behaviour in
line=7634 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.59,423.767,391.471,435.664 iscore=0.23                                   :Kayardild, as pointed out in }3.2.6 with respect to derivational, compounded nominal
line=7635 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,410.816,391.501,421.789 iscore=0.08                                                :stems ending  in the morphomic  privative, proprietive, and associative sufﬁxes. The
line=7636 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,397.925,346.616,408.898 iscore=0.27                                                                            :contribution of argument-like semantics is not the sole preserve of verbs.
line=7637 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.599,385.024,391.55,395.997 iscore=0.09                                                :   A ﬁnal argument  given in support of morphologically verbalized nominals being
line=7638 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.65,372.074,391.61,385.074 iscore=0.27:contentfully verbal is that DPs inﬂected for thematic case cannot be relativized on or ‘be
line=7639 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,359.183,391.64,370.156 iscore=0.27                                                  :the pivot in any complex construction . . . reﬂect[ing] the less-than-full argument status
line=7640 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.64,346.232,391.531,359.233 iscore=0.21                         :of such constituents’ (Evans 1995a:180). Although it is true, there is little that follows
line=7641 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.68,333.342,391.64,344.314 iscore=0.07                                                                             :from this observation, since the only DPs which are relativized on (using an embedded
line=7642 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.68,320.391,391.592,332.258 iscore=0.14                                                      :VP  constituent) are subjects and objects, and arguably in one recorded instance (9.23), a
line=7643 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.729,307.49,391.62,319.765 iscore=0.14                                                         :case:proprietive DP; pivots in Kayardild may be subjects, possessors, objects, locations,
line=7644 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.729,294.54,391.699,307.54 iscore=0.15                          :or instruments (Evans 1995a:500–11), the latter three of which arguably fall under the
line=7645 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.719,281.639,391.699,293.536 iscore=0.27                                  :one category of V complement (i.e. direct object or locational object, cf }5.5.2). In terms
line=7646 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.699,268.688,391.55,281.02 iscore=0.20                             :of their resistance to relativization and use as pivots, DPs inﬂected for thematic case
line=7647 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.55,255.845,391.421,268.12 iscore=0.29                             :(verbalizing case) are no different from DPs inﬂected for other, athematic case values
line=7648 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.461,242.954,345.622,253.927 iscore=0.08                                                                           :of comparable semantic richness, such as privative, associative, or utilitive.
line=7649 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.42,230.003,391.461,243.004 iscore=0.25                                               :   There is no compelling reason to regard ‘morphological word class’ as possessing
line=7650 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.491,217.113,391.362,228.085 iscore=0.33                                               :content  beyond  its function as an inﬂection-conditioning diacritic, and thus the
line=7651 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.441,204.162,391.312,217.162 iscore=0.23                        :analysis proposed in Chapters 4–9, which  dispenses with the notion, does not lose
line=7652 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.441,191.261,391.342,202.234 iscore=0.15                                                                           :descriptive power by  doing so. It is entirely feasible, and more parsimonious, to
line=7653 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.441,178.311,342.71,189.283 iscore=0.31                                                :analyse Kayardild inﬂection without inﬂectional word-class conversion.

doc_id=round-2013 page=210 block_id=210-3 bbox=57.6,145.778,184.169,158.741 label=bt 7654 7654
line=7654 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2,AGHMMP+AdvOT5e4d79fc+fb-7.8 bbox=57.6,145.778,184.169,158.741:9.3 Inﬂection and recursion

doc_id=round-2013 page=210 block_id=210-4 bbox=57.54,74.853,391.471,137.518 label=bb 7655 7659
line=7655 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,126.546,391.471,137.518             :We  turn next to the topic of recursion in the inﬂectional morphology of Kayardild.
line=7656 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.55,113.655,391.441,124.627 iscore=0.21                            :Given  the nature of concord in Kayardild, our expectation is that words in deeply
line=7657 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.55,100.704,391.391,111.677 iscore=0.29:embedded   syntactic positions should typically inﬂect for large numbers of morpho-
line=7658 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.54,87.803,391.431,98.776 iscore=0.31                              :syntactic features. Moreover, since it is possible to embed constituents of the same
line=7659 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.54,74.853,391.431,85.826 iscore=0.33                              :type within one another (e.g. VP below VP; DP below DP), we expect that features

doc_id=round-2013 page=211 block_id=211-2 bbox=57.38,462.529,391.39,602.718 label=bt 7661 7671
line=7661 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.361,602.718                                                                                 :associated with those types of nodes should recur in association with single words: for
line=7662 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,578.795,391.37,591.07 iscore=0.21                       :example, we  should ﬁnd words  which inﬂect for multiple tama and tamt  features,
line=7663 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.45,565.904,391.351,578.179 iscore=0.23                     :multiple case features or multiple number features. The ﬁrst purpose of this section
line=7664 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,552.954,391.39,563.926 iscore=0.19                                          :is to conﬁrm  that in general this is indeed the case, by providing a catalogue of
line=7665 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.43,540.063,391.38,551.96 iscore=0.31                              :attested recursive morphological structures in }9.3.1. The second purpose  is to
line=7666 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,527.112,391.291,538.085 iscore=0.17                                                                     :consider the apparent existence of an upper limit to the morphological complexity
line=7667 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.39,514.212,391.311,526.109 iscore=0.27:of Kayardild words. In }9.3.2 it is argued contra claims in the literature, that any
line=7668 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,501.321,391.37,512.293 iscore=0.13                                                                      :constraints which do exist on the complexity of Kayardild words are not in essence
line=7669 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.38,488.37,391.301,500.267 iscore=0.29                             :morphological,  but syntactic. Finally in }9.4, I review existing formal studies of
line=7670 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.4,475.479,391.321,486.452 iscore=0.08                                          :Kayardild  inﬂectional recursion and  note implications for them  of the revised
line=7671 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.4,462.529,285.391,475.529 iscore=0.18                   :analysis of the Kayardild facts proposed in Chapters 4–9.

doc_id=round-2013 page=211 block_id=211-3 bbox=57.4,311.476,391.37,442.71 label=bbtt 7672 7681

line=7673 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,414.851,391.341,425.824 iscore=0.20                        :This section assembles a catalogue of all of the pairs of features which co-occur in
line=7674 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,401.901,391.321,412.873 iscore=0.07                        :Kayardild words  together with supporting examples (such a catalogue has not been

line=7676 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,376.049,391.361,387.022 iscore=0.17                        :suspicious sentence and two suspicious word forms whose syntactic or morphological
line=7677 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,363.159,388.568,374.131 iscore=0.27                        :structures are unique and whose grammaticality must be regarded with reservation.
line=7678 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.359,350.208,391.321,362.075 iscore=0.17:   Table 9.4 lists the morphosyntactic features of which multiple tokens have been
line=7679 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,337.317,391.341,348.29 iscore=0.08                         :attested, each with overt realization, in association with a single word which either
line=7680 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,324.426,391.37,335.399 iscore=0.13                         :appears in a sentential context, or is reported to have been uttered spontaneously by a

line=7710 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.469,406.662,391.461,418.937 iscore=0.00       :   There are no words inﬂected for multiple instances of +sej, +comp or negation.
line=7711 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.53,393.712,391.454,404.718 iscore=0.25                                                        :In each case, the lack of attestation stems from the fact that S presents an opaque
line=7712 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.573,380.845,391.424,393.12 iscore=0.25              :barrier to feature percolation (Chapter 8). All three of +sej, +comp, or negation
line=7713 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.523,367.894,391.404,378.867 iscore=0.25                                                       :appear  only in full clauses and not in embedded  VPs, as a result of which the
line=7714 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJOA+AdvP4C4E74-12.0 bbox=57.523,342.043,391.495,365.966 iscore=0.25                                :accumulationclausal node S00of, whichmultiplecannotcopiesoccurwould. I haverequireno instancespercolationof a wordacrosswhichthe occursmaximalin
line=7715 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.584,329.155,391.465,341.429 iscore=0.08       :sentential context and which inﬂects for multiple number values. Such a word would

doc_id=round-2013 page=215 block_id=215-2 bbox=57.341,436.687,391.37,602.718 label=btt 7823 7835
line=7823 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.351,602.718                                                                     :would  require an embedding of three DPs. On the grounds that my corpus of actual
line=7824 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.43,578.795,391.301,590.662 iscore=0.20                                   :utterances and sentences, which includes those published by Evans (1995a), contains
line=7825 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.36,565.904,391.231,576.877 iscore=0.14                                                         :no convincing evidence of DP within DP  within DP, it seems appropriate to regard
line=7826 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.36,552.954,391.311,564.821 iscore=0.14                                   :the grammaticality of (9.21) and (9.22) as questionable. This requires a little more
line=7827 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,540.063,391.271,553.063 iscore=0.08:justiﬁcation, since both words were presumably accepted by speakers during Evans’
line=7828 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.341,527.112,391.231,540.113 iscore=0.20                           :research. It is possible that the nature of speakers’ acceptance of the forms was similar
line=7829 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.35,514.212,391.291,525.184 iscore=0.20                             :to what  I experienced in the ﬁeld myself, where (younger) speakers of Kayardild
line=7830 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,501.321,391.37,512.293 iscore=0.27                                                           :accepted some  suggested forms which were known   to be, or later proved to be, ill-
line=7831 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,488.37,391.331,499.343 iscore=0.27                                                           :formed  in the traditional language, provided that the forms were  composed  of
line=7832 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,475.479,391.361,486.452 iscore=0.58                                                          :legitimate Kayardild morphs.  (It is primarily for this reason that all examples
line=7833 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,462.529,391.331,473.501 iscore=0.25                                                          :elsewhere in  this book have  deliberately been restricted to utterances recorded
line=7834 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.4,449.638,305.458,460.611 iscore=0.18                                                          :from  older speakers, or published elsewhere as full sentences.)
line=7835 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.359,436.687,377.277,448.555 iscore=0.08                                  :   For similar reasons, it seems prudent to regard example (9.23) as contentious.

doc_id=round-2013 page=216 block_id=216-2 bbox=57.522,255.817,391.759,602.718 label=tbt 7860 7886
line=7860 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.501,602.718                                                                                           :not present when  I recorded this, but was supplied later when I asked about the
line=7861 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.401,591.795 iscore=0.20:meaning  of this sentence’. If it is true that (9.23) is grammatical with initial darirra
line=7862 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.55,565.904,391.54,576.877 iscore=0.13                       :mardalaaja  then it is unique in two signiﬁcant respects. First, it contains the only
line=7863 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.59,552.954,391.57,565.228 iscore=0.21   :instance in my corpus of a word inﬂected for three case values: ngimiwaanjinabawu,
line=7864 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,540.063,391.57,551.036 iscore=0.20                                                                               :which  appears in the only DP within DP within DP attested in a sentential context.

line=7873 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.739,423.796,326.841,436.411 iscore=0.14                                                    :would  not be syntactically or morphologically unique in any way.11
line=7874 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.55,410.846,391.472,422.713 iscore=0.17                            :   The questionable status of (9.21), (9.22), and (9.23) bear signiﬁcantly on our
line=7875 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.611,397.945,391.532,408.918 iscore=0.08                                                                             :understanding  of the relationship in Kayardild between multiple feature marking
line=7876 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.611,385.054,391.482,396.921 iscore=0.08                                                       :and the syntactic structures which underlie it. If (9.21) and (9.22) are ungrammatical
line=7877 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.621,372.103,391.462,383.971 iscore=0.15                           :and  if the originally-elided material in (9.23) is assumed to have been darirra

line=7879 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.611,346.252,391.522,358.527 iscore=0.27                                                         :values marked  on a single word; (ii) case, the tam features, comp, and sej always

line=7881 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.541,320.401,391.452,332.675 iscore=0.29                                                         :sej, then comp; (iii) the attested environments of embedded VPs coincide with DPs
line=7882 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.541,307.51,391.373,319.785 iscore=0.13        :which  have no overt case marking. If on the other hand (9.23) begins with darirra
line=7883 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.522,294.559,391.442,306.427 iscore=0.20                           :mardalaaja  then none of those three generalizations holds. If (9.21) and (9.22) are
line=7884 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.531,281.668,391.422,292.641 iscore=0.15                                                                             :grammatical  then generalization (i) fails to hold. My suspicion is that the three
line=7885 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.531,268.718,391.396,280.585 iscore=0.23                                                       :generalizations are true, that (9.21) and (9.22) are ungrammatical, and that (9.23) is
line=7886 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.522,255.817,391.442,266.79 iscore=0.23                                                  :ungrammatical  with darirra mardalaaja, and grammatical with darirra mardalaaju.

line=7892 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.509,156.394,391.34,168.668 iscore=0.17:attested though is just ﬁve: number–case–case–tamt–sej   in (9.14) above. Evans

doc_id=round-2013 page=217 block_id=217-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,130.541,633.882 label=tt 7898 7898

doc_id=round-2013 page=217 block_id=217-2 bbox=57.302,268.746,391.425,602.718 label=tb 7899 7924
line=7899 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.351,602.718                                                                :which  would underlie it are both unattested in tandem. It is not the case that after
line=7900 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,578.795,391.41,589.768 iscore=0.06                                                     :some  point syntactic structures continue to increase in complexity while the morph-
line=7901 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.43,565.904,391.362,578.511 iscore=0.25                           :ology fails to keep pace;12 rather syntactic structures whose corresponding morpho-
line=7902 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.342,552.995,391.242,565.995 iscore=0.13                      :logical structure would be ‘too complex’ also fail to occur. Since the syntax and the
line=7903 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.302,540.094,391.223,551.067 iscore=0.20                                                   :morphology  both exhibit upper bounds of complexity, a question that presents itself
line=7904 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.302,527.144,391.213,538.116 iscore=0.15                                                   :is whether those upper bounds  are inherently syntactic (in which case, we might
line=7905 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.302,514.243,391.252,525.216 iscore=0.08                                                   :expect more morphological  complexity if only the syntax obliged), or morphological
line=7906 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.302,501.352,391.213,512.325 iscore=0.07                                                   :(in which case we might expect more syntactic complexity if only it were compatible
line=7907 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.302,488.402,391.272,500.269 iscore=0.14                             :with the morphology). Evans (1995b:410) argues for the latter interpretation, that it is
line=7908 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.332,475.501,391.242,486.473 iscore=0.23                                                   :the morphology   of Kayardild which  constrains the syntax, a claim repeated  in
line=7909 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.332,462.55,391.342,474.417 iscore=0.46                              :abbreviated form in Evans  and Levinson (2009:444). The claim is interesting as it
line=7910 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.372,449.659,391.282,462.66 iscore=0.08                       :implies that Kayardild is a counterexample  to the principle of ‘morphology-free
line=7911 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.332,436.709,391.302,449.709 iscore=0.29:syntax’ (Zwicky 1996). In this section I argue to the contrary that the constraints
line=7912 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.332,423.818,391.312,434.791 iscore=0.21                                                   :are mostly if not entirely inherently syntactic. There are numerous syntactic struc-
line=7913 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.332,410.867,391.242,421.84 iscore=0.33                                                    :tures which  would   be morphologically  felicitous in Kayardild yet which   are
line=7914 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.332,397.977,391.232,408.949 iscore=0.33                                                   :unattested, and there are some few syntactic structures which are attested despite
line=7915 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.332,385.086,345.284,396.058 iscore=0.25                                                   :the inability of the morphology to distinguish them overtly from others.
line=7916 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.291,372.135,391.372,385.135 iscore=0.00:   Evans (1995b:410) states that ‘there are morphologically imposed limits to the syntac-
line=7917 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.342,359.244,391.352,372.245 iscore=0.17                      :tic possibilities of recursion’ in Kayardild. To express the morphological constraints on
line=7918 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.362,346.294,391.312,359.294 iscore=0.25                      :word  structure Evans proposes a model which I will term ‘templatic opportunism’.
line=7919 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.381,333.393,391.332,344.366 iscore=0.23                                                   :Templatic opportunism states that a Kayardild word contains just one templatic slot for
line=7920 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.381,320.442,391.312,333.443 iscore=0.15  :each of Evans’ adnominal  case (corresponding on my analysis to case), relational
line=7921 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.352,307.552,391.421,319.826 iscore=0.17                               :case (also corresponding to my case), modal case (my tama), and complementiz-
line=7922 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.401,294.601,391.421,306.876 iscore=0.06                               :ing case (my +comp   and +sej), and that if any feature has two values which are to be
line=7923 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.421,281.71,391.362,292.683 iscore=0.17                                                    :realized overtly, then one value must co-opt an empty slot belonging to another feature
line=7924 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.421,268.746,391.425,281.311 iscore=0.21    :(Evans 1995b:410).13 The proposal is then that the syntax is constrained to generate just

line=7925 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-5.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4 bbox=65.4,235.957,391.404,245.989                       :   12 This alternate scenario is encountered in Old Georgian and Hurrian (Plank 1995:93). In Old Georgian

line=7930 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-5.7 bbox=57.462,188.711,391.428,199.111 iscore=0.12:A diagram  shows four ‘ranks’ of inﬂection and four groupings of inﬂectional endings: [adnominal case and
line=7931 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.415,179.265,391.42,188.043 iscore=0.19                                                         :number],  [relational case], [modal case], [associating case and complementizing case]. It is not clear if
line=7932 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4 bbox=57.415,169.819,391.42,180.219 iscore=0.17       :groupings should correspond to ranks, or if ranks are equivalent to ‘slots’ in Evans (1995b). It seems that
line=7933 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-5.7 bbox=57.446,160.373,391.436,169.151 iscore=0.11                            :ranks and slots should not be equated, since if we count number among our inﬂections, then the word
line=7934 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-8.8 bbox=57.391,150.928,391.396,159.706 iscore=0.22                             :ngurruwarrawalathinabamaruthurrka    which is reported by Evans as occurring in spontaneous speech
line=7935 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-5.7 bbox=57.391,141.482,391.404,150.975 iscore=0.25      :would  exceed the number  of available slots, with its ﬁve inﬂectional sufﬁxes. Evans (1995a) also places
line=7936 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.423,132.036,391.428,140.814 iscore=0.25                                                        :explicit caps of two overt values on relational case (which together with adnominal case approximates to
line=7937 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9 bbox=57.423,122.59,391.404,132.41 iscore=0.17                                      :my  case) and modal case (my tama)  and of one value on complementizing case (my +sej and +comp).
line=7938 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.5 bbox=57.454,113.145,389.75,122.638 iscore=0.39                                   :These caps are not mentioned in Evans (1995b) and conceptually they are fundamentally different to Evans
line=7939 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4 bbox=57.534,103.699,391.516,113.192 iscore=0.12                                  :(1995b) proposal. Evans (1995b) seeks to have the syntax constrained by limits on morphological expo-
line=7940 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.542,94.253,391.579,103.031 iscore=0.18                                                         :nence, whereas a cap that is placed on relational, modal, and complementizing case but not on adnominal
line=7941 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.542,84.807,391.532,93.585 iscore=0.12                                                          :case would constrain the system according to morphological function. Given that such functions can never
line=7942 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-8.8 bbox=57.542,75.361,391.532,84.139 iscore=0.31                               :exist or fail to exist independently of syntactic structures, a constraint on morphological function is much

doc_id=round-2013 page=218 block_id=218-1 bbox=249.2,621.417,391.654,634.102 label=t 7943 7943
line=7943 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8,AGHKOP+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I+fb-10.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.9 bbox=249.2,621.417,391.654,634.102:                                             9.3 Inﬂection and recursion   197

doc_id=round-2013 page=218 block_id=218-2 bbox=57.55,113.66,391.733,602.718 label=bt 7944 7978
line=7944 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.501,602.718                                                                                              :those structures which can be distinctly realized by the templatically opportunistic
line=7945 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,578.795,391.521,589.768 iscore=0.21                                                                                  :morphology;  should the morphology  be unable to overtly realize a given set of mor-
line=7946 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,565.904,391.59,576.877 iscore=0.21                                                                                   :phosyntactic features, then the corresponding syntactic structure will be ill-formed.
line=7947 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.6,552.954,391.56,565.228 iscore=0.08                                                               :This model correctly predicts the attested maximum of four overt exponents for case,

line=8027 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.557,475.452,391.468,486.425 iscore=0.29                                                                 :appear on several kinds of demoted logical subject DPs. A demoted logical subject DP
line=8028 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.557,462.502,391.468,474.776 iscore=0.36                                             :could then contribute a maximum of two case features (if it contained an embedded,
line=8029 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.577,449.611,391.438,461.885 iscore=0.21                                             :case-marked  DP  and were case-marked itself), yielding a total of three features. The
line=8030 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-7.6 bbox=57.527,436.229,391.426,447.633 iscore=0.20                                               :remaining DPs  in an embedded clause are all situated below VPa and so will inherit
line=8031 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.605,423.755,391.525,436.029 iscore=0.13                                             :both matrix and local tam. Most of those DPs are case:Ø DPs or case:locative DPs
line=8032 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.585,410.804,391.496,423.079 iscore=0.13                                             :whose  case:locative cannot appear overtly for morphomic reasons; thus even with
line=8033 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.585,397.903,391.486,410.178 iscore=0.08                                             :another case-marked  DP  embedded  inside them, they yield just one case feature
line=8034 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.585,385.013,391.466,397.287 iscore=0.27                                             :plus two tam features for a maximum  of three features. The only other DPs below
line=8035 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-7.6 bbox=57.585,371.629,391.517,384.32 iscore=0.19:VPa  in an embedded VP are those inﬂected for thematic case and here I predict that
line=8036 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.596,359.155,391.547,370.127 iscore=0.19                                     :one extra overt feature should be licensed: it should be possible for a DP inﬂected for
line=8037 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.646,346.204,391.457,358.479 iscore=0.12                                             :thematic case to contain one other embedded case-marked DP inside it, in addition
line=8038 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.606,333.313,391.537,345.588 iscore=0.06                 :to inﬂecting for two tam values and one of +comp or +sej. This is a very speciﬁc set
line=8039 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.606,320.363,391.527,331.336 iscore=0.33                                                                 :of conditions which would be met vanishingly rarely in discourse. Given the size of
line=8040 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.606,307.462,391.467,318.435 iscore=0.07                                                                 :the present Kayardild corpus, its absence is almost certainly an accidental gap. In
line=8041 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.606,294.512,391.497,305.484 iscore=0.23                                                                 :sum,  we do  not need  to propose any  inherently morphological constraints on
line=8042 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.606,281.611,391.447,292.583 iscore=0.14                                     :Kayardild in order to derive the observed upper limits on inﬂection. The upper limits
line=8043 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.557,268.66,391.477,279.633 iscore=0.29                                      :to inﬂection follow from  demonstrable and  inherently syntactic constraints on
line=8044 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.557,255.769,136.512,266.742 iscore=0.10                                                                 :syntactic structures.

doc_id=round-2013 page=220 block_id=220-3 bbox=57.6,223.378,271.096,236.341 label=bt 8045 8045
line=8045 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,223.378,271.096,236.341:9.4 Implications for existing formal treatments

doc_id=round-2013 page=220 block_id=220-4 bbox=57.56,74.909,391.6,216.013 label=bb 8046 8056
line=8046 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.6,204.146,391.461,216.013:Since they were ﬁrst presented in Evans (1985; 1995a) the facts of Kayardild inﬂection
line=8047 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.56,191.195,391.491,203.062 iscore=0.14               :have received attention from a number of formal theorists, including Lieber (1992),
line=8048 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.63,178.304,391.56,190.171 iscore=0.17                :Andrews   (1996), Nordlinger (1998), Kracht (2002), and  Sadler and  Nordlinger
line=8049 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.67,165.403,391.511,177.271 iscore=0.25               :(2006b). This section summarizes the implications for these studies of the reanalysis
line=8050 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.67,152.453,263.824,163.426 iscore=0.08                                     :and review of the facts of Kayardild presented here.
line=8051 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.628,139.552,391.57,151.419 iscore=0.10               :   Andrews  (1996) and  Nordlinger (1998) are both  theoretical proposals within
line=8052 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.689,126.602,391.58,138.469 iscore=0.09               :Lexical Functional Grammar  (Kaplan and Bresnan 1982), concerned with the nature
line=8053 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.689,113.711,391.57,125.578 iscore=0.17               :of operations that build grammatical structures, and Kracht (2002) is a computa-
line=8054 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.67,100.76,391.6,111.733 iscore=0.23                                        :tional study of complex morphology within DPs; all three studies refer to Kayardild
line=8055 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.67,87.859,391.59,98.832 iscore=0.23            :and provide partial analyses of its morphosyntax. For the arguments and ﬁndings of
line=8056 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.66,74.909,391.521,85.882 iscore=0.23                                       :these studies the reanalysis of Kayardild advanced here is largely benign. Although

doc_id=round-2013 page=221 block_id=221-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,130.541,633.882 label=tt 8057 8057
line=8057 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,130.541,633.882:200    Discussion

doc_id=round-2013 page=221 block_id=221-2 bbox=57.241,191.244,391.43,602.718 label=tb 8058 8089
line=8058 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,591.746,391.361,602.718                                                                                                     :the reanalysis calls for revisions of the details of these accounts, its implications for
line=8059 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,578.795,391.43,589.768 iscore=0.14                                                                                          :their fundamental  approach  are negligible, following from the fact that all three
line=8060 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,565.904,391.38,576.877 iscore=0.17                                                                                          :studies focus primarily on the relationship between multiple features marked on a
line=8061 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,552.954,391.41,563.926 iscore=0.17                                                                                          :single word and their formal association with syntactic or information structures of
line=8062 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.43,540.063,391.361,551.036 iscore=0.08                                                                                         :various sizes. The reanalysis of Kayardild presented here does not alter the basic
line=8063 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.43,527.112,391.321,540.113 iscore=0.23                                      :observation already present in Evans’ (1985; 1995a) account of Kayardild, that mul-
line=8064 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,514.212,344.578,525.184 iscore=0.17                                                             :tiple inﬂectional sufﬁxes relate to grammatical domains of various sizes.
line=8065 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=67.339,501.321,391.361,513.188 iscore=0.09                                      :   Lieber (1992) argues for a speciﬁc, formal theory of morphosyntactic representa-
line=8066 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.38,488.37,391.291,499.343 iscore=0.20                                                                                          :tions. Kayardild is cited in relation to the question of how many crucially layered (or
line=8067 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.38,475.479,391.311,488.479 iscore=0.40                                      :ordered) values of one and the same feature a word may associate with (1992:94–7).
line=8068 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.38,462.529,391.311,475.529 iscore=0.14                                                            :The language is taken to illustrate the outer bounds of complexity, since under Evans’
line=8069 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.38,449.638,391.361,461.913 iscore=0.14                                               :(1985) analysis a Kayardild word carries up to four exponents of case. The reanalysis
line=8070 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.37,436.687,391.311,449.688 iscore=0.14                                        :of Kayardild proposed here replaces Evans’ case with several features, for which no
line=8071 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.311,423.796,391.251,434.769 iscore=0.21                                                                                        :more  than two values are attested with certainty in association with any word, and
line=8072 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.311,410.846,290.768,423.846 iscore=0.21                               :thus it has no signiﬁcant repercussions for Lieber’s theory.
line=8073 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.26,397.955,391.221,409.822 iscore=0.17                                                                   :   Sadler and Nordlinger (2006b) are concerned not with the representation, but with
line=8074 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.311,385.054,391.251,396.027 iscore=0.15                                                                                        :the realization of multiple instances of features and propose  a revision to the
line=8075 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.311,372.104,391.221,383.971 iscore=0.15                                                                  :realizational theory of Paradigm  Functional  Morphology   (PFM,   Stump  2001).
line=8076 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.261,359.213,391.241,370.185 iscore=0.14                                                            :Again, Kayardild  is held to be signiﬁcant to the extent that words may associate
line=8077 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.251,346.262,391.182,359.263 iscore=0.21                                       :with multiple case features. The multiple ‘functions’ of case are taken by Sadler and
line=8078 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.281,333.371,391.201,344.344 iscore=0.21                                                                                        :Nordlinger  to exhibit identical realizations, following a statement to that effect by
line=8079 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.281,320.421,391.241,332.288 iscore=0.23                                                                  :Evans  (1995a:118). The central argument is that the existence of languages such as
line=8080 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.281,307.52,391.192,318.493 iscore=0.15                                                                                         :Kayardild  demands   a recursive component   in the realizational architecture of
line=8081 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.281,294.57,391.231,307.57 iscore=0.13:PFM.  In }2.6.7 I noted that Evans’ case does not in general have identical realization
line=8082 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.241,281.669,391.201,294.669 iscore=0.27                                                           :across its ‘functions’. As a consequence those functions cannot all be generated by the
line=8083 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.241,268.718,391.162,279.691 iscore=0.21                                                                                        :same, recursively applying component and thus the facts of Kayardild appealed to by
line=8084 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.241,255.827,391.221,266.8 iscore=0.15                                                                                          :Sadler and Nordlinger do not provide an adequate empirical basis for their proposal.
line=8085 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.241,242.927,391.182,253.899 iscore=0.08                                                                                        :Notwithstanding  this there are other facts of Kayardild, namely the permissibility of
line=8086 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.241,229.976,391.221,242.251 iscore=0.29                                                                    :multiple values of (my features) case, tama, tamt, and number in association with a
line=8087 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.261,217.085,391.182,228.058 iscore=0.14                                                                                        :single word which  could occupy  an equivalent place in a revised argument. The
line=8088 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.261,204.135,391.231,215.107 iscore=0.31                                                                                        :conclusions from such an argument  would be empirically valid and be equivalent to
line=8089 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.261,191.244,223.941,203.811 iscore=0.08                                         :those of Sadler and Nordlinger (2006b).16

doc_id=round-2013 page=222 block_id=222-2 bbox=57.52,397.946,391.62,603.613 label=b 8097 8111
line=8097 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.531,603.613                                                                                          :predicates (Dench and  Evans 1988; Evans 1995a), or for person (Evans 2003). Each
line=8098 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.56,578.795,391.531,589.768 iscore=0.15                                                                       :inﬂectional phenomenon   is sufﬁciently accounted for in terms of the non-surface
line=8099 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.58,565.904,391.431,578.904 iscore=0.20                             :syntax, antagonism, and concord set out in Chapters 5–8. In }9.2 it was argued that
line=8100 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.58,552.954,391.441,565.954 iscore=0.13:the analysis of tam inﬂection in Chapters 5–8 is more parsimonious than in Evans
line=8101 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.53,540.063,391.471,551.93 iscore=0.14                                                                              :(1995a), requiring few features, fewer combinations of features in association with
line=8102 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.52,527.112,391.431,538.085 iscore=0.18                                                                                                   :individual clauses, and simpler statements of the conditioning factors according to
line=8103 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.52,514.212,391.431,526.486 iscore=0.21                                                                               :which  the various features are overtly realized. It was also argued that thematic case
line=8104 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.52,501.321,391.421,512.293 iscore=0.07                                                                       :markers  are not verbal and thus that inﬂection in Kayardild does not involve any
line=8105 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.57,488.37,391.451,501.37 iscore=0.29   :conversion of ‘morphological word class’. In }9.3 I identiﬁed a small set of question-
line=8106 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.62,475.479,391.531,486.452 iscore=0.20                                                                                                   :able data and argued that once it is recognized as such, the attested combinations of
line=8107 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.62,462.529,391.521,473.501 iscore=0.13                                                                       :inﬂectional features in Kayardild words is rather constrained. Pursuing this further, it
line=8108 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.62,449.638,391.57,462.638 iscore=0.29                                                                       :was argued  that there is no cause to believe that Kayardild’s syntactic structures are
line=8109 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.68,436.687,391.56,448.555 iscore=0.14                                                                              :constrained by the limitations of its realizational morphology (Evans 1995b; Evans
line=8110 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.65,423.796,391.531,435.664 iscore=0.18                                                                             :and Levinson 2009). A morphological account (Evans 1995b) both overgenerates and
line=8111 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJOA+AdvP4C4E74-12.0 bbox=57.68,397.946,391.62,421.819 iscore=0.15                                                                             :undergeneratesof inherently syntacticwhereasuppera goodboundscoverageon theof theembeddingdata is obtainedof S00, VPby, andpostulatingDP. a set

doc_id=round-2013 page=223 block_id=223-1 bbox=93.23,511.683,160.245,585.338 label=t 8112 8113
line=8112 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.23,563.391,112.275,585.338           :     10
line=8113 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-21.9 bbox=93.23,511.683,160.245,533.63 iscore=1.00:     Particles

doc_id=round-2013 page=223 block_id=223-2 bbox=57.38,294.587,391.545,473.518 label=bt 8114 8127
line=8114 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.43,462.546,391.311,473.518                                                    :The  past several chapters have accounted for how words in Kayardild inﬂect. This
line=8115 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.38,449.655,391.311,460.627 iscore=0.19                                        :chapter turns to a class of Kayardild words which  do not inﬂect at all. The class
line=8116 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.43,436.704,391.39,447.756 iscore=0.25               :of particles is distinguished not only by a lack of inﬂection, but by a tight regulation
line=8117 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.41,423.813,391.4,435.681 iscore=0.25                                                :of surface word  order. Particles are analysed here as special clitics (Zwicky 1977;
line=8118 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.47,410.863,391.41,422.73 iscore=0.38                                                :Anderson  2005) which  align with the edges of surface syntactic constituents, namely
line=8119 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.47,397.962,391.41,408.935 iscore=0.23                                                                     :clauses and DPs.  The  alignment behaviour  of particles and its correlation with a
line=8120 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.47,385.071,391.351,396.044 iscore=0.14                                        :lack of inﬂection is a new observation. I assume that the empirical facts presented
line=8121 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.47,372.121,391.321,383.093 iscore=0.21                                                                    :below  could be  formalized in an alignment-based  framework   such as Anderson
line=8122 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.47,359.23,391.5,372.23 iscore=0.31                     :(2005) although I do not present that formalization here (but see Round 2009:607–31
line=8123 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.47,346.279,391.545,358.176 iscore=0.25                           :for this approach). True particles are covered in }10.1 after which }10.2 discusses a set of
line=8124 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.46,333.378,391.46,345.246 iscore=0.12                                               :semantically particle-like constituents analysed as particles in Evans (1995a) but
line=8125 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.49,320.428,391.47,331.401 iscore=0.07                                                                     :which  are treated here as DPs. Roots which function as both particles and (particle-
line=8126 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.49,307.537,391.46,319.434 iscore=0.29:like) non-particles are mentioned in }10.3. For further exempliﬁcation see also Evans
line=8127 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.48,294.587,142.399,307.587 iscore=0.08                 :(1995a:378–89, 394–6).

doc_id=round-2013 page=223 block_id=223-3 bbox=57.43,262.078,140.924,275.041 label=bbt 8128 8128
line=8128 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.43,262.078,140.924,275.041:10.1 True  particles

doc_id=round-2013 page=223 block_id=223-4 bbox=57.291,100.818,391.361,255.946 label=bbb 8129 8140
line=8129 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.43,242.946,391.291,255.946                                                               :True  particles are not present in Kayardild’s non-surface syntactic representation.
line=8130 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,229.995,391.331,240.968 iscore=0.10                                                                                :Consequently  they cannot  inherit morphosyntactic features by percolation and so
line=8131 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.39,217.104,391.351,228.077 iscore=0.07                                                    :never inﬂect. Instead I analyse them as being introduced into the surface syntax as
line=8132 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,204.154,391.361,215.126 iscore=0.21                                                                                :special clitics, where they align with the edges of other constituents, namely clauses
line=8133 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.39,191.253,93.767,202.226 iscore=0.08                                                                                 :and DPs.
line=8134 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=67.349,178.302,391.291,190.17 iscore=0.00                                                          :   Particles which align with an edge of a clause are listed in Table 10.1. Those which
line=8135 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.291,165.402,241.401,176.374 iscore=0.06                                                                               :have more  than one function carry subscripts.
line=8136 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.25,152.451,391.211,163.424 iscore=0.12                                                                                :   Most particles which align with a clause edge align to the left, and those that do can
line=8137 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.291,139.56,391.201,150.533 iscore=0.12                                                                                :be assigned a rank which expresses the priority with which they appear at the very
line=8138 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.291,126.669,391.251,137.642 iscore=0.20                                                   :edge of the clause in cases where more than one particle appears. The signiﬁcance
line=8139 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.341,113.719,391.321,126.719 iscore=0.20                                                  :of the ‘last’ rank will be discussed further below. Examples of left edge alignments of
line=8140 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.331,100.818,292.746,113.818 iscore=0.20:particles at ranks ‘ﬁrst’ and ‘second’ appear in (10.1)–(10.5).

line=8603 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,425.795,391.481,436.768 iscore=0.25                                                                         :an assumption  that between the morphosyntactic representation of a word and its
line=8604 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,412.904,391.451,423.877 iscore=0.17                                                                         :underlying phonological representation there exists another, morphomic representa-
line=8605 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9 bbox=57.6,399.954,391.55,412.447 iscore=0.13                                                    :tion. As a shorthand, it will be convenient to label these three levels � (morphosyn-
line=8606 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9 bbox=57.64,387.063,391.55,400.063 iscore=0.20:tactic), M (morphomic), and � (underlying phonological). Chapters 5–9 explored the
line=8607 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9 bbox=57.67,374.112,391.501,386.606 iscore=0.23                                                  :mapping  between syntactic structures and �. This chapter presents an analysis of the
line=8608 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9 bbox=57.6,361.212,391.441,373.705 iscore=0.20                                                   :mappings  between  �  and M,  and M  and  �. The  general nature of the analysis
line=8609 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.55,348.261,391.521,360.158 iscore=0.13                               :and  issues involved in its formalization are outlined in }11.1 and }11.2. Mappings
line=8610 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.54,335.36,391.431,347.854 iscore=0.17          :from �  to M are formalized in }11.3, and from M to � in }11.4. Allomorphy which is
line=8611 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.56,322.41,327.503,334.307 iscore=0.22                                :conditioned by surface phonological structure is formalized in }11.5.

doc_id=round-2013 page=236 block_id=236-4 bbox=57.6,289.878,322.631,302.841 label=bbt 8612 8612
line=8612 fonts=AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-12.1,AGHLBP+AdvP445C83-10.2 bbox=57.6,289.878,322.631,302.841:11.1 Mappings between levels in constraint-based grammar

doc_id=round-2013 page=236 block_id=236-5 bbox=57.6,89.826,391.729,281.718 label=bbb 8613 8627
line=8613 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,270.746,391.501,281.718                                                                                  :In addition to an adequate set of representational levels, we require a method of
line=8614 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,257.795,391.481,268.768 iscore=0.21                                                                      :relating representations to one another across those levels. To this end I will employ
line=8615 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,244.904,391.55,256.771 iscore=0.29                                                 :an approach  based on Optimality Theory (OT, Prince and Smolensky  2004 [1993]).
line=8616 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.66,231.954,391.54,242.926 iscore=0.13                                          :Some  of the speciﬁc assumptions of OT will be set aside but the general, constraint-
line=8617 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,219.063,391.531,230.036 iscore=0.13                                                                     :based architecture of the grammar is essentially the same. The basic elements of the
line=8618 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.65,206.112,391.521,218.009 iscore=0.14                            :constraint-based approach  are covered in }11.1 and the reader who is well versed
line=8619 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.68,193.212,391.58,204.184 iscore=0.18                                                                      :in Optimality Theory may  wish to glance at the list of constraint types at the end of
line=8620 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.68,180.321,391.63,193.321 iscore=0.24:}11.1 and otherwise skip ahead to }11.2. In }11.2 I introduce a novel family of ‘Lexical
line=8621 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.799,167.37,391.67,180.37 iscore=0.31                                          :Grounding’  constraints which robustly provide for mappings across representational
line=8622 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.799,154.469,391.729,165.442 iscore=0.22                                                                    :levels whose  constitutive elements (such as features, morphomes,  phonological
line=8623 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.799,141.519,214.746,152.491 iscore=0.22                                                                    :strings) are different from one another.
line=8624 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.758,128.618,391.69,139.591 iscore=0.00                                                                     :   A constraint-based grammar  is divided into one or more levels, at each of which
line=8625 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.799,115.667,391.699,126.72 iscore=0.29                                           :one  representation, the input, is mapped to another, the output. The mapping is
line=8626 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.829,102.777,391.67,113.829 iscore=0.31                                           :achieved via the selection, given an input, of an optimal output candidate, chosen
line=8627 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,89.826,200.095,100.799 iscore=0.15                                                                     :from  amongst a large candidate set.

doc_id=round-2013 page=237 block_id=237-1 bbox=57.43,621.417,263.683,633.882 label=t 8628 8628
line=8628 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8 bbox=57.43,621.417,263.683,633.882:216    Constraint-based realizational morphology

doc_id=round-2013 page=237 block_id=237-2 bbox=57.421,217.085,391.59,602.718 label=btt 8629 8658
line=8629 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.38,591.746,391.362,602.718                                                                      :   The process of selecting an optimal output candidate is fundamentally compara-
line=8630 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.421,578.795,391.372,589.768 iscore=0.00                                                         :tive. Each candidate is evaluated in terms of its possession of desirable traits and the
line=8631 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.421,565.904,391.401,576.956 iscore=0.33                               :candidate  which performs  better than all others is the winning candidate.  The
line=8632 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.451,552.954,391.362,563.926 iscore=0.21                                                         :desirable traits may be expressed purely in terms of the output candidate itself (for
line=8633 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.451,540.063,391.431,553.063 iscore=0.27:example, ‘the output must not contain the sequence AB’) or they may be expressed in
line=8634 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.491,527.112,391.431,540.113 iscore=0.19:terms of both the output candidate and the input (for example, ‘the element C in the
line=8635 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.521,514.212,391.54,527.212 iscore=0.25 :input must  have a realization D in the output’). Such demands on candidates are
line=8636 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.53,501.321,391.381,512.373 iscore=0.29                                :formalized in terms of constraints. All constraints are expressed in absolute terms,
line=8637 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.54,488.37,391.451,501.37 iscore=0.20   :for example  ‘x has property p’ and not ‘x prefers/tends to have property p’, and
line=8638 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.56,475.479,391.59,486.531 iscore=0.20                                 :candidates are evaluated in terms of whether they satisfy each constraint or violate it,
line=8639 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.57,462.529,391.471,473.501 iscore=0.12                                                          :and  if they violate it, to what degree. This gives us in effect a large array with
line=8640 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.57,449.638,391.501,460.611 iscore=0.18                              :constraints along one dimension, candidates along another, and cells ﬁlled with the
line=8641 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,436.687,249.333,447.66 iscore=0.17                                                           :evaluation of each candidate by each constraint.
line=8642 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=67.519,423.796,391.511,434.849 iscore=0.07                               :   Constraints are ranked with respect to one another. This ranking is crucial to the
line=8643 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.58,410.846,391.55,421.898 iscore=0.27                                 :process of selecting a winning candidate. First we can note that given a ranking of
line=8644 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0 bbox=57.54,397.955,391.431,408.928 iscore=0.19                              :constraints, it is possible to take any pair of candidates, a and b, and to determine
line=8645 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.53,385.054,391.491,396.106 iscore=0.18    :which  (if either) is more harmonic that the other: a is more harmonic than b if it
line=8646 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.501,372.104,391.461,383.076 iscore=0.18                             :better satisﬁes the highest ranking constraint which evaluates the two differently. As
line=8647 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,359.213,391.391,370.185 iscore=0.33                                                         :such, a pair of candidates will always be distinguished into a more harmonic and less
line=8648 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,346.262,391.451,357.235 iscore=0.13                                                         :harmonic  member   unless every last constraint evaluates both candidates identically.
line=8649 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.46,333.371,391.481,344.344 iscore=0.21                                                          :   In the overall selection of an output, the winning output candidate is simply that
line=8650 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,320.421,391.521,331.394 iscore=0.21                                                         :candidate which, in each  of its pairwise comparisons with all other candidates, is
line=8651 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.501,307.52,391.501,320.52 iscore=0.54                              :always the more harmonic. Given that the relationship ‘more harmonic than’ depends
line=8652 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,294.57,391.461,305.542 iscore=0.13                                                           :crucially on the ranking of constraints, it follows that the ranking of constraints plays a
line=8653 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.56,281.669,336.528,292.641 iscore=0.20                                                          :crucial role in selecting the winning candidate, that is, the output form.
line=8654 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=67.519,268.718,391.511,281.718 iscore=0.17                            :   The standard  tool for visualizing candidates’ evaluations by a given ranking of
line=8655 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.511,255.827,391.421,266.88 iscore=0.13                                :constraints is the tableau. The tableaux to be used here are of the comparative type
line=8656 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,242.927,391.521,254.794 iscore=0.27                                    :(Prince 2002), which possess a number of advantages over earlier tableau formats in
line=8657 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.54,229.976,391.511,240.949 iscore=0.29                                                          :terms of the clarity with which they present information that is most pertinent to
line=8658 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.54,217.085,363.801,228.952 iscore=0.21                                    :arguments  about constraint ranking. A schematic example is shown in (11.1).

doc_id=round-2013 page=238 block_id=238-1 bbox=122.5,621.417,391.664,633.987 label=t 8677 8677
line=8677 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.5,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.8,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.9 bbox=122.5,621.417,391.664,633.987:               11.1 Mappings between levels in constraint-based grammar  217

doc_id=round-2013 page=238 block_id=238-2 bbox=57.6,358.397,391.69,603.613 label=bttt 8678 8696
line=8678 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,591.746,391.54,603.613                                                                                  :crucially ranked with respect to one another are separated by a dashed line (11.1b).
line=8679 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.68,578.795,391.56,590.662 iscore=0.14                                                                     :Candidates  are arrayed in rows (11.1c). The winning candidate (11.1d) is set above all
line=8680 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGKEKF+AdvP6658-9.4 bbox=57.64,565.904,391.531,578.904 iscore=0.29                                         :others, with a ‘+’ symbol  pointing to it. The input is placed in the top, left hand
line=8681 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.64,552.954,391.63,564.821 iscore=0.12                                                                     :corner (11.1e). Individual evaluations, measured in terms of the number of violations of
line=8682 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.64,540.063,391.63,551.036 iscore=0.12                                                                                           :a constraint which a candidate incurs, are placed in the cells of the table as subscripted
line=8683 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.64,527.112,391.6,538.98 iscore=0.19                                           :roman  numerals (11.1f); if a candidate fully satisﬁes a constraint no numeral is entered.
line=8684 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.689,514.212,391.69,525.184 iscore=0.14                                                                                          :On  the row corresponding  to any losing candidate the comparative performance of
line=8685 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.689,501.311,391.66,512.283 iscore=0.15                                                                                          :that candidate against the winner  is shown  in the appropriate column   for each
line=8686 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.689,488.36,391.66,501.36 iscore=0.23                                   :constraint: ‘W’ indicates that the winner better satisﬁes the constraint in question, ‘L’
line=8687 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,475.459,372.169,486.432 iscore=0.08                                                                                         :indicates that the loser does so, and blank indicates that neither performs better.
line=8688 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.688,462.509,391.6,473.482 iscore=0.15                                                                                           :   The distribution of Ws and Ls in a comparative tableau highlights the relevance
line=8689 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,449.608,391.65,460.581 iscore=0.08                                                                                          :possessed  by individual losing candidates for the ranking of various constraints.
line=8690 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,436.658,391.59,447.63 iscore=0.25                                                                                           :Recall that in each pairwise comparison the winning  candidate must  better satisfy
line=8691 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,423.767,391.62,434.739 iscore=0.17                                                                                          :the  highest ranking  constraint which  distinguishes it from another  candidate.
line=8692 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.729,410.816,391.557,421.789 iscore=0.19                                                                                         :In terms of the tableau this means that the leftmost unequal comparison (i.e. W or L)
line=8693 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.729,397.925,391.67,410.925 iscore=0.31                                                             :in every loser’s row must be W—this   corresponds  to the winner  better satisfying
line=8694 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.759,385.024,391.68,395.997 iscore=0.31                                                                                          :the highest ranking constraint which distinguishes it from the loser. For example,
line=8695 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-6.2,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.759,371.297,391.458,384.349 iscore=0.23:in tableau (11.2), the comparative evaluation of cand2 shows that constraint CB must
line=8696 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3 bbox=57.627,358.397,148.367,370.218 iscore=0.08                                                                :outrank  constraint CC.

doc_id=round-2013 page=238 block_id=238-3 bbox=57.634,285.984,223.158,348.71 label=bttb 8697 8700
