doc_id=round-2013 page=238 block_id=238-4 bbox=57.471,160.56,391.531,274.918 label=btb 8701 8709
line=8701 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,263.946,391.531,274.918                                         :In terms  of their ranking, constraints can be divided into those which are never
line=8702 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.6,251.045,391.441,262.097 iscore=0.07   :violated by winning  output  candidates, termed undominated   constraints on the
line=8703 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.57,238.094,391.461,249.067 iscore=0.17                            :assumption  that no other constraint crucially dominates them; and those which are
line=8704 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.57,225.194,391.471,236.166 iscore=0.25                            :crucially dominated and  therefore violated by at least some winning candidates, in
line=8705 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.57,212.243,391.451,223.216 iscore=0.29:order that a higher ranking constraint be satisﬁed. In addition to their appearance in
line=8706 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.56,199.352,391.431,211.219 iscore=0.29      :tableaux, constraint rankings can be displayed linearly as illustrated in (11.3), or as
line=8707 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.471,186.402,391.401,197.374 iscore=0.23                           :a Hasse  diagram (a standard visualization tool used to represent partially ordered
line=8708 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.471,173.511,391.371,185.378 iscore=0.13     :sets), as illustrated in Figure 11.1, where any two constraints joined by a vertex are
line=8709 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,160.56,272.203,171.533 iscore=0.13                            :crucially ranked, and the uppermost is ranked higher.

doc_id=round-2013 page=239 block_id=239-3 bbox=57.288,153.367,391.45,487.398 label=tb 8720 8744
line=8720 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=57.43,476.346,391.311,487.398                                                        :the Optimality Theoretic notion of correspondence will be used to ensure technically
line=8721 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.42,463.445,391.361,474.418 iscore=0.33                                                                      :that the correct elements are compared with one another. According to correspond-
line=8722 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.42,450.544,391.44,462.411 iscore=0.13                                                 :ence theory (McCarthy and  Prince 1999) a pair of elements in the input and output
line=8723 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.49,437.594,391.37,448.566 iscore=0.27                                                                       :may  stand in correspondence with one another, or not. Constraints can then evaluate
line=8724 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.49,424.693,391.37,435.665 iscore=0.23                                                                       :matters such as whether  a given element possesses a correspondent, or how  an
line=8725 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.49,411.742,391.45,422.715 iscore=0.23                                                                       :element  compares  to its correspondent in some  respect. For example, what  is
line=8726 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.49,398.841,391.45,411.842 iscore=0.21                                          :traditionally termed ‘deletion’ can be regarded as a case in which an input element
line=8727 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.47,385.891,391.39,396.863 iscore=0.14                                                                       :lacks a correspondent in the output. Constraints may refer to output elements in and
line=8728 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.47,373.0,391.361,383.973 iscore=0.07                                                                        :of themselves; to the pairing of input and output elements that are in correspond-
line=8729 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.47,360.049,391.321,371.022 iscore=0.14                                          :ence; or to classes of output elements deﬁned in terms of their corresponding inputs.
line=8730 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHJOA+AdvP4C4E74-12.0 bbox=57.46,334.258,391.4,359.433 iscore=0.21:Anwhichexamplewill beofwrittenthe latteras tamawould0, withbe thetheclassprimeof morphomessymbol indicatingwhich‘realizationrealizes tamaof ’.,
line=8731 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.427,321.395,249.379,332.368 iscore=0.20                                                                     :Four types of constraint will be used, as follows.
line=8732 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=67.386,308.446,391.317,321.011 iscore=0.00                  :   Wellformedness constraints express demands in terms of outputs.1 Typically they
line=8733 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.407,295.495,391.367,306.468 iscore=0.27                                                                     :are formulated as prohibitions on certain structures. For example the constraint
line=8734 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGKEPF+AdvOT1ef757c0+03-10.5 bbox=57.407,282.604,391.377,295.704 iscore=0.14                    :*μloc>μinst  states that the output of the ΣM grammar  may  not contain a μloc
line=8735 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.387,269.654,231.071,281.928 iscore=0.14                                                 :morphome   immediately followed by μinst.
line=8736 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=67.296,256.753,391.258,267.805 iscore=0.08                                           :   Alignment constraints demand that the right or left edges of certain constituents
line=8737 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHPFD+AdvP7627-9.4 bbox=57.347,243.802,391.248,256.077 iscore=0.00                             :align with one another. For example, the constraint RL-Align(μobl,t) demands that
line=8738 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.307,230.912,325.939,243.186 iscore=0.21                                                 :the right edge of μobl align with the left edge of the termination t.
line=8739 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=67.246,217.961,391.208,229.013 iscore=0.00                                           :  Faithfulness constraints directly evaluate correspondences. For example the con-
line=8740 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.288,205.07,391.188,217.345 iscore=0.00                                                  :straint Maximality demands  that input elements have corresponding outputs, while
line=8741 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.288,192.169,347.019,204.444 iscore=0.10                                                 :Dependency   demands  that output elements have corresponding inputs.
line=8742 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKKA+AdvOT5e4d79fc-11.0 bbox=67.246,179.219,391.268,190.271 iscore=0.15               :  The  ﬁnal constraint type, which I call Lexical Grounding, is a novel proposal
line=8743 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.337,166.318,391.337,177.291 iscore=0.08                                                                     :which allows correspondences to be evaluated indirectly via reference to a lexicon of
line=8744 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.337,153.367,147.275,166.368 iscore=0.15                                        :input–output pairings.

line=9452 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-5.9,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=65.4,84.837,391.424,94.939:   8 Actually the same issue arises even where there is just one correspondence in the lexicon and we wish
line=9453 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.427,75.391,296.259,84.169 iscore=0.11           :to penalize its being used to realize the same feature value more than once.

doc_id=round-2013 page=260 block_id=260-5 bbox=57.481,173.344,391.67,524.312 label=bt 9460 9486
line=9460 fonts=AGHJHL+AdvOT7d6df7ab.I-11.0,AGHLFA+AdvP48E56A-9.4 bbox=57.6,512.346,127.819,524.312                                                                        :11.3.7 Allomorphy
line=9461 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.61,496.453,391.55,508.728 iscore=0.08                                                                :The primary morphomes   μcons, μprop, and μabl have strong and weak allomorphs
line=9462 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.67,483.503,391.6,495.4 iscore=0.33                                              :(}2.5). Sometimes the phonology determines which is used. A formalization of that
line=9463 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.66,470.612,391.56,482.509 iscore=0.14                                           :process is covered in }11.5 below, and what it requires is that the morphology
line=9464 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,457.661,391.521,468.634 iscore=0.21                                                                                   :sometimes  passes to the phonology just one allomorph, the strong allomorph, and
line=9465 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,444.76,391.58,455.733 iscore=0.15                                                                                     :other times it passes to the phonology both allomorphs, between which the phonology
line=9466 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,431.81,391.67,442.783 iscore=0.23                                                                                     :chooses. The morphology, therefore, is not concerned so much with strong and weak
line=9467 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,418.919,391.58,429.892 iscore=0.27                                                                                    :allomorphs as it is with the number of allomorphs which the phonology will be given
line=9468 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.65,405.969,391.64,416.941 iscore=0.19                                                                                    :to choose from: one or two. This will be formalized in terms of an allomorphy feature:
line=9469 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.65,393.078,391.65,406.078 iscore=0.12                                                       :[+A] for a choice between two allomorphs and [–A] for just one (which will always be
line=9470 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.66,380.187,391.66,391.159 iscore=0.19                                                                                    :the strong allomorph). In glosses the [+A] value is denoted here, as throughout the
line=9471 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.66,367.236,362.986,379.511 iscore=0.19                                   :book, by a double acute accent over the μ preﬁx of a morphome, as in μcons.
line=9472 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=67.519,354.345,391.491,366.62 iscore=0.13                                                               :   The feature values case:proprietive and case:ablative are realized with [+A]
line=9473 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.54,341.395,391.481,353.67 iscore=0.42                                                                :morphomes,   as μprop and  μloc>μabl  respectively, when they appear in a word
line=9474 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.57,328.504,391.481,341.504 iscore=0.17                                  :immediately before the termination t, but with [–A] morphomes elsewhere. This will
line=9475 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.511,315.553,391.441,327.421 iscore=0.23                                                            :be formalized by positing multiple lexical correspondences as shown in Table 11.3 in
line=9476 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.481,302.653,391.401,315.653 iscore=0.08                                                     :conjunction with  constraints which demand  morphomes   to be  [–A] under  the
line=9477 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.501,289.702,391.391,300.675 iscore=0.18                                                                                  :necessary conditions. In the lexicon, the correspondences involving [+A] mor-
line=9478 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4 bbox=57.501,276.801,292.478,289.802 iscore=0.10                                                     :phomes  are marked as prioritized (shown with a carat ‘^’).
line=9479 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=67.45,263.851,391.501,276.125 iscore=0.18                                                               :   Taking the example of the proprietive case, the constraint RL-Align(μ,t) will
line=9480 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.55,250.96,391.431,261.933 iscore=0.21                                                                                    :demand  that if a [+A] morphome appears in the output, it must immediately precede
line=9481 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.55,238.069,391.411,250.562 iscore=0.14:t. As discussed in }11.2, the constraint LexPrior-�M is violated if a lexical corres-
line=9482 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-10.4,AGHKAB+AdvP4C4E59-9.9 bbox=57.55,225.119,391.511,238.119 iscore=0.14            :pondence  is used which is unprioritized; as always Lex-�M is violated if an input–
line=9483 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.56,212.218,391.471,224.085 iscore=0.29                                                             :output correspondence  is not identical to one listed in the lexicon. Tableau (11.43)
line=9484 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1 bbox=57.491,199.195,391.486,211.47 iscore=0.08                                   :now  shows the derivation of a stem inﬂected for case:proprietive. The realization of

doc_id=round-2013 page=270 block_id=270-2 bbox=57.6,584.278,287.84,597.241 label=tbt 9798 9798

doc_id=round-2013 page=270 block_id=270-3 bbox=57.539,242.094,391.593,576.118 label=tbb 9799 9824
line=9799 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,565.146,391.531,576.118                                                                                  :Generative phonologists  have recognized for several decades that phonologically
line=9800 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.6,552.195,391.481,563.168 iscore=0.27                                                                      :conditioned allomorphy  can be sensitive not only to underlying phonological struc-
line=9801 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.6,539.294,391.461,551.162 iscore=0.29                                                :ture but to derived structure as well (Anderson 1975, 2008; Carstairs 1988, 1998; Wolf
line=9802 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.55,526.344,391.511,537.316 iscore=0.14                                                                     :forthc.). There are several cases in Kayardild in which  the conditions driving
line=9803 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.55,513.453,391.451,524.426 iscore=0.25                                                                     :allomorphy  are found  not in the underlying phonological form (as addressed in
line=9804 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3,AGHJMP+AdvOT1ef757c0+fb-7.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-11.4 bbox=57.55,500.502,391.501,512.399 iscore=0.13:}11.4 above) but at the surface. Speciﬁcally, they are driven by the avoidance of surface
line=9805 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGKEPF+AdvOT1ef757c0+03-7.0 bbox=57.56,487.546,391.532,498.584 iscore=0.27                                         :sequences of two identical short vowels, VαVα, followed either by a third vowel (V) or
line=9806 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-7.3,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.602,473.797,391.513,486.87 iscore=0.20  :by  a semivowel  (S). They are summarized  in Table 11.6, where tV refers to the
line=9807 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.632,461.755,286.856,472.727 iscore=0.20                                                                    :allomorphs  of the termination that appear after vowels.
line=9808 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.671,448.804,391.593,459.777 iscore=0.08                                                                    :   These patterns will be formalized as follows. In the phonology of Kayardild there
line=9809 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.712,435.903,391.583,446.876 iscore=0.38                                                                    :is an unviolated constraint against surface strings in which two identical short
line=9810 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGKEPF+AdvOT1ef757c0+03-7.0 bbox=57.712,422.946,391.445,433.975 iscore=0.14                                        :vowels are followed by another vowel, which we can call *VαVαV. It drives several
line=9811 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-9.3 bbox=57.584,409.995,391.525,421.862 iscore=0.14                                              :phonological alternations (Round  2009) and  importantly here, it plays a role of
line=9812 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGKEPF+AdvOT1ef757c0+03-7.0 bbox=57.644,397.094,391.589,408.118 iscore=0.17                                        :allomorph  selection. Another constraint *VαVαS penalizes candidates containing two
line=9813 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGKEPF+AdvOT1ef757c0+03-7.0 bbox=57.539,384.146,391.532,395.168 iscore=0.08                                        :short vowels followed by a semivowel. Aside from allomorph selection *VαVαS plays
line=9814 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.581,371.255,391.571,382.227 iscore=0.29                                                                    :no visible role in Kayardild phonology and is ranked lower than all other phonological
line=9815 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.581,358.304,391.442,369.277 iscore=0.21                                                                    :constraints. A second low-ranked constraint can be dubbed  *μμaa. This penalizes
line=9816 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.581,345.403,391.561,356.376 iscore=0.07                                                                    :output candidates containing a string /aa/ which is preceded by any string of two or
line=9817 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.581,332.453,391.462,343.426 iscore=0.13                                                                    :more  morae (where short vowels are one mora and long vowels two; consonants are
line=9818 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.581,319.562,109.165,330.535 iscore=0.07                                                                    :non-moraic).
line=9819 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=67.54,306.661,391.492,317.634 iscore=0.00                                                                     :   Phonological allomorph selection in Kayardild will be analysed here in terms of
line=9820 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.581,293.711,391.512,305.985 iscore=0.17                                                :these three wellformedness constraints in addition to Priority constraints which
line=9821 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.671,280.81,391.512,291.783 iscore=0.30                                                                     :penalize the realization of non-prioritized allomorphs. Each allomorph set requires
line=9822 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-6.6,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-9.8 bbox=57.671,267.859,391.567,280.134 iscore=0.18                            :its own Prior  constraint which I will label Prior-μprop, Prior-μabl, Prior-tv.
line=9823 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.636,255.045,391.577,266.018 iscore=0.13                                                                    :The  constraints which drive the bulk of the phonology will not be of concern here,
line=9824 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-11.0 bbox=57.636,242.094,391.537,253.067 iscore=0.40                                                                    :and thus output candidates will only be considered which obey the general rules of

doc_id=round-2013 page=270 block_id=270-4 bbox=57.6,204.449,391.464,216.713 label=bt 9825 9825

line=9992 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9 bbox=57.43,467.473,391.459,477.293 iscore=0.07                                                   :to verbal(izing) case. The few instances where Evans adnominal or (non-verbalizing) relational case

line=9994 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4 bbox=57.374,448.582,88.351,458.075 iscore=0.05                                                 :Table A.2.

line=9996 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4 bbox=57.454,429.746,391.436,440.146 iscore=0.17:verbalizing  case and thematic case values are shown in Table A.3. The approach has been to retain Evans’
line=9997 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9 bbox=57.51,420.3,391.571,430.12 iscore=0.25                                                      :case label, but to discontinue the use of the adjective verbalizing . Where this would lead to two case values

line=9999 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9 bbox=57.541,401.409,391.507,411.228 iscore=0.11                                                  :the verbalizing/thematic case value based on semantics. Note that two of Evans verbalizing cases each

line=10001 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJGK+AdvP94BD-7.9,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.5 bbox=57.581,382.517,390.418,392.336 iscore=0.05                           :purposes of the grammar (Evans 1995a:171 5). Accordingly they are assigned to separate case values here.

line=10149 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKO+AdvOT1ef757c0+20-8.4 bbox=57.414,465.036,391.42,475.436 iscore=0.26                                                     :dominating  DP node  which is also the daughter of VP. The determinant of that DP’s position is usually

line=10151 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=57.486,446.145,391.523,454.922 iscore=0.25                                                                                :accommodate   this the subsections below are organized according to DPs roles or according to the head

line=10153 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-6.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-9.1 bbox=57.525,426.903,391.446,436.774 iscore=0.21                      :daughters of VPb or as complements of V (cf }5.5); }B.2 presents other DP daughters of VPb; }B.3 provides
line=10154 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-6.1 bbox=57.408,417.403,391.333,426.634 iscore=0.26                                                              :data for DPs  for which the evidence is ambiguous,  and which  could be daughters of VPb  or VPg;
line=10155 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.4,AGHJKN+AdvP40C64E-7.5,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-6.1,AGHKIA+AdvPi1-9.1 bbox=57.407,408.003,391.404,417.928 iscore=0.28:}B.4 presents DP daughters of VPg; }B.5 presents DP daughters of VPd; }B.6 presents DPs which  are

line=10157 fonts=AGHJFK+AdvOT1ef757c0-8.8 bbox=65.43,389.511,391.405,398.289 iscore=0.00                                                                                 :   Example glosses below do not display underlying phonological representation rather I insert hyphens at
